title: Basic info
body: Recalculate values – Aggregate transactions from subportfolios and convert the amounts to the portfolio currency (using the FX rate valid on the transaction date). Use this option if you have subportfolios in different currencies than the main portfolio currency.

title: Basic info
body: Custody. Choose the custody of the portfolio from the alternatives, which are defined by creating a new contact of the type Custody.

title: Basic info
body: Book entry. Define the book entry number for the portfolio.

title: Basic info
body: Currency*. Choose the default currency for the portfolios from the alternatives, which are defined by creating a new security of the type currency. The default currency of a portfolio defines the currency used when creating reports for the portfolio, and the transactions are recorded in the portfolio default currency.

title: Basic info
body: Locked. Allows you to Lock your portfolio to prevent anyone from manually adding, modifying or deleting transactions or trade orders within the portfolio. If you try to change the transaction or trade orders within a locked portfolio, you will be notified with a message: "Your portfolio is locked!". Locking a portfolio allows you to freeze your portfolio's contents from manual modifications, or for example collateralize assets by moving them to a locked sub-portfolio to prevent making modifications to the collateral.

title: Basic info
body: Even when your portfolio is locked, you can still execute trade orders that have already been marked as executable, run corporate actions, and import transactions and trade orders to your portfolio.

title: Basic info
body: Pledged. Allows you to pledge your portfolio to prevent positions in the portfolio or its sub-portfolios from being traded, moved or changed. If you try to trade with or edit the positions in a pledged portfolio or its sub-portfolios, the system shows an error message. You can unpledge the portfolio by unticking the checkbox.

title: Basic info
body: Language. Choose the language to be used in portfolio reports from the alternatives, which are defined in Preferences - Language. The default language of a portfolio is the language of its primary contact. The language chosen for a portfolio determines, which language is used in the portfolio reports when creating a report: the reports are created in the language of the portfolio. The translations for the security and transaction types to different languages are defined in Preferences - Internationalization. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish and the abbreviations defined for security and transaction types are used.

title: Basic info
body: Juridical form*. Choose the juridical form from the alternatives, which are defined in Preferences - Juridical form. The default juridical form of a portfolio is the juridical form of its primary contact. The juridical form affects the taxation of certain transactions added to the portfolios: when creating corporate actions, the tax associated with these is defined as a combination of juridical forms and tax countries of the portfolio.

title: Basic info
body: Tax country*. Choose the tax country from the alternatives, which are defined in Preferences - Countries. The default tax country of a portfolio is the tax country of its primary contact.

title: Basic info
body: Creation date. Define the creation date of the portfolio.

title: Basic info
body: Start-up date. Define the start-up date of the portfolio.

title: Basic info
body: Update date. Define the update date of the portfolio.

title: Basic info
body: Model portfolio. Choose a model portfolio for the portfolio, which is used in the portfolio rebalancing (an optional extra to FA Portfolio). When a model portfolio is linked to the portfolio, the portfolio can be rebalanced to match the model portfolio, and the system automatically creates trade orders to buy and sell securities.

title: Basic info
body: Close type. Choose the close for the portfolio: No change, Depreciation, Depreciation and refund or Market value. The close type relates to Closing a portfolio: a close type can be set to a portfolio already in the portfolio information, and used for example to check the portfolio's closing values with the Book values (closing) report.

title: Basic info
body: Accrued interest. Choose whether the accrued interest is calculated on the position level based on Transaction date (default) or based on Settlement date.

title: Basic info
body: Transaction date – the accrued interest on a position is calculated until the selected report date. If the bond is bought, the paid accrued interest of the purchase is used as the accrued interest of the position until the settlement date of the purchase.

title: Basic info
body: Settlement date – the accrued interest on a position is calculate until the settlement date. The settlement date is defined versus the selected report date using the bond's settlement date offset (if enabled), holiday calendar and business day convention. If the settlement date offset is not enabled on the bond security, the default value 0 is used.

title: Basic info
body: Transaction date, interest accrued by EOD – The accrued interest on a position is calculated until the end of day on the transaction date. The transaction date is included in the interest accrual period.

title: Basic info
body: Settlement date, interest accrued by EOD – The accrued interest on a position is calculated until the end of day on the settlement date. The settlement date is included in the interest accrual period.

title: Basic info
body: Posting date. Define a posting date.

title: Basic info
body: Posting rule. Choose the posting rules used for the portfolio from the alternatives that are defined in Preferences > Bookkeeping > Posting rule. You can add several posting rule sets to produce different kinds of postings for a portfolio (for example, postings that follow different accounting standards). For more information, see Posting-based bookkeeping in FA User guide.

title: Basic info
body: Import TWR date. The date until which Analytics+ should use pre-calculated TWR values (instead of calculating values on the fly). For more details, see File format for importing TWR.

title: Basic info
body: Price source. Choose the method to determine the close market price for the securities in the portfolio. You can use the security's close price or define a portfolio-specific priority of price sources:

title: Basic info
body: Security's Market data info tab – Use the security close price, no portfolio-specific price source is used. Security close price is picked up from the Close column in the Security window, Market data info tab.

title: Basic info
body: First available price from the price fields – For this portfolio, pick up the first available price in the Manual, Close 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5 columns in the Security window, Market data info tab (checking the column values in the order specified above).

title: Basic info
body: Define the price source order – Define the price order for this portfolio. Choose the price columns to use in the priority order. Start typing the column name in the Price source field that appears.

title: Basic info
body: Generate postings on parent level. For a subportfolio, choose if you want to generate postings for subportfolios on the parent portfolio level. This option works only for simple two-level structures when there is only one parent for several subportfolios. This option can be useful, for example, if:

title: Basic info
body: A customer has several portfolios linked to a parent portfolio.

title: Basic info
body: A fund portfolio has subportfolios (for example, linked to different strategies), and the bookkeeping is done for the whole fund.

title: Basic info
body: When selling, position valuation takes into account positions in all subportfolios. If you choose to generate postings on the parent portfolio level, make sure that transactions in all subportfolios have unique IDs: choose “Contact level” in the Contact window, Transaction no. level field.

title: Basic info
body: Tags. Choose tags from the alternatives defined in Preferences - General - Tags. Tags can be defined in three different ways:

title: Basic info
body: Grouped tags (select one): you can select one tag from each tag group, grouped in separate dropdowns. Only one tag in each tag group can be chosen. To group tags in a dropdown, defined them with a hyphen as "group - tag".

title: Basic info
body: Grouped tags (select multiple): you can select multiple tags from each tag group, grouped as separate sets of checkboxes. You can check multiple tags within each tag group. To group tags as a set of checkboxes, defined them with a colon as "group : tag".

title: Basic info
body: Individual tags: search for individual tags by typing the tag in the field and choosing the correct tag from the list below the field - all available tags are shown from the downward arrow on the keyboard. You can select multiple individual tags.

title: Accounts
body: The Accounts tab allows you to add different kinds of accounts to your portfolio. Accounts allow you to follow your portfolio's cash balance and calculate interest for your accounts. When you link transactions to an account, the system automatically keeps track of your account balance. Accounts are not required when creating a portfolio, but if you want to follow the cash balance of your portfolio or to set up portfolio credit, you need to add at least one cash account to your portfolio.

title: Accounts
body: The account at the top of the list is considered the default account of the portfolio, and all transactions are by default created against this account. If you want to create transactions against another account, you need to select it. You can modify the order of the accounts by dragging an account to the desired place in the account listing. The order of the accounts determines the order in which the accounts are shown in Overview and in reports.

title: Accounts
body: A portfolio can have one or more accounts: existing accounts are listed on the left side of the window. Add a new account with the Add account button and fill in the fields in the Basic info and Interest details tabs.

title: Basic info
body: The Basic info tab contains account information, sharing and visibility options, and calculation settings. Fields marked with * are required.

title: Basic info
body: Account no.*. The account number. This can be, for example, the bank account number.

title: Basic info
body: Currency*. The account currency. Currency options are defined in the system as securities of the type Currency.

title: Basic info
body: Name*. The name of the account.

title: Basic info
body: BIC code. The BIC code of the account.

title: Basic info
body: Issuer. The issuer of your account from contacts that are defined in the system as the Issuer type. Linking an issuer to your account allows you to keep track of who has issued the account. This is especially useful when analyzing your portfolio’s investments by the issuer when accounts and other investments are grouped similarly.

title: Basic info
body: Secondary account no. A secondary account number for the account.

title: Basic info
body: Category. The account category. When you start to type, the system automatically suggests categories you have used previously.

title: Basic info
body: Mandate reference. The mandate reference of the account.

title: Basic info
body: Decimals for transactions. The number of decimal places used for amounts in transactions created against the account. This setting applies to all transaction fields except Unit price, Coefficient, Yield, FX rates , and Amount (in non-cash transactions). If you leave this setting empty, the number of decimal places is taken from Preference → Content and translations → Date and decimal formats. The "Default" value in the drop-down means:

title: Basic info
body: For cash transactions – The number of decimal places specified in the Block size field for the currency security (for details, see Security window).

title: Basic info
body: For other transactions – The number of decimal places specified in the Block size field for the security (for details, see Security window). If the Block size field is not defined, “Default” means the number of decimal places defined in the security type settings (for details, see Security types).

title: Basic info
body: Account type. The type of the account. The different types of accounts are grouped separately within the FA Platform, for example in Overview. The available account types are:

title: Basic info
body: Cash account

title: Basic info
body: Credit account

title: Basic info
body: Other account

title: Basic info
body: Hide if balance is zero. Hides the account in Overview and Positions reports when the account balance is zero. The account is shown only when there is a non-zero balance. By default, accounts are not hidden.

title: Basic info
body: Account sharing options:

title: Basic info
body: Shared to primary contact's portfolios indicates the account is shared to all portfolios with the same primary contact. This option allows you to choose the account for transactions in other portfolios of the same contact. If portfolio A owns a shared account X and you analyze portfolio B which has transactions against account X, you do not see account X in the Overview. If you analyze both A and B or just portfolio A, you can see the shared account's information.

title: Basic info
body: Shared to all parent portfolios' subportfolios indicates the account is shared only to the parent portfolio and its sub portfolios. If subportfolio B has transactions against a shared account X that is owned by parent portfolio A, you can see account X in the Overview when analyzing A or B. If A has other subportfolios, you cannot see account X when analyzing them unless they have transactions against it.

title: Basic info
body: Shared to all linked contact's portfolios indicates the account is shared to the portfolio to which the primary contact is linked. If you add the owner of account X in the Contacts to a portfolio owned by another contact, account X is shared to that portfolio.

title: Basic info
body: By default, the sharing options are disabled. Accounts are only shared to sub portfolios of the current portfolio. You can use shared accounts when you create transactions manually or by importing. Shared accounts are used by the system when it creates transactions through corporate actions or trade order execution, and when it creates trade orders through rebalancing. The FA Platform first checks if the portfolio has its own accounts that can be used, and if not, it checks if the portfolio has shared accounts that can be used.

title: Basic info
body: Visibility (include account in reports). Indicates the account is visible in Overview and in other views, taken into account in all portfolio reports, and is available as a criterion when defining dynamic groups. Visibility is enabled as a default for all accounts. If an account is defined as not visible (i.e. hidden), the account is ignored in all calculations.

title: Basic info
body: Exclude balance from portfolio total. Indicates the account is shown in your positions but its balance is not included in the total market value (or other total values) of your portfolio. By default, accounts are not excluded from the portfolio's total. This option is useful in tracking the total capital added to an insurance contract and the profits taken out.

title: Basic info
body: Status. The account status: "Open" or "Closed". The status allows you to differentiate between active and closed accounts. You can keep track of closed accounts, for example, to remove their information after a certain time for regulatory compliance.

title: Basic info
body: Open date. The account opening date.

title: Basic info
body: Close date. The account close date. You can only set a close date after selecting "Closed" as the account status.

title: Basic info
body: Account tags. Account tags from the options defined in Preferences → General → Tags. Tags can be defined in the following ways:

title: Basic info
body: Grouped tags (select one). You can select one tag from each tag group, grouped in separate drop-downs. Only one tag in each tag group can be chosen. To group tags in a drop-down, define them with a hyphen as follows: "group - tag".

title: Basic info
body: Grouped tags (select multiple). You can select multiple tags from each tag group, grouped as separate sets of checkboxes. You can check multiple tags within each tag group. To group tags as a set of checkboxes, define them with a colon as follows: "group : tag".

title: Basic info
body: Individual tags. Search for individual tags by typing the tag in the field and choosing the correct tag from the list below the field. Use the downward keyboard arrow to view all available tags. You can select multiple individual tags.

title: Interest details
body: The Interest details tab contains account interest calculation settings.

title: Interest details
body: Base instrument. Mandatory base security for calculating accrued interest on the account. If you want to set a flat interest on the whole amount, create a new security with one price and add it as the base instrument.

title: Interest details
body: Offset days. Indicates the date for checking the price of the base instrument. You can't add a negative offset day value. Offset days are always calculated back in time.

title: Interest details
body: Calendar (day count convention). The day count used to convert dates into a numeric representation for financial maths. You need to define a calendar day convention in order to run account interest calculations.

title: Interest details
body: Transaction type. The transaction type of the interest.

title: Interest details
body: Thresholds. A feature for setting the interest rate at different levels based on the account balance. Thresholds are optional. If no thresholds are defined, the interest rate is the same regardless of the account balance. The interest rate specified for a given threshold only applies to the amount of funds in that range instead of the full account balance. For example: The account balance is 120 000€. Thresholds are set at 2% for 0-50 000€, 3% for 50 000-110 000€, and 3.5% for 110 000-200 000€. Interest is paid as follows: 2% on 0-49,999€, 3% on 50 000-109,999€, and 3,5% on 100 000-120 000€.

title: Interest details
body: To add or edit thresholds, click Edit. Remember to specify the spread for each threshold. If you have multiple thresholds and want to apply a specific spread to all values below or above a certain balance, you can leave the first Balance from and the last Balance to values empty.

title: Interest details
body: Balance from. The lower limit for the account balance at which the interest rate applies.

title: Interest details
body: Balance to. The upper limit for the account balance at which the interest rate applies.

title: Interest details
body: Spread. The spread added to the values from the base instrument as a percentage. Enter the value as a number without the percent sign.

title: Interest details
body: The last two fields are from older versions of FA Back. Don't use them for account interest calculation.

title: Interest details
body: Fixing. The annual fixing as a percentage %. Fixing can be used to calculate the account's accrued interest with a custom formula.

title: Interest details
body: Spread. The spread added to the values from the base instrument as a percentage %. Spread can be used to calculate the account's accrued interest with a custom formula.

title: Groups view
body: You can manage groups in the system in the Groups view. You can group portfolios or securities to manage them as a whole and use them for, for example, searching data, reporting, and running corporate actions. For example, you can group portfolios based on whether their owners are private or corporate customers, or based on their advisors, and you can create a group for securities that you want to allow your customers to trade.

title: Groups view
body: You can maintain two kinds of groups:

title: Groups view
body: Static group - the portfolios or securities within a group are maintained by adding and removing portfolios or securities manually.

title: Groups view
body: Dynamic group - the portfolios or securities within a dynamic group are maintained automatically by the system to always include all portfolios or securities that fulfill the dynamic criteria defined for the group.

title: Groups view
body: In addition to maintaining groups in the Groups view, you can add groups to single portfolios or securities in the Portfolio window (Portfolio groups or Security groups tab) or the Security window (Security groups tab). See Portfolio groups and Security groups).

title: Groups view
body: You can group static or dynamic groups by using a prefix or suffix in the group code with an underscore that separates the grouping code from the rest of the group code. For example, fund groups have the prefix "FAFUNDS_" in their group code.

title: Create a static group
body: To create a static group, click Add, select Static group from the drop-down menu at the top, and define the group information in the two tabs.

title: Basic info
body: Define the basic information for the group in the Basic info tab. A red star indicates a mandatory field.

title: Basic info
body: Code* – a code to identify the group and distinguish it from others.

title: Basic info
body: To create a static fund group, add the prefix "FAFUNDS_" to the group code. You can also create static fund groups in FA Fund Management (see Create fund groups in FA Fund Management reference).

title: Basic info
body: Name* – the name of the group.

title: Basic info
body: Description – an optional detailed description of the group.

title: Basic info
body: Restrict this group to be shown to roles - an option to restrict access to the group based on user role. You can restrict the list of available groups within the Group, contact, portfolio dropdown per user role:

title: Basic info
body: User roles assigned in the FA Admin Console app (for details, see User details pane).

title: Basic info
body: Underlying system-level roles marked with # before the role name.

title: Portfolios
body: Select the portfolios to include in the static group in the Portfolios tab. You can include portfolios in the group by moving them from "Available" to "Chosen". To remove portfolios, move them from the right list to the left. You can also search for portfolios in both lists using portfolio name or ID.

title: Securities
body: Select the securities to include in the static group in the Securities tab. You can include securities in the group by moving them from "Available" to "Chosen". To remove securities, move them from the right list to the left. You can also search for securities in both lists using security name, ISIN, code, or currency.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: The system automatically maintains dynamic groups so that they only contain portfolios or securities matching the criteria defined for the group.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: To create a dynamic group, click Add, select Dynamic group from the drop-down menu at the top, and define the group information (fields marked with * are required):

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Code* - a code to identify the group and distinguish it from others.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: To create a dynamic fund group, add the prefix "FAFUNDS_" to the group code. You can learn more about fund groups in Create fund groups in FA Fund Management reference.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Name* - the name of the group.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Restrict this group to be shown to roles - an option to restrict access to the group based on user role. You can restrict the list of available groups within the Group, contact, portfolio dropdown per user role:

title: Create a dynamic group
body: User roles assigned in the FA Admin Console app (for details, see User details pane).

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Underlying system-level roles marked with # before the role name.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Below the basic information, define the dynamic criteria for the group by adding criteria with the Add rule button. The available criteria are related to portfolio or security information and the primary contact's information.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Criterion - choose the criterion you want to base your rule on from the first drop-down menu.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Portfolio information: status, type, currency, language, asset manager, account, juridical, tax county, valuation method, posting rule, close type, cost type, cost formula, book-entry account number, custody, model portfolio, portfolio groups, portfolio tag, account tag, and pre-trade, post-trade and investment plan limit status.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Security information: status, type, subtype, currency, country, marketplace, settlement place, holiday calendar, issuer, class 1-5, security tag, and security profile attribute.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Primary contact's information: status, type, country, juridical, identity, classification, classification 2, classification 3, nationality, language, representative and contact tag.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Profile attribute: in addition to the fixed portfolio, security, and contact information, you can form a dynamic group based on the information saved in custom fields defined for your portfolio, security, or contact.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Include / Exclude - define if portfolios or securities are included or excluded from the group based on this criterion.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Value - define the value you want to base your criterion to include or exclude portfolios or securities from the group.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: For a criterion based on profile attributes, define a key and value pair in the two fields available. The key in the first field defines which custom field value you want to use, and the value in the second field defines which value of the custom field you want to use as the criterion.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Example of a dynamic group with "and" and "or" criteria:

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Currency - Include - EUR

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Tax country - Include - Finland

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Tax country - Include - Estonia

title: Create a dynamic group
body: → This dynamic group includes portfolios with "Currency" "EUR" AND with "Tax country" "Finland" OR "Tax country" "Estonia".

title: Create a dynamic group
body: Example of a dynamic group with profile attributes: Contact profile attribute - Include - contact.profiling.risk - Medium

title: Create a dynamic group
body: → This dynamic group relies on custom fields for contacts. This example assumes you have a custom field for "Risk" (defined with the key contact.profiling.risk) with options "Low", "Medium" and "High". The dynamic group includes portfolios of contacts with "Risk" level "Medium".

title: Create a dynamic group
body: If you do not define any criteria for a dynamic group, the group includes all portfolios or securities saved in the system.

title: Create a dynamic group
body: When you have defined the dynamic group criteria, you can save the group by clicking Save. You can also save the group and see which portfolios or securities are included in the group by clicking Save & show results.

title: Groups with limited visibility
body: You can also restrict the usage of groups for users with limited visibility - users with limited visibility can only use groups within the Group, contact, portfolio dropdown if a separate permissions GROUPS.VIEW is enabled. When disabled, users with limited visibility can see all the groups within Group, contact, portfolio dropdown - the contents of the group are always filtered according to limited visibility, ensuring the user can only see portfolios they are allowed to access (thus, some groups might show as empty for a user with limited visibility if the group contains no portfolios the user is allowed to access.

title: Groups with limited visibility
body: Users without limited visibility can always use groups Group, contact, portfolio dropdown if groups have been defined in the system.

title: Add a column based on a key figure
body: You can add custom columns based on key figures into the different search views and Analytics+. To learn how to do this, follow the instructions below.

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: You can modify the definition of an existing key figure or define a new one. The hard-coded security key figure and portfolio key figure definitions are available to view but not modify.

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: To define a new key figure, do the following:

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: Click Add new key figure.

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: Fill in the fields. For field descriptions, see Key figures in FA Back.

title: Step 1 - Configure the key figure in Preference
body: Click Save.

title: Modify key figure definitions
body: You can modify key figure definitions after saving. However, if you modify an existing key figure that already has values stored for contacts, portfolios, or securities, the values are preserved but may not be modified anymore. For example, if you change a key figure from "contact" to "portfolio", you cannot modify the key figure values for contacts.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: You can add key figure values for contacts, portfolios, or securities by entering them manually in the respective windows or by importing them.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: To add key figure values manually in FA Back, do the following:

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: Open the Key figures tab in the Contact, Portfolio, or Security window.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: On the left side of the tab, select the key figure and click Add new value.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: Define the date and value.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: Click Add.

title: Step 2 - Fill in key figure values
body: For more information about importing key figures, see File formats for importing securities and security prices and File format for importing portfolios in FA Back reference.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: To configure a key figure as an Analytics+ column, do the following:

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Open Preference → Content and translations → Analytics+ columns.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Click Add new column and fill in the fields:

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Select how you want to define the column - Select "Based on a security key figure".

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Code* - A unique code for the column. You can't change the code after saving.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Name* - Name for the column.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Description - Optional description of the column content, shown when selecting columns in Analytics+.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Link - Optional link for more information about the column, shown when selecting columns in Analytics+.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Select the security key figure you want to use as a column - Choose the key figure to link to the column from the dropdown list.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Select how to calculate values on group levels -

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Do you want to override the default formatting? Choose if you want to specify a custom formatting for the column. If you select "Yes, override formatting", you also need to specify the format.

title: Step 3 - Set up the Analytics+ column
body: Click Save.

title: Unlock contact's portfolios when LEI is entered
body: This rule removes the "LEI code missing" portfolio tag and unlocks the contact's portfolios if the contact has LEI code entered in the Contact window, MiFiR tab.

title: Unlock contact's portfolios when LEI is entered
body: Condition: LEI code is available in the contact

title: Unlock contact's portfolios when LEI is entered
body: Actions: The "LEI code missing" tag is removed from the portfolios where the contact is the primary contact, and the portfolios are unlocked.

title: Add a task type to FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor has a set of standard task types (calls, emails, letters, and meetings) you can work with, but you can also create your own task types. The following instructions describe how to create a task type in FA Developer and make it available to users in FA Advisor.

title: Step 1 - Create a form
body: Create a new form by following the instructions in Create a form. Note down the Form ID, because it is needed in the next step.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: After creating a form for the task type, you need to create a process:

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Go to Workflows → Process modeler and click Create process.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Fill in the fields for the new task type and click Create new model.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Model name. Enter a name for the task type to be displayed in FA Advisor.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Model key. Give an identifier for the task type.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: In the process editor, create a process with at least a start event, an activity (for example, user task), and an end event. To learn more about creating user tasks, see Create a contact.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Click on the activity you created and enter the Form ID from the previous step in the Form key field.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Form key. Enter the Form ID from the previous section.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Category. Enter "FAADVISOR".

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Name. Enter the task type name.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Assignments. Choose which users the task can be assigned to by clicking the field and selecting "Fixed values". In the Candidate groups field, specify user groups by user role and separate groups with a comma (see Manage access to a workflow).

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Click on the space outside the process and then on Target namespace. Enter "FAADVISOR" in the field.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: Click Save.

title: Step 2 - Create a process
body: The task type can now be included in the FA Advisor app to make it available to users.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: The final step of adding a task type is to make it available in FA Advisor:

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Go to Workflows → Process modeler → Apps and click on FA Advisor.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Open the App editor in the top right and then click Edit included models.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Select your task type to include it and click Close.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Click Save the app definition in the top left and tick the Publish? checkbox.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Click Save and close editor.

title: Step 3 - Make the task type available in FA Advisor
body: Your task type is now available in FA Advisor and can be assigned to users.

title: Create a form
body: To create a form in FA Developer app, do the following:

title: Create a form
body: Go to Workflows → Forms and click Add form in the top right.

title: Create a form
body: Add components from the list on the left and define the component properties.

title: Create a form
body: Add a Label in the Display tab to distinguish the component from others. This field is required for some components.

title: Create a form
body: Specify the Property Name in the API tab to identify the field in the collected data for the component (see Define form components to import data in FA).

title: Create a form
body: For the Content component, enclose the text in HTML tags. Form translations only work for text inside HTML tags.

title: Create a form
body: Define the form name and save the form.

title: Create a form
body: After saving the form, you can see it in the Forms view. You can now use the form in a process: see Display a form.

title: Related links
body: Workflows

title: React to changes in FA data
body: You can integrate the FA Platform with your external system to receive messages about and react to changes in FA data. This allows you to, for example, implement API calls to fetch updated information that your external system uses. To start using this functionality, contact FA.

title: React to changes in FA data
body: If you want to synchronize information about contacts, portfolios, securities, transactions, or trade orders, see Receive messages about core data type changes. If you want to synchronize information about positions or purchase lots, see Receive messages about report data calculations.

title: Receive messages about core data type changes
body: You can receive messages when contacts, portfolios, securities, transactions, or trade orders are inserted, modified, or deleted in FA. Security price updates don’t produce any notifications.

title: Receive messages about core data type changes
body: The messages are sent to a service bus topic called “data-changes” and are available for up to 7 days. The messages only indicate the data type, the action (create, update, or delete), and the object ID.

title: Receive messages about core data type changes
body: The following are example messages about changes to core data types:

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: You can receive messages when the FA system completes purchase lot or position calculations. The messages are sent to a service bus topic called "report-calculation-events" and are available for up to 7 days. The message content matches the original report data calculation request. The following is an example message about completed report data calculations:

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body:
{
 "portfolioIds": 10527961,
 "date": 1612130400000,
 "type": "LATEST",
 "name": "1631619219707-10527961",
 "group": "REPORTS-10527961",
 "description": "UpdateReportFromLatestDate-10527961",
 "key": "REPORTS-10527961.1631619219707-10527961"
}

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: The following information is relevant for your external integrations:

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: portfolioIds (Long data type). The database ID of the portfolio that was recalculated.

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: date (Unix timestamp). The date from which onward the report data calculation was done. If blank, report data was calculated from the beginning of the portfolio, or if type is "LATEST", report data calculation was only done for dates without positions.

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: type. The type of report data calculation executed. The options are:

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: LATEST. Calculated positions only starting from a given date.

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: FULL. Calculated purchase lots and positions starting from a given date.

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: FULL-ALL. Calculated purchase lots and positions starting from the beginning.

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: SUB. Calculated purchase lots only.

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: REMOVE. Removed position and purchase lot data for the given portfolio.

title: Receive messages about report data calculations
body: name. A combination of a timestamp (when the report data calculation was triggered) and the portfolio ID.

title: Define custom integrations to service bus topics
body: FA Developer allows you to gain value from the messages you receive about data changes when you define custom integrations to the service bus topics. The following is an example Camel route that prints the content of messages arriving in the “data-changes” topic:

title: Define custom integrations to service bus topics
body:
<route id="custom-data-changes-listener">
   <from uri="amqp:topic:data-changes/subscriptions/customlistener"/>
   <log message="Received message: ${body}"/>
</route>

title: Define custom integrations to service bus topics
body: In this example, the messages are simply recorded in connector microservice system logs. To synchronize FA Platform data with your external system, you can use Apache Camel (for example, REST API) to send the message content to your external system.

title: Calculate and accept NAV
body: FA Fund management app lets you calculate and accept NAV for your fund. This section includes the following information:

title: Calculate and accept NAV
body: Overview and the logic of NAV calculation:

title: Calculate and accept NAV
body: NAV formula

title: Calculate and accept NAV
body: Workflows and NAV statuses

title: Calculate and accept NAV
body: NAV calculation instructions:

title: Calculate and accept NAV
body: View and check NAV calculation

title: Calculate and accept NAV
body: Adjusting NAV:

title: Calculate and accept NAV
body: Apply swing pricing

title: Calculate NAV
body: You can calculate NAV for one or more funds in the NAV status view. You can also enable four-eyes approval of NAV to ensure that two separate users calculate and accept the NAV (see Use four-eyes approval of NAV).

title: Calculate NAV
body: To calculate NAV for one fund, do the following:

title: Calculate NAV
body: Click on a fund in the NAV status view. Make sure the fund status is "Pending NAV" or "Pending unofficial NAV".

title: Calculate NAV
body: Click Calculate NAV in the Fund details pane.

title: Calculate NAV
body: Check the calculation details and warnings (see View and check NAV calculation). You can add comments to the NAV calculation in NAV overview, Details tab.

title: Calculate NAV
body: If you need to fix the calculation, you can recalculate NAV or delete the recent calculation (see the sections below). If the calculation is correct, NAV can be accepted (see Accept NAV).

title: Calculate NAV
body: The fund status changes accordingly. You can also calculate NAV for multiple funds simultaneously by selecting the funds in the NAV status view and clicking Calculate NAV.

title: Recalculate NAV
body: If you need to correct the underlying data related, for example, to fee or trade orders after you calculated NAV:

title: Recalculate NAV
body: Make the necessary fixes.

title: Recalculate NAV
body: Select the fund in the NAV status view and click Recalculate NAV.

title: Recalculate NAV
body: You can view the calculation result in the NAV overview. For details, see View and check NAV calculation.

title: Delete NAV calculation
body: You can delete an NAV calculation, for example, if there is an error in the calculation schedule. To delete an NAV calculation, do the following:

title: Delete NAV calculation
body: In the NAV status view, double-click on the fund to open the NAV overview.

title: Delete NAV calculation
body: Click Delete calculation.

title: Delete NAV calculation
body: The NAV calculation data is deleted, and you can calculate NAV again.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: You can interrupt an ongoing NAV calculation.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: We don't recommend stopping an ongoing NAV calculation unless you are confident in what you are doing.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: To stop the NAV calculation, do the following:

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: Click on the fund in the NAV status view to open the Fund details pane.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: Click Stop calculation.

title: Stop NAV calculation in progress
body: The NAV calculation is cancelled, and the fund returns to the "Pending NAV" status.

title: Roll back failed calculation
body: You can roll back a failed NAV calculation caused by a system error. Such a situation is indicated by the fund status being "Error". To roll back a failed NAV calculation, do the following:

title: Roll back failed calculation
body: Click on the fund in the NAV status view to open the Fund details pane.

title: Roll back failed calculation
body: Click Roll back failed calculation.

title: Roll back failed calculation
body: The fund returns to the "Pending NAV" status.

title: Accept NAV
body: You can accept NAV for one or more funds in the NAV status view. If four-eyes approval of NAV is enabled, the same user who calculated NAV can't accept it (see Use four-eyes approval of NAV).

title: Accept NAV
body: To accept NAV for a single fund, do the following:

title: Accept NAV
body: Click the fund in the NAV status view. Make sure the fund status is "Calculated".

title: Accept NAV
body: Check the NAV calculation details, warnings, and comments (see View and check NAV calculation). You can add comments to the NAV acceptance in NAV overview, Details tab.

title: Accept NAV
body: Accept or reject the NAV calculation:

title: Accept NAV
body: If NAV summary is correct and no warnings need to be addressed, click Accept NAV in the Fund details pane or NAV overview, Details tab. The fund status changes to "Accepted".

title: Accept NAV
body: If fixes are needed and NAV has to be calculated again, click Reject NAV in the Fund details pane or NAV overview, Details tab.

title: Accept NAV
body: You can also accept NAV for multiple funds simultaneously by selecting the funds in the NAV status view and clicking Accept NAV.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Rolling back NAV reverts all actions performed in the acceptance:

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Deletes fee and cash transactions in the fund portfolio in FA Back.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Deletes market data observations for the share class in FA Back.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Changes the status of trade orders executed in the acceptance step to "Executable" and deletes transactions linked to them.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: If performance fee equalization is used for the fund, removes capitalization transactions, removes performance fees, removes compensation trade orders created for subscriptions, and restores compensation trade orders canceled or updated as a result of redemptions.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Updates the calculation schedule and shows the previous accepted NAV as the latest one.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Rolling back unofficial NAV does the following:

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Updates the calculation schedule and shows the previous NAV as the latest one.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: The actions performed during the rollback are logged. To view the log, click in the Fund details pane.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: You can roll back the latest accepted NAV calculation. To cancel several NAV calculations, roll them back one by one, starting with the latest:

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Double-click the fund in the NAV status view to open the NAV overview.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Click Roll back NAV.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Only the latest NAV can be rolled back. The button is only available if you select the latest NAV date at the top of the screen.

title: Roll back accepted NAV
body: Rolling back NAV can take a few moments. If you run deferrals, you need to delete them after NAV rollback, meaning delete the postings and update the schedule. After the rollback and deletion of deferrals, you can calculate NAV again.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: You can interrupt an ongoing NAV acceptance. This removes all changes made in FA Back during the acceptance, similar to Roll back accepted NAV, but the latest NAV calculation is preserved.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: To stop ongoing NAV acceptance, do the following:

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: Click the fund in the NAV status view.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: Click View progress in the Fund details pane.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: Click Stop acceptance.

title: Stop NAV acceptance in progress
body: After interrupting NAV acceptance, you can calculate NAV again.

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: You can roll back a failed NAV acceptance caused by a system error. Such a situation is indicated by the fund status being "Error". To roll back a failed NAV calculation, do the following:

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: In the NAV status view, check the Error column for the fund to see at what stage NAV acceptance was interrupted.

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: Open FA Back and remove any changes made during NAV acceptance (for example, delete the fee or cash transactions).

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: Open FA Fund Management and click on the fund in the NAV status view to open the Fund details pane.

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: Click Roll back failed acceptance.

title: Roll back failed acceptance
body: The failed acceptance is cancelled.

title: Receive fund orders
body: The Orders view shows information about fund orders created in FA Back or received from outside the FA system via a trading connector such as Fundsettle (see Set up Fundsettle trading integration in FA Admin guide).

title: Receive fund orders
body: The Orders view shows trade order information based on the transaction date. You can edit and execute fund orders in FA Back or set up trade order execution for funds so that incoming trade orders with the "Executable" status are executed when you accept NAV (see Create a fund).

title: Viewing options
body: You can:

title: Viewing options
body: View fund orders for a predefined period (today, previous 7 days, current month, previous month, current quarter, or previous quarter) or specific dates.

title: Viewing options
body: Refresh the table content by clicking at the top right.

title: Viewing options
body: Export the orders as an XLSX or CSV file.

title: Viewing options
body: For the whole table, click Export → Download as CSV/XLSX.

title: Viewing options
body: For specific rows, select orders and click Export → Download as XLSX.

title: Viewing options
body: Adjust the table (see Adjust the view) and group the table information by certain columns (click on and then Group by).

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view
body: Sort by clicking the column name.

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust table row density ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Filter the table based on column content ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Search the table with the search fields at the top of the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click and enter a name for the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click Save.

title: Adjust the view
body: The adjustments are saved as a view, including the search fields at the top. You can now:

title: Adjust the view
body: Set a saved view as the default. To do this, click the Saved views field or , and then click the star icon next to the saved view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: View order details
body: To view details for a fund order, click on a row in the list. In the side pane that opens, you can see the following information:

title: View order details
body: Fund order details: Shows the same information as the fund order list columns and the fund order execution method and reference.

title: View order details
body: Documents: Shows documents uploaded for the order, the tags applied to them, and the date and time they were last modified. You can download the documents to your computer.

title: Order information
body: Account

title: Order information
body: The fund or share account to record deposits and withdrawals. The default account used in trade orders is specified in the fund and share class settings

title: Order information
body: Cashflow (client)

title: Order information
body: The trade amount from the client's perspective. The amount on each row is summed up into a total amount shown in the last row.

title: Order information
body: Cashflow (fund)

title: Order information
body: The trade amount from the perspective of the fund. The amount on each row is summed up into a total amount shown in the last row.

title: Order information
body: Code

title: Order information
body: The share class code.

title: Order information
body: Cost 1 and 2

title: Order information
body: The cost amount.

title: Order information
body: Cost type 1 and 2

title: Order information
body: The cost types from the alternatives defined in the cost type preferences. The cost can be, for example, a credit fee or a transaction fee (see Transaction fees for a fund).

title: Order information
body: Created

title: Order information
body: The date and time when the fund order was created.

title: Order information
body: Description on statement

title: Order information
body: A description for the transactions and counter transactions that are created from the fund order.

title: Order information
body: Execution method

title: Order information
body: The fund order execution method. For more information about execution methods, see Trade order execution method in FA Back reference.

title: Order information
body: External ID

title: Order information
body: The external ID of the fund order.

title: Order information
body: Gross trade amount

title: Order information
body: The trade amount excluding costs.

title: Order information
body: ID

title: Order information
body: The database ID of the fund order in the FA system.

title: Order information
body: Internal info

title: Order information
body: A description of the transaction created by the fund order.

title: Order information
body: ISIN

title: Order information
body: The share class ISIN.

title: Order information
body: Net trade amount

title: Order information
body: The trade amount including costs.

title: Order information
body: Payment date

title: Order information
body: The payment date of the order when the payment date is different from the settlement date.

title: Order information
body: Portfolio

title: Order information
body: The name of the shareholder's portfolio.

title: Order information
body: Receive date

title: Order information
body: The date when the fund order information was received from the client.

title: Order information
body: Receive time

title: Order information
body: The time when the fund order information was received from the client.

title: Order information
body: Report FX rate

title: Order information
body: The report exchange rate or the exchange rate between the share class security currency and the shareholder portfolio currency.

title: Order information
body: Security currency

title: Order information
body: The share class currency.

title: Order information
body: Settlement date

title: Order information
body: The settlement date of the fund order (see ??? in FA Back reference).

title: Order information
body: Share class

title: Order information
body: The share class name.

title: Order information
body: Status

title: Order information
body: The status of the fund order. The status options are: Open, Accepted, Executable, Sent to execution, In execution, Partially executed in the market, Executed in the market, Settled in the market, Executed, Cancelled, Rejected, and Expired.

title: Order information
body: Tags

title: Order information
body: The tags applied to the fund order. Tags can be used to sort trade orders or adjust the trade order workflow.

title: Order information
body: Tax 1 and 2

title: Order information
body: The tax amount in the transaction. For subscriptions, taxes add the trade amount, and for redemptions, taxes reduce the trade amount.

title: Order information
body: Tax type 1 and 2

title: Order information
body: The tax types from the alternatives defined in Preference (see Preference - Taxation in FA Back reference).

title: Order information
body: Trade time

title: Order information
body: The time of the trade.

title: Order information
body: Transaction date

title: Order information
body: The transaction date. Transaction date determines when the transaction took effect.

title: Order information
body: Transaction type

title: Order information
body: Transaction type (subscription or redemption).

title: Order information
body: Unit price

title: Order information
body: Preliminary estimation of the order unit price. When the trade order is executed, the system determines the unit price based on recent NAV acceptance.

title: Order information
body: Units

title: Order information
body: Preliminary number of units in the fund order. When the trade order is executed, the actual number of units is determined.

title: View warnings
body: When you calculate NAV, FA Fund Management checks the underlying data and shows you warnings if there is anything to double-check. To view the warnings, double-click the fund in the NAV overview and open the Warnings tab.

title: NAV warnings
body: NAV warnings mean that there is something wrong with the fund or NAV calculation settings, and NAV calculation failed. Possible reasons include:

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account.

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account balance (normal when there are no earlier fees of the type).

title: NAV warnings
body: Cost formula is invalid and doesn't return any transactions.

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Share class and portfolio warnings are based on the decision table rules that check share classes and portfolios. The decision table contains checks listed below, most of which you can adjust (see Add warnings for NAV calculation in FA Admin guide).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Adjustable warnings:

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Negative positions or cash account balance (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 5% for stocks (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 1% for other securities and currencies (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: FX rate has changed more than 5% (portfolio). This check can be adjusted separately for securities and cash accounts.

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Market price older than calculation date (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Fund performance vs. benchmark differs by more than 1% (share class).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Market price history missing (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: System warning (not adjustable):

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: The difference in the outstanding units in the current and previous NAV calculation does not match the number of units from the executed transactions (share class).

title: Limit warnings
body: Limit warnings mean that the fund portfolio positions are close to or outside the warning or breach thresholds set for the portfolio.

title: Limit warnings
body: Warning: portfolio values are beyond the warning threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: Breached: portfolio values are outside the breach threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: To learn more about setting investment limits in FA Back, see UCITS limits.

title: Fund analysis and reporting data
body: FA Fund management provides you with fund performance-related data that you can use to produce fund factsheets and reports:

title: Fund analysis and reporting data
body: Portfolio content grouped by asset classes and types, showing the market value, share of total and share of parent.

title: Fund analysis and reporting data
body: Share class performance, showing TWR, alpha, beta, tracking error, vol ann, information ratio, SRRI.

title: Fund analysis and reporting data
body: Fund performance, showing TWR, alpha, beta, tracking error, vol ann, information ratio, turnover.

title: Fund analysis and reporting data
body: The data is generated regularly according to the schedule you set up for the fund. When the data is calculated, you can preview and accept it.

title: Fund analysis and reporting data
body: Note: accepting fund analysis and reporting data is currently unavailable. This is a know issue that is going to be fixed in the nearest future.

title: Fund analysis and reporting data
body: To create reports based on the generated data, you need to build a report template. To learn more, see the Reporting section in FA Developer guide.

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view

title: Adjust the view

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view

title: Adjust the view

title: Adjust the view

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view

title: Generate fund analysis and reporting data
body: To generate fund analysis and reporting data:

title: Generate fund analysis and reporting data
body: Set the schedule for calculation the data. To do this, choose the fund in the NAV overview and click to open the Fund wizard. Go to the Fund reporting tab, enable fund reporting and define the schedule. For the field details, see Create a fund.

title: Generate fund analysis and reporting data
body: Calculate the data (make sure your fund is in the "Pending calculation" status). You can mass-calculate the data or start the calculations one by one from the side panel in the Fund analysis view.

title: Generate fund analysis and reporting data
body: View and check the data in the Analysis overview (double-click the fund in the list). For details about the figures, see Fund analysis and reporting data in the Analysis overview.

title: Generate fund analysis and reporting data
body: If you notice a mistake in the underlying data that caused an incorrect calculation, make the necessary fixes. Click the fund in the list and then Recalculate.

title: Generate fund analysis and reporting data
body: If you calculated the data on the wrong date, for example, due to an incorrect schedule, you can delete the calculation data from the system. Double-click the fund in the list and click Delete.

title: Generate fund analysis and reporting data
body: Accept the calculation if the data is correct (click Accept).

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: You can track the data calculation status in the Fund analysis view and see if you need to calculate the reporting data today.

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: Data calculation can have the following statuses:

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: No schedule

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: The calculation schedule is missing in the fund settings.

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: No action

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: No calculation or acceptance needs to be carried out today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: Pending calculation

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: Fund analysis and reporting data needs to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate it for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept it for these first to be able to calculate the current day’s data.

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: Calculated

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: Fund analysis and reporting data was already calculated, and you can accept it.

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: Accepted

title: Follow the data calculation statuses
body: Fund analysis and reporting data was accepted today. The next calculation date is in the future.

title: Fund analysis and reporting data in the Analysis overview
body: The Analysis overview shows the fund analysis and reporting data you calculated. The date in the top-right corner shows the latest calculation date. You can choose a previous date to view the history.

title: KPI tabs
body: KPI tabs

title: KPI tabs
body: KPI tabs show fund portfolio analyzed as a whole and by share class. The indicators are:

title: KPI tabs
body: For the fund portfolio: TWR, vol ann, alpha, beta, tracking error, vol ann, information ratio, turnover.

title: KPI tabs
body: For the share classes: TWR, vol ann, alpha, beta, tracking error, vol ann, information ratio, SRRI.

title: KPI tabs
body: To learn more about these indicators, see Figures available in Analytics in FA Back reference.

title: Holdings tab
body: Holdings tab

title: Holdings tab
body: The Holdings tab shows the fund portfolio content, with market value and share of total specified for each position.

title: Allocation: Asset class tab
body: Allocation: Asset class tab

title: Allocation: Asset class tab
body: The Allocation: Asset class tab shows the fund portfolio analyzed by asset type and asset class for all allocation groups.

title: Performance tab
body: Performance tab

title: Performance tab
body: The Performance tab shows the fund portfolio performance since the fund inception as a graph.

title: Track changes and view history
body: FA Operations tracks the changes made by the users and stores the history of reconciliations and reconciliation items.

title: Track changes and view history
body: Audit logs show who and when made changes to a reconciliation or a reconciliation item. You can see the old and new value of the property that was changed.

title: Track changes and view history
body: Reconciliation history shows closed reconciliations and items.

title: Audit logs
body: To access audit logs for a reconciliation, open the reconciliation in the Reconciliation overview or History view and click Audit log at the upper right.

title: Audit logs
body: To access audit logs for a specific reconciliation item, open it in the Reconciliation overview or History view and go to the Audit log section.

title: Reconciliation history
body: Reconciliation history

title: Reconciliation history
body: To access all reconciliations that have been uploaded in FA Operations and view the reconciliation items, open the History view.

title: View reconciliations
body: The Reconciliations tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliations in the system. You can:

title: View reconciliations
body: Download the reconciliations list in the CSV or XLSX format (click Export).

title: View reconciliations
body: View reconciliation details and the list of reconciled items (click in the reconciliation row). To download the reconciliation report, then click Download report in the upper-right corner. If the reconciliation is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation.

title: View reconciliations
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.

title: View all reconciliation items
body: The Reconciliation items tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliation items that have been uploaded in the system. You can:

title: View all reconciliation items
body: Download the list of all items in the CSV or XLSX format (click Export).

title: View all reconciliation items
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view
body: Sort by clicking the column name.

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust table row density ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Filter the table based on column content ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Search the table with the search fields at the top of the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click and enter a name for the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click Save.

title: Adjust the view
body: The adjustments are saved as a view, including the search fields at the top. You can now:

title: Adjust the view
body: Set a saved view as the default. To do this, click the Saved views field or , and then click the star icon next to the saved view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks and onboarding new customers. You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: Work with customers

title: About FA Advisor
body: Maintain up-to-date customer information. You can view your customers, or all customers in the system, and select an individual customer to view and edit their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Add customer-related notes and store documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related tasks: calls, emails, letters, meetings, or custom tasks that you define.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer investments

title: About FA Advisor
body: View a summary of a customer's investments or see more details in FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Trade for the customer via FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Keep track of unsigned trade orders that the customer needs to accept.

title: Work with customers
body: FA Advisor enables you to access customer profiles in the FA Platform to work with your customers. Customer profiles are created in FA Back as contacts, and FA Advisor allows you to maintain up-to-date information about a customer as well as manage tasks, documents, and notes related to them.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view allows you to view customer information in a table. To open a specific customer's details, click  in the Actions column. To access a customer's investments or trade on their behalf, click  in the Actions column to open the FA Client Portal app.

title: Viewing options
body: You can:

title: Viewing options
body: Use the Customer groups dropdown to view different groups of customers. View customers you are linked to as a representative by selecting "My customers" (default selection), all customers in the system by selecting "All customers", or customers linked to a specific representative by selecting their name. You can also save your selection or set it as the default (see Adjust the view).

title: Viewing options
body: Export customers as a CSV or XLSX file by clicking Export.

title: Viewing options
body: Adjust the table (see Adjust the view) and group the table information by certain columns (click on and then Group by).

title: Viewing options
body: Convert all visible currency values to a specific currency by selecting it in the Currency dropdown.

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view
body: Sort by clicking the column name.

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust table row density ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Filter the table based on column content ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Search the table with the search fields at the top of the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click and enter a name for the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click Save.

title: Adjust the view
body: The adjustments are saved as a view, including the search fields at the top. You can now:

title: Adjust the view
body: Set a saved view as the default. To do this, click the Saved views field or , and then click the star icon next to the saved view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: You can see the following information as columns in the Customers view or fields in the Customer details:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer’s address information.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Advisors

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's advisors (contacts with contact type 2 in FA Back). You can edit contact definitions under contact type 2 in FA Back (Preference → Contacts → Contact types).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Cash

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Amount of cash in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. Customer ID can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Date of birth

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's date of birth.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in the FA Platform.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Identity

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Identity format of the customer, for example passport. Identity can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Investments

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Amount of investments, excluding cash, in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Language of reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Nationality of the customer. Nationality can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Order status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Trade order status. If the customer has unsigned trade orders, the column shows "Unsigned trade orders".

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Represented by

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Persons who represent the customer and the tags specified for them in the customer profile. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can add representatives in FA Back (see Representatives in FA Back reference).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Represents

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
