body: Persons the customer represents and optional tags assigned to them. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit representatives in FA Back (see Representatives in FA Back reference).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Status of the customer record in the system (active, passive, or closed). Customer status can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Taxation country of the customer. Taxation country can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Total assets

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Combined amount of cash and investments in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Transaction no. level

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Level at which the system generates transaction numbers. This is either the portfolio level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within the portfolio, or the contact level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within all of the contact's portfolios. Transaction no. level can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Add notes and documents
body: The Notes and history section at the bottom of Customer details view allows you to add your customer-related notes, store documents like agreements or investment plans, maintain notes about customer meetings, and view completed tasks related to the customer. If the customer has a contact memo in FA Back, you can also see it in FA Advisor.

title: Add notes and documents
body: To display notes in FA Advisor correctly, we recommend you use, for example, Google Chrome or Safari as your browser.

title: Manage notes
body: In the Notes and history section, the Notes tab allows you to add notes related to the customer or meetings with the customer and link them to specific dates. Notes are also shown in FA Back Contact window, Documents tab. If you delete a note in FA Back, it is also deleted from FA Advisor.

title: Manage notes
body: You can create meeting notes from templates uploaded in FA Back (see ??? in FA Admin guide) or from a blank note the same way you can create general notes. Notes are arranged into categories, including general notes, meeting notes, and any additional categories you create in FA Back (to create categories, see LINK in FA Admin guide).

title: Manage notes
body: To add a note, do the following:

title: Manage notes
body: Click Add note. To create a meeting note, select one of the meeting note templates or "Blank". To create a general note, select "Blank".

title: Manage notes
body: Enter a name and date for the note. If you created a blank note, select the note Category.

title: Manage notes
body: Enter the content in the text editor.

title: Manage notes
body: Click Save.

title: Manage notes
body: To download notes as text files, select them in the list and click Download. You can also print or save a note as a PDF by opening it and clicking the icon.

title: Manage note tabs
body: You can add general information about the customer in the Customer info tab in the Notes and history section. If you have stored information in the customer's contact memo in FA Back (in the Contact window), you can view a tab called FA Back note. Note that you can only edit or delete the memo in FA Back. You can also add new tabs in the Notes and history section.

title: Manage note tabs
body: To add a new tab, do the following:

title: Manage note tabs
body: Click + Add tab and enter a name for it.

title: Manage note tabs
body: Add content in the text editor.

title: Manage note tabs
body: Click Save.

title: Store documents
body: In the Documents tab, you can see documents uploaded for the customer. You can track the signing status and check the FA Client Portal availability of each document. To add documents, do the following:

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload and add the documents.

title: Store documents
body: Fill in the fields: Category, Signing status, Show in FA Client Portal. See the field descriptions below.

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload.

title: Store documents
body: The document is uploaded. To edit the category, signing status, or availability in FA Client Portal for an uploaded document, click in the Actions column.

title: Store documents
body: For each document, you can see the following information:

title: Store documents
body: Category

title: Store documents
body: Document category, for example, agreement or investment plan. Document categories are defined as tags under "Document type" in FA Back (Preference → Tags → Document tags).

title: Store documents
body: Document name

title: Store documents
body: The file name. The supported file types are: PDF, DOC, DOCX, ODT, XLS, XLSX, PPT, PPTX, ODP, ODS, TXT, CSV, XML, PNG, JPG, RTF, and MP3.

title: Store documents
body: Uploaded by

title: Store documents
body: The user ID of the user who uploaded the document.

title: Store documents
body: Upload date

title: Store documents
body: The upload date and time of the document.

title: Store documents
body: Signing status

title: Store documents
body: Document signing status: canceled, done, error, expired, pending or waiting. These document signing statuses are included in FA Standard Solution, otherwise statuses are defined in FA Back in Preference → Tags → Document tags under "Document signing". Documents are sent for signing in FA Back (see Document signing in User guide).

title: Store documents
body: FA Client Portal

title: Store documents
body: Document availability to customer in FA Client Portal, indicated with a checkmark. You can make a document available when uploading by ticking the Show in FA Client Portal checkbox. In FA Back, documents that are available in FA Client Portal are assigned the tag "Online" (included in FA Standard Solution, otherwise the tag is defined in Preference → Tags → Document tags).

title: Manage tasks
body: Advisor tasks allow you to plan and record your actions when communicating with a customer. You can schedule calls, emails, letters, and meetings, for example, and make notes related to them. You can also create other task types in the FA Developer app (see Add a task type to FA Advisor in FA Developer guide). Customer tasks are for tracking pending trade orders (see Track pending trade orders).

title: Manage tasks
body: The following sections describe how you can add advisor tasks, search for tasks, and mark tasks as completed.

title: Add a task
body: You can add a task related to a customer by doing the following:

title: Add a task
body: In the Customer details, Open tasks section, click Add task in the Advisor tasks tab.

title: Add a task
body: Select the task type (for example, call, email or letter, or meeting). Alternatively, you can click Add task in the Tasks view.

title: Add a task
body: Select the Assignee who should complete the task and define the Due date (for details, see Task information). You can also mark the task as completed.

title: Add a task
body: Click Save.

title: Work on tasks
body: When working with a customer, you can see open tasks related to them by going to the Customer details and viewing the Open tasks section. To view and manage all tasks assigned to you or any other user, go to the Tasks view. The Tasks view allows you to do the following:

title: Work on tasks
body: Search for tasks based on assignee, task type, and task status.

title: Work on tasks
body: View only tasks assigned to you by selecting "Assigned to me" in the Assignee filter.

title: Work on tasks
body: Open the task details by clicking the icon in the Actions column. You can:

title: Work on tasks
body: View the contact information of the customer or access their profile by clicking Open customer details.

title: Work on tasks
body: Change the task assignee by selecting a different user in the Assignee field.

title: Work on tasks
body: Change the task status by editing the Due date (future due date gives the task "Open" status, while past due date gives the task "Overdue" status).

title: Work on tasks
body: Mark the task as complete.

title: Task information
body: The following information is available for tasks:

title: Task information
body: Assignee

title: Task information
body: The user the task is assigned to. You can assign the task to yourself or another user by selecting them in the dropdown.

title: Task information
body: Customer

title: Task information
body: The name of the customer.

title: Task information
body: Creator

title: Task information
body: The user who created the task.

title: Task information
body: Due date

title: Task information
body: The date by which the task needs to be completed.

title: Task information
body: Note

title: Task information
body: Notes about the task.

title: Task information
body: Status

title: Task information
body: Task status ("Open", "Overdue", or "Completed"). The "Overdue" status is applied to tasks with a due date in the past. The "Completed" status is applied to tasks marked as complete.

title: Task information
body: Task type

title: Task information
body: Type of action. Standard advisor task types are call, email or letter, and meeting.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: After finishing a task, you can mark it as completed by doing the following:

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Click the icon in the Actions column of a task to open the side pane.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Tick the checkbox Mark task as completed.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Click Save.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: The task status changes to "Completed". You can view completed tasks in a separate tab in the Customer details view, Notes and history section.

title: Manage customer's investments
body: You can view a summary of customer investments in FA Advisor. You can also create trade orders on behalf of the customer via FA Client Portal. Trade orders are sent for execution after the customer signs them.

title: View customer's investments
body: In the Customer details, you can view a summary of a customer's investments in the Investments section. You can view the investment summary for the customer's active portfolios in the following ways:

title: View customer's investments
body: As a table by clicking . The table shows the portfolio name, ID, currency, and in the portfolio currency the value (existing holdings and executed amount) of securities, cash accounts, and market value. The portfolios are in alphabetical order by default, but you can sort the columns in ascending or descending order.

title: View customer's investments
body: As a pie chart by clicking , but only if the customer's portfolios are all in the same currency. The pie chart shows the name, ID, and total value of active portfolios. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are grouped together. If the customer has more than 10 portfolios in the same currency, the pie chart displays 9 portfolios and the remaining portfolios are grouped together.

title: View customer's investments
body: You can also access the customer's investments via FA Client Portal in the following ways:

title: View customer's investments
body: In the Customer details view, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right.

title: View customer's investments
body: Open the Customers view and click the icon in the Actions column.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: You can buy, sell, or switch securities and make deposits and withdrawals on behalf of the customer via FA Client Portal. When making trade orders on behalf of the customer, you can also send them to be signed by the customer before execution. Make sure you have access to trading on behalf of customers and that sending documents for signing is enabled.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: You can only trade via FA Client Portal with portfolios in the group "ADV_TRADING" and securities in groups that start with "ADV_.". The groups are assigned in FA Back (see Security groups and Portfolio groups in FA Back reference).

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: To trade on behalf of a customer, do the following:

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: In the Customers view, click the icon in the Actions column. Alternatively, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right of the Customer details. The customer's FA Client Portal opens.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Make sure you have the rights to trade by checking the banner at the top of the view. Allowed actions are written in green with a check mark next to them.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Make the trade order, deposit, or withdrawal. For information on how to make trade orders, deposits, and withdrawals, see FA Client Portal documentation.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: The trade order you created is tagged with "Advisor" in FA Back and has the pending signing status until the customer signs it. The customer's Status column in the Customers view now shows "Unsigned trade orders". The system sends the trade order to the customer for signing.

title: Cancel a trade order
body: You can cancel trade orders in the customer's FA Client Portal app. For details on how to cancel trade orders, see Orders view in FA Client Portal.

title: Track pending trade orders
body: You can keep track of the customer's pending trade orders in the Customer tasks tab of the Open tasks section in Customer details. Pending trade orders are listed as trade order signing tasks in the table. You can download documents related to the trade orders to your computer in the Actions column.

title: Holdings view
body: The Holdings view shows the client’s investments and lets the user buy, sell and switch securities. The user can view the list of securities in all portfolios or in a portfolio chosen in the drop-down at the top. If a portfolio has subportfolios, the Holdings view shows values aggregated from subportfolios.

title: Holdings view
body: Holdings in the list are grouped by security type. For each holding in the list, the user can view its ISIN code, number of units, purchase value, total market value and unrealized profit since start.

title: Holdings view
body: The user can download the list of holdings in the XLSX file when viewing the page on a larger screen or desktop.

title: Holding details
body: The user can view the following holding details by tapping a holding:

title: Holding details
body: Latest market price with the date

title: Holding details
body: Market price history chart

title: Holding details
body: Number of units

title: Holding details
body: Purchase value

title: Holding details
body: Market value

title: Holding details
body: Change % since start

title: Holding details
body: Unrealised profits since start

title: Holding details
body: Security type, ISIN code, and currency

title: Holding details
body: Documents:

title: Holding details
body: Prospectus. To make Prospectus available in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back, Security window, URL field.

title: Holding details
body: KID. To make KID available in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back, Security window, URL 2 field.

title: Holding details
body: <Security documents>. To make documents related to specific security available on the Holding details page in FA Client Portal, upload them to the security in FA Back (Security window, Documents tab), and add the "Online" tag. The documents will be listed under Prospectus and KID.

title: Holding details
body: Buy and/or Sell buttons. To enable buying and selling, you need to include the portfolio in the CP_TRADING group and add a "Tradeable" tag to the security in FA Back.

title: Holding details
body: Switch button for switching a fund position (or a share of it) to another fund. To enable switching, you need to include the portfolio in the CP_TRADING group and add a "Switchable" tag to the security in FA Back.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: The Buy or Sell button opens the window to enter trade order details:

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Portfolio to trade in.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Cash account (available only when buying).

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Number of units / Trade amount - Trade order amount or the number of units to buy or sell.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Trading method:

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Units - Create a trade order based on the number of units.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: Trade amount - Create a trade order based on the trade amount.

title: Buying and selling securities
body: By default, all security types except for collective investment vehicles are traded in units. Collective investment vehicles are traded in trade amount. To change this, go to the Security window in FA Back and choose one or more options in the Trade type field: "Buy units", "Buy trade amount", "Sell units", "Sell trade amount".

title: Buying and selling securities
body: The user can also buy securities in the Trading view.

title: Switching fund positions
body: The Switch button is available for fund positions. It opens the window to enter the switch order details and create a switch order:

title: Switching fund positions
body: Portfolio to trade in.

title: Switching fund positions
body: Security to sell.

title: Switching fund positions
body: The share of the position to sell in percent.

title: Switching fund positions
body: Security to buy.

title: Switching fund positions
body: The approximate trade amount is estimated based on the position share to sell and the latest price.

title: Switching fund positions
body: When the user clicks Confirm , redemption and subscription trade orders are created in FA Back. When the redemption order is executed, the switch order in FA Client Portal is replaced with a buy order. The redemption is shown as a new transaction in the Transactions view.

title: Trading view
body: The Trading view allows users to browse securities on the markets and create buy trade orders. Securities in the list are grouped by security type. The user can filter securities by Country and Security type and search by Security name.

title: Trading view
body: To provide access to the Trading view, add the user's portfolio in the CP_TRADING portfolio group in FA Back (for details about portfolio groups, see Portfolio groups in FA Back reference).

title: Trading view
body: Trade orders are imported to FA Back and can be further processed there and sent to a marketplace.

title: Security details
body: Security details show security information and display recent price change as a graph. The user can view:

title: Security details
body: Security information (security type, ISIN code, currency).

title: Security details
body: Performance over time (one, three, and five years) in percentage (also on a graph).

title: Security details
body: Buy and/or Sell buttons. To enable buying and selling options for a security, you need to add a "Tradeable" tag to this security in FA Back.

title: Security details
body: Documents (prospectus and KID). To make the documents available to the user, navigate to the Security window in FA Back and input the prospectus and KID URLs in the URL and URL 2 fields. Make sure the URLs begin with a valid protocol (http://, https://, or ftp://) or they will not be visible to the user in the FA Client Portal.

title: Buying a security
body: The Buy button opens a view to enter trade order details:

title: Buying a security
body: Portfolio to trade in.

title: Buying a security
body: Cash account.

title: Buying a security
body: Number of units / Trade amount - Trade order amount or the number of units to buy.

title: Buying a security
body: Trading method:

title: Buying a security
body: Units - Create a trade order based on the number of units.

title: Buying a security
body: Trade amount - Create a trade order based on the trade amount.

title: Buying a security
body: By default, all security types except for collective investment vehicles are traded in units. Collective investment vehicles are traded in trade amount. To change this, go to the Security window in FA Back and choose one or more options in the Trade type field: "Buy units", "Buy trade amount", "Sell units", "Sell trade amount".

title: Buying a security
body: Trading options (buying and selling) are also available in the Holdings view.

title: Enable features for FA Client Portal users
body: You can enable or restrict various features for the user in FA Client Portal. The following sections explain the process of enabling and restricting features for users in FA Client Portal.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: You can hide subportfolios from the user in FA Client Portal. Hidden subportfolios are removed from the portfolio selector, but all figures are still aggregated into the parent portfolio. For more information on portfolio summaries in FA Client Portal, see Overview.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: To hide subportfolios from the Client Portal, assign the "Client Portal: Hide sub portfolio" tag to the subportfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Make documents available
body: You can provide access to the uploaded documents or documents available on the Internet by linking them:

title: Make documents available
body: To make documents available in FA Client Portal, upload them in FA Back and save them with the "Online" tag. To make documents related to specific securities available to the FA Client Portal user, upload them in the Security window, Documents tab, and add the "Online" tag to them. The documents are then listed below the prospectus and KID in FA Client Portal.

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security prospectus available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL field).

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security KID available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL 2 field).

title: Make documents available
body: For more information on documents in FA Client Portal, see Documents view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: If you want to allow the user to trade in FA Client Portal, you need to enable trading on the portfolio and security level and specify the trading method:

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading for a portfolio, add the "Client Portal: Trade" tag to it in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trading in FA Client Portal, see Trading view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable buying and selling for a security, add the "Tradeable" tag to it in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). The user can only trade securities with this tag. For more information on buying and selling in FA Client Portal, see Buying and selling securities.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable the user to switch a fund position to another fund, add the "Tradeable" and "Switchable" tags to the security in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). For more information on switching fund position in FA Client Portal, see Switching fund positions.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading in units and trade amount, add the "Trade type: Buy units, Sell units, Buy trade amount, Sell trade amount" tags to a security in FA Back (Security window, Basic info tab).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: You can define which securities the user can trade per portfolio. For example, you can allow buying, selling, or switching only certain security types for a certain portfolio. To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities only, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Create a security group with the group code prefix "CP" in FA Back. For example, you can create a group for equities with the code "CP_ EQUITY". For details on how to create security groups, see Groups view.

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Link the security group to the user's portfolio in Portfolio window, Security groups tab in FA Back (see Portfolio window).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Add the "Tradeable" tag to all securities in the group in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field).

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: You can restrict access to actions like trading, depositing, and withdrawing based on a mandate between a specific contact and portfolio. This is useful if there are multiple individuals associated with a single portfolio who have distinct roles or permissions based on legal mandates or agreements. For example, you can set individual permissions for Portfolio A so that Person 1 is only able to buy and sell while Person 2 is only able to make withdrawals.

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Access is provided by assigning "Client Portal" tags in the Portfolio or Contact window. FA Client Portal checks the assigned tags and enables or disables actions for users based on them. You can provide access to trading on the following levels:

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Portfolio level: Provide access to trading for all users associated with a portfolio by assigning it "Client Portal" tags in the Portfolio window, Basic info tab (the portfolio is included in a dynamic group).

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Contact level (all portfolios): Provide a specific contact access to trading in all portfolios of another contact. For example: Your user has a linked contact A who is contact B's representative. You assign A some "Client Portal" tags in the Contact window, Representatives tab. Contact A is the only user who gets access to the actions you assigned across all of B's portfolios.

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Individual portfolio level: Provide a specific contact access to trading in an individual portfolio. For example: Your user has a linked contact A who is linked to a specific portfolio in the Portfolio window, Contact tab or Asset managers tab, meaning they have access to the portfolio in FA Client Portal. You assign A some "Client Portal" tags in the Contacts or Asset managers tab. The actions you assigned are only activated for that specific portfolio and contact A.

title: Enable canceling trade orders
body: To enable the user to cancel trade orders with Open or Accepted status, add the "Client portal: Cancel orders" tag to the portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trade orders in FA Client Portal, see Orders view.

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: To set up deposits and withdrawals for the user, do the following:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Add the "Client portal: Deposit" and "Client portal: Withdraw" tags to the user's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Mark portfolio accounts to use for deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal. To do this, open the Portfolio window, Accounts tab in FA Back, and set the following properties for the accounts:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Portfolio cash accounts: set the account category to "Internal".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to deposit funds from: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to withdraw funds to: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: If you define multiple external accounts in the user's portfolio, FA Client Portal shows the Deposit from and Withdraw to fields in the Deposit and Withdrawal windows, where the user can choose the external account to use. For more information on deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal, see Deposits and withdrawals.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly investments for the user:

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Follow the Set up monthly investments instructions in FA Admin guide to define the trade order generation details.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Add the "Client portal: Monthly investments" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly savings for the user, add the "Client portal: Monthly savings" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: The user can only set up investment or savings plans for portfolios with the required tag. For more information on monthly investments and monthly savings, see Monthly investments in FA Client Portal and Monthly savings in FA Client Portal in FA Client Portal.

title: Rebalance window
body: You can create model portfolios, strategies or investment plans and use them to keep your investment portfolios in balance. Rebalancing creates trade orders to buy and sell securities according to the model. For general information about rebalancing approaches and for instructions, see Rebalance in FA User guide.

title: Rebalance window
body: The Rebalance window allows you to define the rebalance parameters and the securities to rebalance. The window lists securities in the portfolio or in the model linked to the rebalanced portfolio and indicates the shares of these securities in the investment portfolio and model. The portfolio account is also included in rebalancing.

title: Rebalance window
body: At the top of the Rebalance window, you can define the rebalancing parameters.

title: Affected portfolios
body: Affected portfolios

title: Affected portfolios
body: The Affected portfolios section defines which portfolios are rebalanced.

title: Affected portfolios
body: Rebalance against

title: Affected portfolios
body: Target for rebalancing, in order of descending priority. The system uses the first target in the list if defined. Otherwise, the system the target with the next highest priority. The targets can be:

title: Affected portfolios
body: "Model portfolio", "Investment plan", "Strategy" – Model portfolio, investment plan or strategy linked to the portfolio.

title: Affected portfolios
body: "Portfolio itself" – Target shares you specify in the Rebalance window.

title: Affected portfolios
body: "Empty portfolio" – An option to empty the portfolio – this will set all the new shares as 0% and sell everything, regardless of the linked model or plan.

title: Affected portfolios
body: Invest

title: Affected portfolios
body: invest

title: Affected portfolios
body: Include sub-portfolios

title: Affected portfolios
body: Aggregates positions and investment plan/ model portfolio contents also from the rebalanced portfolio's subportfolios. This allows you to divide holdings into subportfolios and rebalance everything at once through the main portfolio. Trade orders are created either to the main portfolio or the sub-portfolios based on which portfolio or portfolio's investment plan / model portfolio the trade order's security can be found in: for sells of existing positions, trade orders are created in the same portfolio where the position currently is, and for buys, trade orders are created in the same portfolio which has the position in the investment plan / model portfolio.

title: Affected portfolios
body: Asset group

title: Affected portfolios
body: The asset group the strategy is based on (for example, geographical, industry, or asset class).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Rebalance parameters

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The Rebalance parameters section defines rebalancing logic.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Date

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The rebalancing date. This date affects:

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The market prices, rebalanced portfolio shares, trade order amounts. The percentage shares of securities in the portfolio are determined based on the market prices on the rebalancing date. The market prices on this date are used to calculate the amount in the suggested trade orders.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The content of the model portfolio/ investment plan. The target shares are fetched based on the selected rebalancing date

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Restrict rebalancing to accounts

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Restrict rebalancing to only reach the target level for portfolio accounts, without any other buys or sells. This feature has different effects depending on the rebalance method (buying with extra cash or using cash from sells) – see Choose rebalance method.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: With the conservative rebalancing method, securities are bought and sold only to achieve the target level of the account. If the account has excess cash, the selected securities (largest first) are bought as long as there is available cash but nothing is sold. If the account has a lack of cash, the selected securities (largest first) are sold until the account reaches the target level - nothing is bought and securities are sold only to rebalance the account to the defined level.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: With the exchange method, if the account balance is below the target, it is first rebalanced with sells. After this, the excess cash from sells is used to buy the securities to be rebalanced, but securities are sold only to cover all the necessary buys. If there are Executable sell trade orders, the cash coming in from these is taken into account when selling the securities.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: With full rebalance, if the account balance is below the target, it is first rebalanced with sells. After this, the excess cash from sells is used to buy the securities to be rebalanced, but securities are sold only to cover all the necessary buys.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: You can also define the rebalance settings in Preference ("Define target range for portfolio's cash balance", "Define how much negative cash balance is increased by to cover all negative cash" and "Define how much positive cash balance is decreased by to ensure positive cash balance"). These preferences determine how rebalancing tries to achieve the target level for accounts. See Rebalancing for details.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Rebalance method

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Rebalancing approach: conservative rebalance, full rebalance, full rebalance including outstanding orders, exchange, invest cash, cover for cash, and model change (see Choose rebalance method).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Filter out small trade orders based on

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The minimum size for the trade orders that rebalancing should create. The size restrictions don't apply if you sell an entire position away from the portfolio (see Selling an entire position). Set the minimum difference between the portfolio position and the model as:

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Minimum change % (absolute/ percentage points)" - The difference in percentage points.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Minimum change % (relative / percentage change)" - The relative difference in percentage.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Minimum trade amount" - The minimum trade amount in portfolio currency. Alternatively, you can define a Minimum trade amount for each of your securities (see Security window).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Position is within min/max share" - The difference defined with the minimum and maximum thresholds in the model. Trade orders are created only if your position deviates outside of the minimum and maximum thresholds. The minimum trade amount for each trade order is calculated as follows:

title: Rebalance parameters
body: For "buy": ( target share - min share ) * portfolio value

title: Rebalance parameters
body: For "sell": ( max share - target share ) * portfolio value

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Positions that don't have the thresholds specified int the model are rebalanced without filtering when "Position is within min/max share" is selected.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Use cash from accounts

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Accounts to use for buys if you select to buy with extra cash in the portfolio. This option allows you to keep your portfolio fully invested and exclude certain accounts (for example, accrued fee accounts) from rebalancing.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "All accounts" – Use cash on all accounts. You can choose to use available credit or repay the used credit (see the Use portfolio credit field below).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Cash accounts" – Use cash on the accounts marked as "cash accounts" in the Portfolio window, Accounts tab.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Cash and credit accounts" – Use cash on cash and credit accounts. You can choose to use available credit or repay the used credit (see the Use portfolio credit field below).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Default account only" – Use cash on the portfolio's default account – the first account in the list in the Portfolio window, Accounts tab. If this account is a credit account, you can choose to use available credit or repay the used credit (see the Use portfolio credit field below).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Use portfolio credit

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Use credit account for buys. Choose if you want to use the positive account balance and available credit for buys, and if you want to cover the negative balance. The option is shown if you selected "All accounts", "Cash and credit accounts" or "Default account only" in Use cash from accounts.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Don't use portfolio credit" – Use only positive balance on the credit account for buys, without repaying the used credit.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Use portfolio credit" – Use available credit and positive balance on the credit account for buys, without repaying the used credit.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Repay portfolio credit" – Use positive balance on the credit account. In case of negative balance, rebalance the credit account account to 0. The cash is rebalanced to the default portfolio account, and you can then repay the credit manually. If a portfolio has no accounts other than the credit account, the credit is repaid automatically.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Calculate fees to trade orders

title: Rebalance parameters
body: An option to calculate fees, or to estimate the effect of an upcoming fee when generating buy and sell trade orders. If a fee is calculated, the effect of the fee is taken into account when determining how many units you can buy with you available cash and how much money you get from sells. This allows you to estimate the effects of upcoming transaction fees more accurately. Fees are also saved in the Fees field for each trade order.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Don't calculate fees" - Don't calculate fees in trade orders.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Calculate portfolio specific fees" - Calculate a transaction fee defined in the portfolio (Portfolio window, Fees tab).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Calculate fixed fees" - Calculate a fee defined as a percentage in the field available next to the selection.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Use security minimum trade amount

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Option to set the minimum trade amount of the security as the minimum trade order amount. A trade order is only created if the amount is at least equal to the security minimum trade amount. If you also use "Minimum trade amount" for Filter out small trade orders based on, rebalancing first applies the filter and then checks the security minimum trade amount.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The system starts rebalancing from the largest potential trade order and works towards the smallest one. If both settings are enabled, the system does the two checks and if a trade order fails them, the following logic is used:

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Filter out the trade order without reallocating the trade order if the minimum trade amount is not reached. If the last security to rebalance fails, the trade order is always filtered out.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Reallocate the trade order amount if the security minimum trade amount is not reached.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Example 1: The rebalancing amount is 550. Minimum trade amount is 100. Security minimum trade amount is 600. The system first checks if 550 > 100 (true), and then checks if 550 > 600 (false). No trade order is created.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Example 2: The rebalancing amount is 550. Minimum trade amount is 100. Security minimum trade amount is 300. The system first checks if 550 > 100 (true), and then checks if 550 > 300 (true). The system creates a trade order.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Trade order parameters

title: Trade order parameters
body: Trade order parameters section includes criteria for defining how trade orders are created

title: Trade order parameters
body: Set accounts to trade orders

title: Trade order parameters
body: An option to define accounts for trade orders (Account field):

title: Trade order parameters
body: "Don't set accounts to trade orders" - Create trade orders with "No account".

title: Trade order parameters
body: "Set the default account to trade orders" - Set the portfolio's default account – the first account in the list in the Portfolio window, Accounts tab.

title: Trade order parameters
body: "Set the currency account (or default account) to trade orders" - Use the account with the same currency as the trade order. If such account doesn't exist, this option uses the default account of the portfolio. If the portfolio doesn't have accounts, then the shared accounts for the portfolio are used in the same order: first using the shared account with the same currency as the trade order, and if not found, then using the shared default account.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Create trade orders with status

title: Trade order parameters
body: The status of trade orders.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Set trade order tags

title: Trade order parameters
body: Tags to add to trade orders. For example, you can use tags to mark trade orders with execution instructions.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Set portfolio tags

title: Trade order parameters
body: Tags to add to portfolios affected by rebalancing. This allows you to for example mark the rebalanced portfolios.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Rebalance memo

title: Trade order parameters
body: Comments and notes on your rebalances, for example, references. Memos are stored in the Rebalance view, which allows you to search for conducted rebalances.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: The bottom of the Rebalance window shows a summary of the positions of the rebalanced portfolio(s). The rebalanced portfolios' positions are grouped per rebalanced portfolio: the icon next to the portfolio ID indicates whether the portfolio is rebalanced against model portfolio, investment plan or portfolio itself, and moving your mouse above a portfolio provides you with more details on how the portfolio is rebalanced, such as the name of the linked model portfolio and the full name of the rebalanced portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: The content is divided into columns:

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Security - Position affected by the rebalance (a position in the portfolio or a position in the model).

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Amount – The current amount (number of units) of the security in the portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Purchase value – The current purchase value of the position in the portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: MPrice – The latest available market unit price of the security, with the date (and time) of the price shown in parentheses.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Market val. – The total market value of the position in the portfolio with the latest available market price.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Change - The change between the purchase value and the market value of the position.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Share % – The current percentage share of the position in the portfolio, calculated with the current market price from the total value of the portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Min % and Max % – The minimum and maximum thresholds defined for the position in its investment plan or model portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Model % – The share of the security in the model portfolio or investment plan.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: New % – Target share. The field shows the percentage share of the security in the model, if any model is linked to the portfolio. Otherwise, the percentage share of the security in the portfolio is shown. You can edit the value before rebalancing the portfolio and creating trade orders.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Difference % – The percentage difference between the percentage shares of the security between the portfolio and the model portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Difference - The difference between the shares of the security in the portfolio and the model portfolio in portfolio currency.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: You can select portfolios and the positions to include in rebalancing.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: When the information for the rebalancing is defined and manually adjusted if necessary, the investment portfolios are rebalanced and trade orders are suggested to be created with the Rebalance button.

title: Trade orders suggested by rebalancing
body: You can view the suggested trade orders after you click Rebalance. You can use filters to search for trade orders within the suggestion.

title: Trade orders suggested by rebalancing
body: Only visible trade orders are saved - to save all suggested trade orders, clear all filters.

title: Trade orders suggested by rebalancing
body: Saving the trade orders is done in the background - you can close the trade order listing and continue using FA while the trade orders are being created. Once the trade order creation is finished in the background, you will see a notification at the bottom-right corner of the view: "Trade orders done. Created trade orders: x.

title: Trade orders suggested by rebalancing
body: You can view the trade orders in the Trade orders view. If a portfolio is rebalanced again, Open trade orders are replaced with new trade orders.

title: Users and accesses
body: User access in FA is controlled with the following features:

title: Users and accesses
body: User roles let you manage the user’s access to FA functionality.

title: Users and accesses
body: Limited visibility and linked contacts let you manage the user’s access to the client information stored in FA.

title: Access to FA functionality
body: The access to FA functionality is defined by:

title: Access to FA functionality
body: A tree structure that consists of departments, roles, and rights. Departments include roles that are linked to user rights. User rights define access to features and functionality within the FA applications.

title: Access to FA functionality
body: The role(s) you assign to the user.

title: Access to FA functionality
body: Role management lets you structure departments, roles, and rights in the way that suits your use case best. When you create a role structure in FA, identify the types of tasks the users perform in FA and group them accordingly. The screenshot below features an example of a simple role structure that has back-office users, administration, and clients. Such structure is suitable for a small organization where all employees perform the same back-office tasks, and the administration role is reserved for users with access to FA setup. Client role is for the clients using FA Client Portal.

title: Access to FA functionality
body: If your use case is more complex, with various users performing various sets of tasks, you should create a corresponding role structure. In the screenshot below, departments feature multiple roles that correspond to different sets of tasks (for example, accountant, back office analyst, fund operations, head of operations).

title: Access to FA functionality
body: Note that the role structure in FA should not mirror your organization structure, as roles and departments are based on the system usage.

title: Access to FA functionality
body: Roles, departments and rights define user's access to FA functionality (for example, to trade order management or rebalancing). They don't grant or restrict access to certain client data. To set up access to client data, use limited visibility (see Access to data in FA Admin guide).

title: Departments
body: Departments are groups of roles in your organization. Departments help you organize roles in a clear structure that is easy to understand, navigate and use. In a smaller organization, a simple department structure with only one role per department can be enough - for example, "Back office", "End client" and "Administration". In a bigger organization, you can have many departments, each of them including several roles (see examples above).

title: Roles
body: Roles represent use cases. When you create a role, you link it to the user rights that provide access to FA functionality needed for the role's use case. Here are some tips:

title: Roles
body: Roles shouldn't copy the structure of your organization or offices. Create roles based on the type of tasks the users need to perform. For example, if your organization has advisors who work in Helsinki and Stockholm offices and have the same scope of tasks – we recommend creating one common "advisor" role for them.

title: Roles
body: Avoid too granular, feature-specific role definitions. Try to create roles that are based on the type of tasks. For example, "Back office", "Administrator" instead of "Rebalancing" or "User management".

title: Roles
body: If you have a group of users with the same tasks (for example, back office employees), with a part of these users having additional responsibilities, consider creating separate roles for the basic and additional sets of tasks. For example, you can have a back office role for all back office employees, and separate roles for accounting, user management, compliance, and so on. The users with additional responsibilities would have two or more roles.

title: Rights
body: Rights define access to FA features and functionality. While roles depend on your use case and you can define them in FA user management, rights are standard – they correspond to certain FA features and can't be changed. For example, the ROLE_ANA right provides access to Analytics views and Strategy analyzer. You can use it in one or more user roles you set up, such as Analyst, Asset manager, Fund manager, and so on. Here are some tips on adding rights to a role:

title: Rights
body: Avoid including too many extra rights in one role – identify the rights that are really needed for the role's tasks. If a role is linked to too many rights, the user with the role might see a lot of extra views, tabs, and menus that they don't need. You can always redefine a role in the future by adding more rights in it if you need to.

title: Rights
body: To provide access to an app in a role, include at least one right for this application. Otherwise, the user won't be able to access it.

title: Rights
body: To let the users access the same functionality but different data (for example, restrict advisors' view to the portfolios they are responsible for), define a role with the following rights:

title: Rights
body: The ROLE_LV right for limited visibility.

title: Rights
body: The ROLE-ELV right for extended limited visibility.

title: Rights
body: Other rights that provide access to the functionality needed for the role.

title: Rights
body: The limited visibility rights (ROLE_LV and ROLE_ELV) affect the choice of other rights you add for the role. When you define a role, you should first decide if you want to include the limited visibility right in it. After that, make sure that other rights you add don’t conflict with the limited visibility right – these rights must provide access only to views and features that support limited visibility. To learn more about the views that support limited visibility, see Access for employees.

title: User's roles
body: After you defined user rights and roles in the system, assign roles to the users. A user can have one or more roles, depending on what kind of use cases are relevant for them when working with FA.

title: Managing users
body: In the User management view of FA Admin Console, you can:

title: Managing users
body: Store user information and add, view, delete, activate and deactivate users.

title: Managing users
body: Set up the user’s authentication process. You can choose direct or two-factor authentication process for the users to log in.

title: Managing users
body: Manage brute force protection that deactivates a user after a number of unsuccessful login attempts.

title: Managing users
body: View the user’s activity and log a user out of FA.

title: Managing users
body: Set up a user's access to FA with user roles and the limited visibility functionality.

title: View and search for users
body: To search for a user by login, name, or email, enable filtering in the top-right corner of the user list.

title: View and search for users
body: To filter users by user roles, click the filter icon in the top-right corner of the User management view. Choose the roles from the dropdown list - a user is shown if the user has any of the selected roles.

title: Add a user
body: To add a user:

title: Add a user
body: Go to the User management view in the FA Admin Console app.

title: Add a user
body: Click Add user at the top-right corner and fill in the user information:

title: Add a user
body: The User ID used as a username at login and Email (required fields).

title: Add a user
body: Linked contact to set up limited visibility or FA Front access with external identity provider.

title: Add a user
body: Other fields, if needed. For more details, see User details and account information in FA Admin Console.

title: Add a user
body: Click Edit user roles in the User details pane and choose which apps your user can access and with what roles.

title: Add a user
body: To access an app, a user needs a role for it – a user without any roles can't access any application.

title: Add a user
body: Let the user know about their credentials and how to get a password.

title: Add a user
body: Send them the user ID – FA doesn't send this information automatically.

title: Add a user
body: Instruct the user to request a password reset link by clicking Forgot password on the login page.

title: Modify a user
body: To modify a user, click on the user in the list. You can:

title: Modify a user
body: Activate/ Deactivate a user. Switch the user’s status. Deactivated user can’t log in to FA. We recommend using this option instead of deleting the user – this maintains the user's history while preventing them from accessing FA.

title: Modify a user
body: Edit user info. To learn more about the user details, see User account information in FA Admin Console.

title: Modify a user
body: Edit user roles. To learn more about managing user roles, see Assign user roles in FA Admin Console.

title: Delete a user
body: To delete a user and all user information from the system, click the Delete user icon. A deleted user can’t log in. If you just want to disable a user and prevent them from logging in, consider deactivating the user instead of deleting it.

title: Unblock a user (brute force detection)
body: To check if the user lost access to FA due to the brute force detection:

title: Unblock a user (brute force detection)
body: Go to the FA Admin console, User Management view.

title: Unblock a user (brute force detection)
body: Click the user row to open the User details pane on the right. You will see the user’s status in Brute force detection - blocked or unblocked.

title: Unblock a user (brute force detection)
body: To unblock the user, click Unblock and activate.

title: Related links
body: User management view in FA Admin Console

title: Authentication
body: FA provides the following authentication methods:

title: Authentication
body: Direct authentication with login and password.

title: Authentication
body: Two-factor authentication with login, password and verification code.

title: Authentication
body: Authentication for end clients through external identity provider, such as Signicat.

title: Authentication
body: To protect user accounts from malicious attempts to guess the password, FA uses Brute force detection that blocks the user account after a number of unsuccessful login attempts.

title: Optional packages
body: Optional packages are certain packages that are available for installation in FA Back but are not necessarily needed in each installation. They include packages such as optional asset classes / types and sample bookkeeping accounts / posting rules.

title: Manage optional packages
body: The optional packages are managed with the tool available in FA Back under Tools → Administer → Install optional packages.

title: Manage optional packages
body: Select the package you want to manage by clicking its title. If the package is not yet installed, you can install it by clicking the Install button. If there is an update available, you can update the package with the Update to version [x.x] button. Note however that the packages are also automatically updated each night; this means that in normal cases there shouldn't be a need to update the packages manually. You can prevent the automatic updates by clicking the Unsubscribe from updates button on an installed package. Unsubscribing from a package doesn't delete anything from the system – it just prevents the package contents from updating in the future.

title: Schedule processes
body: You can configure FA processes to run at specific times. The scheduling is done with Cron expressions.

title: Schedule processes
body: If you have overlapping schedules, the system shows a warning. Five scheduled processes can run at the same time, but overlapping runs can cause issues if they affect the same data. For example, we don't recommend generating settlement and payment instructions for the same transactions simultaneously.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To create and manage schedules, open Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions in the top menu. After selecting a scheduled process, you can see the Cron schedule specified for it. This means a regular execution time has been set for the process.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To add a new schedule:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Add button and fill in the fields:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Cron schedule

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The process schedule specified using Cron syntax (see Cron schedules). The next execution time is shown when a valid Cron schedule is entered.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Configuration

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The configuration used for the schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Saved views

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The saved view, if it’s relevant for the process you are scheduling. The saved view can be e.g. saved transaction view if you are scheduling a functionality that runs against a list of transactions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click Save to save the schedules. Alternatively, you can click Remove to delete a schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Run button to test your configurations. The functionality is run with the configuration set and saved view you specified.

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the Cron syntax. The basic principles are:

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the following order, with space separating each component:

title: Cron schedules
body: Seconds

title: Cron schedules
body: Minutes

title: Cron schedules
body: Hours

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-month

title: Cron schedules
body: Month

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Year (optional)

title: Cron schedules
body: Asterisk ( * ) can be used to specify any value (for example, * as the Day-of-month component indicates that the schedule is run every day of the month).

title: Cron schedules
body: Question mark (?) can be used in day-of-month and day-of-week fields to specify “no specific value”.

title: Cron schedules
body: Some examples of different kinds of schedules:

title: Cron schedules
body: Daily at 15:00:

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first second of the first minute of the 15th hour, every day of month and every month, regardless of the day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Every Friday at 12:30:

title: Cron schedules
body: Every weekday (Monday through Friday) at 08:10:20

title: Cron schedules
body: 20 10 08 ? * MON-FRI

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first day of every month at 21:00

title: Export list of schedules
body: You can export scheduled runs as an XLSX file. This can help you, for example, to determine how to add a new schedule with as little overlap as possible. To export a list of scheduled runs, do the following:

title: Export list of schedules
body: Go to Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions.

title: Export list of schedules
body: Click Export scheduled runs.

title: Export list of schedules
body: An XLSX file is downloaded to your computer. The file contains the process ID, cron expression, run time (for the next 24 hours and one run thereafter), configuration name, namespace, view type and view name.

title: Process monitoring view
body: The Process monitoring view provides visibility into processes that take place in FA applications. You can see which processes were run, how long they took, and if were completed successfully. If a process is ongoing, you can see details about its progress and evaluate how long it may take. The view also provides input for monitoring the performance of processes over time.

title: Process monitoring view
body: The system monitors processes such as user-triggered and scheduled processes, authority and client reporting, and custom processes. For example, for nightly price updates and report calculation, the monitoring tracks the process through the following stages:

title: Process monitoring view
body: Start

title: Process monitoring view
body: Fetch active portfolios

title: Process monitoring view
body: Handle market data connector 1 (if enabled)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Find applicable securities

title: Process monitoring view
body: Fetch and save close prices

title: Process monitoring view
body: Update cashflow securities

title: Process monitoring view
body: Handle market data connector 2 (if enabled)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Handle market data connector 3 (if enabled)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Update discount factors (if no connectors 1-3 defined)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Schedule report updates

title: Process monitoring view
body: End

title: Tracked processes
body: The initial release of this feature covers the following processes, but the coverage will be expanded in future releases:

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV calculation

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV acceptance

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV rollback

title: Tracked processes
body: Run deferrals

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV rejection

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV acceptance interruption and NAV rollback

title: Tracked processes
body: Corporate actions

title: Tracked processes
body: Nightly price update and report calculation

title: View the process timeline
body: In the Process monitoring view, you can see the timeline of process runs during a given period by choosing the start and end dates. To view information about a specific process, select the application it relates to. You can filter the list down by selecting a single process type, instance, or status. You can also adjust the time scale of the process timeline by using the slider on the right.

title: View the process timeline
body: The status of a process run can be ongoing (blue), completed (green), canceled (grey), or error (red). Click on the process to view its information: start and end times of a run, its completion status, duration, and the user who executed it. You can expand the process run to see the stages.

title: View process details
body: To view the details of a process run or stage, click in the Actions column. The details shown depend on the process. For example, for the NAV acceptance process, you can see the date on which the NAV was accepted. If the run failed, you can view the error message. If the process was canceled, the details show the user who canceled it.

title: Process information
body: The following information is available in the Process monitoring view:

title: Process information
body: Start time

title: Process information
body: The start date and time of the run.

title: Process information
body: End time

title: Process information
body: The end date and time of the run.

title: Process information
body: Status

title: Process information
body: The run status. If the run was successful, the status is "Completed". If the run was canceled by a user, the status is "Canceled". If the run was unsuccessful, the status is "Error". If the run has not finished yet, the status is "Ongoing".

title: Process information
body: Duration

title: Process information
body: The duration of the run in minutes, seconds, and milliseconds.

title: Process information
body: User

title: Process information
body: The username of the user who executed the run.

title: Process information
body: Actions

title: Process information
body: The Actions column shows the button to open process run or stage details.

title: Process information
body: Canceled by

title: Process information
body: If the run was canceled, the username of the user who canceled it.

title: Related links
body: Administer processes in FA Admin guide

title: Notifications
body: FA allows you to keep track of processes by sending global push notifications about their status. You can view the notifications in any FA application, allowing you to get updates about processes started in one application while working with another. Notifications are available for 30 days unless saved for later.

title: View and save notifications for later
body: To open Notifications side pane, click the bell icon in the Global app bar on the left. In the side pane, you can:

title: View and save notifications for later
body: View all notifications in the All tab or only notifications saved for later in the Saved tab.

title: View and save notifications for later
body: Filter the notification list by type (see Notification types).

title: View and save notifications for later
body: Only view unread notifications by toggling Unread only.

title: View and save notifications for later
body: Mark all notifications as read or mark individual notifications as read by clicking the blue dot icon next to them.

title: View and save notifications for later
body: Save notifications for later with the bookmark icon . Saved notifications appear in the Saved tab.

title: View and save notifications for later
body: Notifications can also contain an "Open details" link to the application from which the process originates. You can click the link to learn more about what occurred in the process.

title: Notification types
body: The following notification types are available:

title: Notification types
body: Success. The process was completed successfully.

title: Notification types
body: Info. Information about the process.

title: Notification types
body: Warning. The process produced a warning.

title: Notification types
body: Error. The process failed.

title: Set up pledging portfolios and positions
body: The FA system allows users to pledge and unpledge portfolios and positions to restrict them from being traded or changed. Pledged positions are moved to a pledged portfolio. When positions are pledged or unpledged, the system creates transactions both in the pledged portfolio and the portfolio they originate from. You need to select a pledging tax type and, if you are not using standard security types, link your security types to pledging transactions.

title: If you are using standard security types
body: If you are using the standard security types (see Standard security types in FA User guide), the transaction types of pledging and unpledging transactions are already set. You still need to select a tax type for pledging and unpledging positions:

title: If you are using standard security types
body: Go to Preference → Portfolios → Portfolios.

title: If you are using standard security types
body: Select a tax type in the Tax type for pledging and unpledging field.

title: If you are using standard security types
body: Click Save.

title: If you are using standard security types
body: The system now takes into account taxes and costs when you pledge or unpledge positions or purchase lots.

title: If you are not using standard security types
body: If you are not using the standard security types (see Standard security types in FA User guide), you need to select the transaction types and make sure they are linked to the security types you want to pledge. You also need to select a tax type for pledging or unpledging positions. Follow the steps below to set these up.

title: Step 1 - Select transaction and tax types for pledging and unpledging
body: To select the transaction types and the tax type that the system should use when creating transactions in the original and pledged portfolio, do the following in FA Back:

title: Step 1 - Select transaction and tax types for pledging and unpledging
body: Go to Preference → Portfolios → Portfolios.

title: Step 1 - Select transaction and tax types for pledging and unpledging
body: Fill in the fields (see Portfolios in FA Back reference):

title: Step 1 - Select transaction and tax types for pledging and unpledging
body: Removing position from portfolio. Select a transaction type (for example, "REM").

title: Step 1 - Select transaction and tax types for pledging and unpledging
body: Adding position to portfolio. Select a transaction type (for example, "ADD").

title: Step 1 - Select transaction and tax types for pledging and unpledging
body: Tax type for pledging and unpledging. Select a tax type.

title: Step 1 - Select transaction and tax types for pledging and unpledging
body: Click Save.

title: Step 1 - Select transaction and tax types for pledging and unpledging
body: The system uses the selected transaction types and tax type when creating pledging or unpledging transactions.

title: Step 2 - Link security types to transaction types
body: After selecting the transaction types, you need to make sure that the security types you want to pledge are linked to them. To link a security type to your selected transaction types, do the following:

title: Step 2 - Link security types to transaction types
body: Go to Preference → Securities → Security types and select the security type.

title: Step 2 - Link security types to transaction types
body: In Links to transaction types, select the transaction types that you chose in step 1 and move them to the right with the arrow buttons.

title: Step 2 - Link security types to transaction types
body: Click Save.

title: Step 2 - Link security types to transaction types
body: This security type can now be used for pledging and unpledging.

title: Related links
body: Pledge and unpledge positions in FA User guide

title: Accounting settings
body: To start generating bookkeeping postings, you need to set up bookkeeping accounts and posting rules in Preference → Bookkeeping. If you want to generate deferral transactions, you need to set them up separately in the Tools menu.

title: Administer files
body: The File management view in FA Admin Console allows you to access system-level files and troubleshoot file-based integrations and FA Back or FA Front configurations and themes.

title: View and manage folders
body: The File management view allows you to view and access the following folders:

title: View and manage folders
body: fa-back – Files received and generated for file-based integrations.

title: View and manage folders
body: keycloak-custom-themes – Custom login page themes.

title: View and manage folders
body: keycloak-custom-spi – Extensions for authentication, for example against in-house identity provider (JAR files).

title: View and manage folders
body: routes – Routes for client-specific integrations with the FA Connector microservice.

title: View and manage folders
body: You can manage folders in the following ways:

title: View and manage folders
body: Add folders by clicking the icon in the top right. The size limit for folders is 500MB per upload.

title: View and manage folders
body: View or modify a folder by clicking it to open the side pane. In the side pane, you can:

title: View and manage folders
body: Open a folder with the icon.

title: View and manage folders
body: Download a folder to your computer with the icon.

title: View and manage folders
body: Rename a folder with the icon.

title: View and manage folders
body: Copy or move a folder with the icon.

title: View and manage folders
body: Delete a folder with the icon.

title: Add, modify and delete files
body: You can manage files in the following ways:

title: Add, modify and delete files
body: Add files by clicking Upload files in the top right. The size limit for files is 500MB per upload.

title: Add, modify and delete files
body: View or modify a file by clicking it to open the side pane. In the side pane, you can:

title: Add, modify and delete files
body: Download a file to your computer with the icon.

title: Add, modify and delete files
body: Rename a file with the icon.

title: Add, modify and delete files
body: Copy or move a file with the icon.

title: Add, modify and delete files
body: Delete a file with the icon.

title: Administer documents
body: FA allows you to store documents in the system and link them from external sources. Documents are stored under contacts, portfolios, securities, transactions, and trade orders, but you can manage them on the system level in the Administration view, Documents tab. The documents are listed in a table that shows the document name, the document type as an icon, the date, time, and user who last modified the document, and the document tags.

title: Administer documents
body: The following section describe how you can search and mass-modify documents on the system level.

title: Search documents in the system
body: In the Administration view, Documents tab, you can search for and access documents. You can't view all documents stored in the system at once, but you can search for documents on different levels:

title: Search documents in the system
body: Search within a specific folder by selecting the folder by name in the drop-down menu.

title: Search documents in the system
body: Search from all documents in the system by selecting the root folder (empty or "/") in the drop-down menu.

title: Search documents in the system
body: You can make your search more specific with the following criteria:

title: Search documents in the system
body: Document name. Search for exact (case sensitive) or partial matches. For partial matches (beginning, middle, or end of a file name), use * or %. For example, "Contract*", "*Contract*" or "*Contract", respectively.

title: Search documents in the system
body: Document tags. Select tags to search with. This returns all documents with any of the selected tags.

title: Mass-modify documents
body: You can mass-modify documents with the buttons at the bottom of the Administration view, Documents tab. For example, you can categorize large numbers of documents quickly by tagging them simultaneously. You can:

title: Mass-modify documents
body: Delete all currently visible documents by clicking Delete document.

title: Mass-modify documents
body: Add or remove tags from all currently visible documents by clicking Tag documents. You can add new tags by entering them in the + Document tags field and remove tags by entering them in the - Document tags field.

title: Related links
body: Documents in FA User guide

title: Set up document signing notifications
body: FA allows you to send documents to be signed by your clients (see Document signing in FA User guide). When you send a document for signing, the FA system can send notifications and reminders to a client via email and SMS. You can customize the content of the notifications or use the default texts.

title: Enable notifications and reminders
body: You can define the notification settings by doing the following:

title: Enable notifications and reminders
body: Go to Tools → Administer → Signicat sign.

title: Enable notifications and reminders
body: Fill in the fields:

title: Enable notifications and reminders
body: Send email notifications and Send SMS notifications. Define when notifications are sent to the client. The following options are available:

title: Enable notifications and reminders
body: Always (all document signees need to have a valid email address or international phone number).

title: Enable notifications and reminders
body: If valid email address is found / If valid phone number is found.

title: Enable notifications and reminders
body: Never.

title: Enable notifications and reminders
body: Reminder frequency. Define when reminder notifications are sent to the client. You can select none (never send reminders), daily, every other day, or weekly.

title: Enable notifications and reminders
