body: Click Done.

title: Enable notifications and reminders
body: Notifications are now set up and the system sends notification and reminder messages to your clients as defined.

title: Define notification content
body: You can customize the content of document signing notifications sent to your clients by creating your own message templates. By default, the FA system uses the default notification texts. To override the default texts, do the following:

title: Define notification content
body: Go to Preference → Reporting → Email and click New.

title: Define notification content
body: Fill in the fields:

title: Define notification content
body: Template name

title: Define notification content
body: For the initial notification, enter "SigningRequestEmail" for an email and "SigningRequestSMS" for an SMS. If you enabled notification reminders, you need to create separate templates for the reminder notifications and enter "SigningReminderEmail" or "SigningReminderSMS". If you don't set up templates for reminders, the initial notification text is used in reminders as well.

title: Define notification content
body: From (name), From (email address), Reply to

title: Define notification content
body: Name of sender, email address of sender, and reply email address. These fields are not used in the signing process (the system uses the email address "noreply@signicat.com").

title: Define notification content
body: Title

title: Define notification content
body: Title of notification message, used as the subject in email notifications.

title: Define notification content
body: Content

title: Define notification content
body: Notification text. You can:

title: Define notification content
body: Use dynamic keys. For example, you can use %%contact.name%% to address the recipient by name (see Preference - Reporting in FA Back reference).

title: Define notification content
body: Show the document name to the recipient by including ${documentNames}.

title: Define notification content
body: Show the URL for reviewing and signing the document by including ${taskUrl}.

title: Define notification content
body: Click Save.

title: Define notification content
body: The system now uses the custom template to send notifications or reminders to your clients.

title: Logging settings
body: FA logs various kinds of events into system and user audit logs. These errors can be checked manually or monitored on a scheduled basis.

title: You can
body: Check for logged system errors

title: You can
body: Configure automatic log monitoring

title: Report data calculation
body: The FA system recalculates report data for all portfolios each night or morning to reflect the current day's portfolio positions. During the day, to ensure that report data remains up-to-date, report data recalculation is triggered when:

title: Report data calculation
body: A user adds or imports transactions.

title: Report data calculation
body: Transactions are created as the result of a corporate action, fee run, or trade order execution.

title: Report data calculation
body: Certain portfolio information is changed, for example, accounts, valuation method, benchmark, or sub-portfolio aggregation.

title: Report data calculation
body: The system recalculates data only for the portfolios that include securities or positions associated with changes. Since the system handles most of them, as a user, you don't generally need to start report data recalculations. All report data calculations are automated, so you only need to start them yourself in certain situations. To do this, use options in the Update menu at the top, described in the following sections.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Typically, report data is recalculated based on a schedule, for example, every night (see Update report in FA Back reference). The Update menu allows you to start the recalculation outside the schedule, for example, if the scheduled recalculation was unsuccessful.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate all report data of the selected group / customer / portfolio.Recalculates purchase lots and report data shown in Analytics+ and reports for the whole history of the selected portfolios.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate all report data of all portfolios. Recalculates all purchase lots and report data shown in Analytics+ and reports for the whole history of all portfolios in the system. This option prioritizes sub item recalculations over report item recalculations and first drops the report tables to not spend time on deleting individual entries from them and ensure critical FA Back functionalities are available first.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Be careful when starting a full report recalculation for all portfolios. The update can take a long time. Some functionalities become unavailable during the process.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate purchase lot and report data separately for all portfolios. Allows you to recalculate purchase lots and report data shown in Analytics+ and reports in two separate steps, so you can control what to calculate. For example, you can calculate purchase lots first to ensure critical functions of the system are available as soon as possible, and calculate report data later. You can also only calculate report data, for example, if the purchase lots are up-to-date.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate purchase lot data (sub items) for all portfolios.Recalculates purchase lots for all portfolios. Afterwards, you can use the main features of FA Back, excluding functionality relying on analytics of report data.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Recalculate report data (report items) for all portfolios.Recalculates all report data for all portfolios. After report data is updated, you can use FA Back functionalities relying on analytics or report data. Ensure that the purchase lots are up-to-date before updating report items.

title: Recalculate report data outside schedule
body: Re-run the nightly report data update for all portfolios. Recalculates portfolio report data shown in Analytics+ and reports for all active portfolios starting from the last report date until the current date. If portfolio reports are already up-to-date (there are reports for the current date), no recalculation is run.

title: Recalculate transaction effects
body: The Update menu allows you to recalculate transaction effects. This is only required if you change the effects of a transaction type in Preference → Transactions → Transaction types but don't click Update (see Transaction types in FA Back reference). For example, you can change the tax or cost effect from "adding" to "reducing", resulting in a different trade amount if taxes or costs are added instead of subtracted. After the transactions are "recalculated" (transaction trade amounts updated based on the effects change), the system recalculates the affected portfolio reports data.

title: Recalculate transaction effects
body: Recalculate transaction effects of selected group / customer / portfolio. Trade amounts and cash flows of transactions in selected portfolios are recalculated to take into account the changes in transaction types.

title: Recalculate transaction effects
body: Recalculate transaction effects of all portfolios. Trade amounts and cash flows of transactions in all portfolios are recalculated to take into account the changes in transaction types.

title: Recalculate transaction effects
body: Be careful when starting a full recalculation for all portfolios. The update can take a long time. Some functionalities become unavailable during the process.

title: Update market data
body: Market data connection is available in the Update menu if you receive market prices through a market data connector.

title: Update market data
body: With the Market data connection menu items, you can fetch update codes and prices for securities with the "Active" status. Fetching market prices triggers a report calculation to update the effect of the new market prices in your portfolios. The report calculation affects all portfolios containing securities that receive an updated price, and starts from the earliest market price received.

title: Update market data
body: Get missing update codes. Uploads missing update codes from the external price source and saves them in the Update code 1-3 fields in the Security window. The system uploads a missing code for securities with "Active" status that have ISIN code defined. The ISIN is needed to identify the security to update. Note that some securities (for example, currencies) don't have ISIN codes, so you need to enter the update code manually.

title: Update market data
body: Get market prices. Fetches market prices for "Active" securities with a corresponding update code (if market data connection is enabled for Update code 2 / Close 2, prices are only fetched for securities that have the Update code 2 defined).

title: Update market data
body: Get market prices for past 7/30/365 days. Fetches all prices for the past 7, 30, or 365 days and updates existing market prices. If a market price entry exists for a date, this option updates the market price only in the Close field used by the market data connector. Other Close fields keep the original values.

title: Update market data
body: Get market prices from [date]. Fetches all prices starting from the Earliest market price date configured in Market data connection (FA Back reference), updating existing market prices*.

title: Update market data
body: Get missing market prices. Fetches market prices for each security from the latest existing market price onward. This option allows you to fetch prices that are newer than the newest observation already stored. The system goes through all securities with a corresponding update code, determines the latest available market price date for each, and fetches new prices from that date onward. If a security doesn't have existing market prices, they are fetched starting from the earliest market price date specified in Preference → Adminstration (for details, see Market data connection in FA Back reference). Depending on your existing market price history, prices might be fetched for different time periods for different securities, based on their latest available observation.

title: Update market data
body: Example: A security has a price for 2.1.2019 with entries in the Manual and Close 2 fields. You fetch the market price again and include this date (using a market data connector linked to Update code 2 / Close 2). As a result, the value in Close 2 is updated. The value in Manual stays the same.

title: Revaluate securities
body: Revaluate all securities is only available in the Update menu if you have the user role that permits revaluating securities.

title: Revaluate securities
body: The Revaluate all securities menu items allow you to recalculate the discount factors for a specific time period on all your securities that have the base type "DISCOUNT" and other relevant information. The system never calculates discount factors on a security before the beginning of the position or after the maturity date, and all calculations are done until the previous day.

title: Revaluate securities
body: Revaluating securities always triggers a report calculation to update the effect of the new values in your portfolios. The report calculation affects all portfolios containing securities that receive a new valuation. For more details on the revaluation menu items, see Valuation of forward cashflows in FA Back reference.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: The Show pending and ongoing calculations menu item allows you to view pending, ongoing, and failed report calculations. You can refresh the records, export the table as an XLSX file, or delete all records. By default, calculations are deleted automatically after 30 days. The tabs Pending and ongoing and Failed show the following information:

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Scheduled

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Scheduled date and time of the report calculation.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Update since

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Date from which onwards the data is calculated. For example, if the date is a week in the future, report calculations are run from that date onwards until the completion time.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Type

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Report calculation type that distinguishes different report calculation jobs. "FULL-ALL" calculates positions and purchase lots for a portfolio's full history, "FULL" calculates positions for a portfolio's full history, "LATEST" calculates positions starting from a specific date, "SUB" only calculates purchase lots, and "REMOVE" removes report data for a portfolio.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Portfolio ID

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Unique ID of a portfolio.

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: ID

title: Show status of portfolio report calculation
body: Report calculation ID.

title: Set up Fundsettle trading integration
body: The Fundsettle Euroclear trading integration is for inbound and outbound trading of funds (basic type FUND) and uses FTP for connectivity. You can:

title: Set up Fundsettle trading integration
body: Receive inbound fund subscriptions and redemptions for funds managed in the FA system.

title: Set up Fundsettle trading integration
body: Send outbound fund subscriptions and redemptions from the FA system.

title: Inbound trading
body: The FA system receives fund subscription and redemption orders from Fundsettle. In response, the FA systems sends out acknowledgements and confirmations based on the trade order status.

title: Get access to Fundsettle
body: You need to have Fundsettle generate a username and password for you before you can set up the trading connector. When you set up the connector in FA, you need to enter that username and password to establish the connection.

title: Get access to Fundsettle
body: You also need to set the trading channel tag for fund trading as "TradingChannel-FundSettle". For more information about setting trading channel tags, see Add trading platform information.

title: Define accounts
body: To receive or send fund subscription and redemption orders, you need to define two accounts for a fund portfolio:

title: Define accounts
body: Open the Portfolio window, IDs tab for the fund.

title: Define accounts
body: Click Add ID and define the distributor account:

title: Define accounts
body: External name. Enter "KID".

title: Define accounts
body: External ID. Enter the account ID.

title: Define accounts
body: Click OK.

title: Define accounts
body: Click Add ID and define the Fundsettle account:

title: Define accounts
body: External name. Enter "AccountIdentification".

title: Define accounts
body: External ID. Enter the 5-digit account number from Fundsettle.

title: Define accounts
body: Click OK and then Save & close.

title: Define accounts
body: The fund can now receive or send fund subscription and redemption orders via the Fundsettle trading integration.

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: After getting your credentials and defining the fund accounts, you can set up the inbound trading connection via Fundsettle by doing the following:

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Go to Tools → Administer → Trading connectors → Manage and click on "FundSettle" in the Trading Connections tab to expand the section.

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Fill in the fields:

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Enable

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Tick this checkbox to enable the trading connector.

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Username

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Enter the username generated by Fundsettle.

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Password

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Define the password generated by Fundsettle.

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: FTP outbound location

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Enter "ftp.vpc.se:port/Import".

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: FTP inbound location

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Enter "ftp.vpc.se:port/Export".

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Open the Advanced Settings tab and fill in the field in the "Inbound trading" section:

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Portfolio identification code, external ID

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Enter the KID.

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: Click Done and then restart the trading connector by selecting Tools → Service bus message sender.

title: Set up inbound trading connection
body: As a result, the system shows a confirmation if the connection was established successfully.

title: Inbound trading messages
body: The trade orders are sent and received in the ISO20022V4 format. The confirmation messages are sent and received the ISO20022V5 format.

title: Inbound trading messages
body: Fundsettle sends the following trade order messages to FA:

title: Inbound trading messages
body: SubscriptionOrderV04 (setr.010.001.04)

title: Inbound trading messages
body: RedemptionOrderV04 (setr.004.001.04)

title: Inbound trading messages
body: In response, FA sends out the following messages and changes the trade order status in the system:

title: Outbound trading
body: The FA system sends fund subscription and redemption orders to Fundsettle. In response, the FA systems receives acknowledgements and confirmations and the trade order status is updated in the system.

title: Get access to Fundsettle
body: You need to have Fundsettle generate a username and password for you before you can set up the trading connector. When you set up the connector in FA, you need to enter that username and password to establish the connection.

title: Get access to Fundsettle
body: You also need to set the trading channel tag for fund trading as "TradingChannel-FundSettle". For more information about setting trading channel tags, see Add trading platform information.

title: Define accounts
body: To receive or send fund subscription and redemption orders, you need to define two accounts for a fund portfolio:

title: Define accounts
body: Open the Portfolio window, IDs tab for the fund.

title: Define accounts
body: Click Add ID and define the distributor account:

title: Define accounts
body: External name. Enter "KID".

title: Define accounts
body: External ID. Enter the account ID.

title: Define accounts
body: Click OK.

title: Define accounts
body: Click Add ID and define the Fundsettle account:

title: Define accounts
body: External name. Enter "AccountIdentification".

title: Define accounts
body: External ID. Enter the 5-digit account number from Fundsettle.

title: Define accounts
body: Click OK and then Save & close.

title: Define accounts
body: The fund can now receive or send fund subscription and redemption orders via the Fundsettle trading integration.

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: After getting your credentials and defining the fund accounts, you can set up the outbound trading connection via Fundsettle by doing the following:

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Go to Tools → Administer → Trading connectors → Manage and click on "FundSettle" in the Trading Connections tab to expand the section.

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Fill in the fields:

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Enable

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Tick this checkbox to enable the trading connector.

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Username

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Enter the username generated by Fundsettle.

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Password

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Enter the password generated by Fundsettle.

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: FTP outbound location

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Enter "ftp.vpc.se:port/Export".

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: FTP inbound location

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Enter "ftp.vpc.se:port/Import".

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Open the Advanced Settings tab and fill in the field in the "Inbound trading" section:

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Portfolio identification code, external ID

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Enter the KID.

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Click Done and then restart the trading connector by selecting Tools → Service bus message sender. The system shows a confirmation if the connection was established successfully.

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Upload a trading decision table via Tools → Administer → Decision tables. The decision table populates the trade order's information. For details about decision tables, see Transaction and trade order decision tables in FA Developer. Make sure the following information is included:

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Tag: TradingChannel-FundSettle

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: Internal info:

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: DistributorName= (Portfolio IDs KID)

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: AccountIdentification= (Portfolio IDs AccountIdentification)

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: TradingFormat=ISO20022v5

title: Set up outbound trading connection
body: When the connection is established, you can send out trade orders in the Trade orders view by selecting Trading → Send trade orders to trading platform. The FA system updates the trade order statuses as they are received.

title: Outbound trading messages
body: The trade orders are sent and received in the ISO20022V4 format. The confirmation messages are sent and received the ISO20022V5 format.

title: Outbound trading messages
body: When the trade orders have the status "OPEN/EXECUTABLE", FA sends the following trade order messages to Fundsettle:

title: Outbound trading messages
body: SubscriptionOrderV04 (setr.010.001.04)

title: Outbound trading messages
body: RedemptionOrderV04 (setr.004.001.04)

title: Outbound trading messages
body: In response, Fundsettle sends out the following messages and FA changes the trade order status accordingly:

title: FA Back setup
body: FA Back setup

title: FA Client Portal setup
body: FA Client Portal is an app that provides access to investment information for your clients. The app runs in the web browser on desktop and mobile devices and allows your clients to see their holdings, transactions, trade orders, and documents. You can learn more about FA Client Portal from FA Client Portal.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: You can install FA Client Portal from Optional packages:

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Install FA Client Portal in FA Back. Go to Tools → Administer → Install optional packages. In the Other packages section, choose FA Client Portal and click Install.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: If you intend to use FA Client Portal impersonation feature, go to Tools → Administer → FA Client Portal → Configurations → Impersonation in FA Back. Enter the intended URL of the FA Client Portal, for example, https://myportal.com.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Provide access to FA Client Portal. To do this, follow the steps in Set up user access to FA Client Portal.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Contact FA customer service to set up test and production URLs for FA Client Portal.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: You can have multiple instances of FA Client Portal installed (for example, with different logos and branding). For this, contact FA customer service.

title: Set up user access to FA Client Portal
body: Follow the instructions below to set up access to FA Client Portal:

title: Set up user access to FA Client Portal
body: Access for end users - Create a user and specify contacts and portfolios the user can access.

title: Set up user access to FA Client Portal
body: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting - Set up view-only access to client information for advisors, support service, and so on.

title: Access for end users
body: FA Client Portal provides end clients with access to investment information. The user can access:

title: Access for end users
body: Their own portfolios and subportfolios.

title: Access for end users
body: Portfolios and subportfolios of the contacts the user represents – for example, if the user represents their child or a company they work for. A representative can switch between the contacts in FA Client Portal by clicking .

title: Access for end users
body: To provide access to FA Client Portal, you need to:

title: Access for end users
body: Add a new user as described in Add a user in FA Admin guide. Assign the user a role or roles with the following rights in FA Admin Console: FA Client Portal/ ROLE_CLIENT_ACCESS and FA Back/ ROLE_CLIENT_PORTAL. Contact FA customer services if you can't see the listed roles.

title: Access for end users
body: Set up the user’s access to client information stored in FA Back:

title: Access for end users
body: To let the user access their own investment information, make sure the user's contact is specified as a primary contact for the portfolio (see Contacts) and link this contact to the user in FA Admin console (to do this, follow the steps in Link a contact to the user).

title: Access for end users
body: To let a representative access the linked contacts’ information in FA Client Portal, add the user as the contact’s representative in the Contact window, Representatives tab.

title: Impersonation mode
body: Impersonation mode

title: Impersonation mode
body: View-only mode lets advisors and support service specialists access the same view as the client sees, without being able to make any modifications. To access client accounts in FA Client Portal view-only:

title: Impersonation mode
body: Assign the user a role or roles with the following rights in FA Admin Console: FA Client Portal/ ROLE_IMPERSONATE and FA Back/ROLE_CLIENT_PORTAL_IMPERSONATE. This will enable impersonation mode in FA Client Portal, and enable launching it from FA Back. Contact FA customer services if you can't see the listed roles.

title: Impersonation mode
body: View FA Client Portal for a contact in the impersonate mode:

title: Impersonation mode
body: In FA Back, right-click the contact in the Overview and choose "Impersonate in Client Portal".

title: Impersonation mode
body: FA Client Portal opens in a new tab in your browser.

title: Enable features for FA Client Portal users
body: You can enable or restrict various features for the user in FA Client Portal. The following sections explain the process of enabling and restricting features for users in FA Client Portal.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: You can hide subportfolios from the user in FA Client Portal. Hidden subportfolios are removed from the portfolio selector, but all figures are still aggregated into the parent portfolio. For more information on portfolio summaries in FA Client Portal, see Overview.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: To hide subportfolios from the Client Portal, assign the "Client Portal: Hide sub portfolio" tag to the subportfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Make documents available
body: You can provide access to the uploaded documents or documents available on the Internet by linking them:

title: Make documents available
body: To make documents available in FA Client Portal, upload them in FA Back and save them with the "Online" tag. To make documents related to specific securities available to the FA Client Portal user, upload them in the Security window, Documents tab, and add the "Online" tag to them. The documents are then listed below the prospectus and KID in FA Client Portal.

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security prospectus available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL field).

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security KID available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL 2 field).

title: Make documents available
body: For more information on documents in FA Client Portal, see Documents view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: If you want to allow the user to trade in FA Client Portal, you need to enable trading on the portfolio and security level and specify the trading method:

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading for a portfolio, add the "Client Portal: Trade" tag to it in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trading in FA Client Portal, see Trading view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable buying and selling for a security, add the "Tradeable" tag to it in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). The user can only trade securities with this tag. For more information on buying and selling in FA Client Portal, see Buying and selling securities.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable the user to switch a fund position to another fund, add the "Tradeable" and "Switchable" tags to the security in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). For more information on switching fund position in FA Client Portal, see Switching fund positions.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading in units and trade amount, add the "Trade type: Buy units, Sell units, Buy trade amount, Sell trade amount" tags to a security in FA Back (Security window, Basic info tab).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: You can define which securities the user can trade per portfolio. For example, you can allow buying, selling, or switching only certain security types for a certain portfolio. To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities only, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Create a security group with the group code prefix "CP" in FA Back. For example, you can create a group for equities with the code "CP_ EQUITY". For details on how to create security groups, see Groups view.

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Link the security group to the user's portfolio in Portfolio window, Security groups tab in FA Back (see Portfolio window).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Add the "Tradeable" tag to all securities in the group in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field).

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: You can restrict access to actions like trading, depositing, and withdrawing based on a mandate between a specific contact and portfolio. This is useful if there are multiple individuals associated with a single portfolio who have distinct roles or permissions based on legal mandates or agreements. For example, you can set individual permissions for Portfolio A so that Person 1 is only able to buy and sell while Person 2 is only able to make withdrawals.

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Access is provided by assigning "Client Portal" tags in the Portfolio or Contact window. FA Client Portal checks the assigned tags and enables or disables actions for users based on them. You can provide access to trading on the following levels:

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Portfolio level: Provide access to trading for all users associated with a portfolio by assigning it "Client Portal" tags in the Portfolio window, Basic info tab (the portfolio is included in a dynamic group).

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Contact level (all portfolios): Provide a specific contact access to trading in all portfolios of another contact. For example: Your user has a linked contact A who is contact B's representative. You assign A some "Client Portal" tags in the Contact window, Representatives tab. Contact A is the only user who gets access to the actions you assigned across all of B's portfolios.

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Individual portfolio level: Provide a specific contact access to trading in an individual portfolio. For example: Your user has a linked contact A who is linked to a specific portfolio in the Portfolio window, Contact tab or Asset managers tab, meaning they have access to the portfolio in FA Client Portal. You assign A some "Client Portal" tags in the Contacts or Asset managers tab. The actions you assigned are only activated for that specific portfolio and contact A.

title: Enable canceling trade orders
body: To enable the user to cancel trade orders with Open or Accepted status, add the "Client portal: Cancel orders" tag to the portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trade orders in FA Client Portal, see Orders view.

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: To set up deposits and withdrawals for the user, do the following:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Add the "Client portal: Deposit" and "Client portal: Withdraw" tags to the user's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Mark portfolio accounts to use for deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal. To do this, open the Portfolio window, Accounts tab in FA Back, and set the following properties for the accounts:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Portfolio cash accounts: set the account category to "Internal".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to deposit funds from: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to withdraw funds to: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: If you define multiple external accounts in the user's portfolio, FA Client Portal shows the Deposit from and Withdraw to fields in the Deposit and Withdrawal windows, where the user can choose the external account to use. For more information on deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal, see Deposits and withdrawals.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly investments for the user:

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Follow the Set up monthly investments instructions in FA Admin guide to define the trade order generation details.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Add the "Client portal: Monthly investments" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly savings for the user, add the "Client portal: Monthly savings" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: The user can only set up investment or savings plans for portfolios with the required tag. For more information on monthly investments and monthly savings, see Monthly investments in FA Client Portal and Monthly savings in FA Client Portal in FA Client Portal.

title: Modify FA Client Portal
body: You can modify FA Client Portal by uploading logos, adding translations and filling the Contact us page. To do this, follow the instructions in this section. If you want to do more, for example, modify the views, styles and branding, you need to make a fully customized version (see Customize FA Client Portal in FA Developer guide).

title: Related links
body: Customize FA Client Portal in FA Developer guide

title: Related links
body: FA Client Portal

title: FA Front setup
body: FA Front setup

title: Add warnings for NAV calculation
body: The default decision table contains several types of warnings which you can adjust. For more information about each warning type, see View warnings in FA Fund Management. You can adjust, for example, the percentage by which a security price can change before causing a warning, or the list of securities that should be excluded when checking that a market price history exists.

title: Adjust the warnings
body: To adjust the warnings, you need to download and edit the default decision table before uploading it into the FA system. Download the default decision table:

title: Adjust the warnings
body: fa-decisiontable-fundrules.xlsx

title: Adjust the warnings
body: To adjust the warnings, do the following:

title: Adjust the warnings
body: Open the XLSX file you downloaded and adjust the warnings as needed.

title: Adjust the warnings
body: Upload the file to the document bank (FundRules folder). If the folder does not exist yet, create it by uploading your file and renaming it by adding "FundRules/" in front of the file name (for example: "FundRules/myfile.xlsx").

title: Adjust the warnings
body: After uploading the file, go to the GraphQL for API view and run the following code:

title: Adjust the warnings
body: mutation updateRules{ reloadFundRules }.

title: Set up user access to FA Advisor
body: Users of FA Advisor need the correct rights to access the app and its functionalities such as trading on behalf of customers.

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: To access FA Advisor, a user needs the correct rights in FA Admin Console. To provide a user access to FA Advisor, do the following:

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: Ensure the FA Advisor application is enabled. Contact FA if you need to enable it.

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: In FA Admin Console, assign the user the ROLE_USER right within the FA Advisor role (see Access to FA functionality in FA Admin guide).

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: If limited visibility is in use, it also applies to FA Advisor and the user can see the same customers as in FA Back (see Access for employees in FA Admin guide).

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: To trade on behalf of customers in FA Advisor, a user needs to have the rights to impersonate customers in FA Client Portal. To provide a user access, do the following:

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: Make sure the user has access to FA Advisor (see Access to FA Advisor).

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: In FA Admin Console, assign the user the following rights (see Access to FA functionality):

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: ROLE_CLIENT_PORTAL_IMPERSONATE within the FA Back role.

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: ROLE_IMPERSONATE within the FA Client Portal role.

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: Make sure necessary features like trading are enabled for the user in FA Client Portal (see Enable features for FA Client Portal users).

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: The user can now access a customer's investments via FA Client Portal and trade on their behalf. A banner at the top of the view shows what the user has the rights to do with green checkmarks (buy, sell, switch, deposit, withdraw, and cancel orders).

title: Enable features for FA Advisor users
body: You can enable features like report generation and document signing for FA Advisor users.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: To enable FA Advisor users to generate reports, you need to make them available in FA Back:

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Go to New → New report and select the report packages or combined report packages you want to make available to generate in FA Advisor.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Fill in the fields. You don't need to define the Customer, group, portfolio or Date period fields. For field descriptions, see Report window in FA Back reference.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Tick the Available in other applications checkbox.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Click Generate report.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: After the reports are made available in FA Advisor, users can generate and download them according to their needs.

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: When FA Advisor users trade on behalf of customers via FA Client Portal, the trade orders they create need to be signed by customers before being executed. To enable sending trade orders for signing, do the following:

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: Make sure the FA Advisor user has access to trading via FA Client Portal (see Access to trading via FA Client Portal).

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: Set up document signing in FA Back (see Document signing in FA User guide). The signing functionality is provided through Signicat services which need to be configured by FA.

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: After the document signing functionality is enabled, customers receive signing requests for trade orders created by FA Advisor users.

title: Enable features for FA Advisor users
body: You can enable features like report generation and document signing for FA Advisor users.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: To enable FA Advisor users to generate reports, you need to make them available in FA Back:

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Go to New → New report and select the report packages or combined report packages you want to make available to generate in FA Advisor.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Fill in the fields. You don't need to define the Customer, group, portfolio or Date period fields. For field descriptions, see Report window in FA Back reference.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Tick the Available in other applications checkbox.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Click Generate report.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: After the reports are made available in FA Advisor, users can generate and download them according to their needs.

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: When FA Advisor users trade on behalf of customers via FA Client Portal, the trade orders they create need to be signed by customers before being executed. To enable sending trade orders for signing, do the following:

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: Make sure the FA Advisor user has access to trading via FA Client Portal (see Access to trading via FA Client Portal).

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: Set up document signing in FA Back (see Document signing in FA User guide). The signing functionality is provided through Signicat services which need to be configured by FA.

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: After the document signing functionality is enabled, customers receive signing requests for trade orders created by FA Advisor users.

title: Audit search view
body: The Audit search view allows you to access audit logs that track user activity and system events such as report data and market price updates in FA apps. To view the list of logged events, see FA audit logs.

title: Viewing options
body: You can:

title: Viewing options
body: Search the table by user, target ID, or applications (fields at the top) or the quick search bar (indicated by the icon).

title: Viewing options
body: Refresh the table content by clicking at the top right.

title: Viewing options
body: Export the audit logs as an XLSX file by clicking Export.

title: Viewing options
body: Adjust the table (see Adjust the view) and group the table information by certain columns (click on and then Group by).

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view
body: Sort by clicking the column name.

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust table row density ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Filter the table based on column content ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Search the table with the search fields at the top of the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click and enter a name for the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click Save.

title: Adjust the view
body: The adjustments are saved as a view, including the search fields at the top. You can now:

title: Adjust the view
body: Set a saved view as the default. To do this, click the Saved views field or , and then click the star icon next to the saved view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: Audit search results
body: The available columns are:

title: Audit search results
body: Action

title: Audit search results
body: The type of action performed by the user, such as logging in, creating a portfolio, generating a report, or calculating NAV.

title: Audit search results
body: Application

title: Audit search results
body: FA app where the action was performed.

title: Audit search results
body: Attachment

title: Audit search results
body: Attachment with the log details. You can download the attachment as a TXT file by clicking or preview the attachment in the side pane by clicking .

title: Audit search results
body: Component ID

title: Audit search results
body: The system component where the action was performed.

title: Audit search results
body: Event ID

title: Audit search results
body: Reference of the event that generated the log.

title: Audit search results
body: Log level

title: Audit search results
body: The log levels to view: "info", "warn" or "error".

title: Audit search results
body: Log time

title: Audit search results
body: The date and time of the user action.

title: Audit search results
body: Message

title: Audit search results
body: Log message describing the user action. You can expand long messages by clicking and Expand all messages.

title: Audit search results
body: IP address

title: Audit search results
body: User's IP address.

title: Audit search results
body: View

title: Audit search results
body: The application view where the action was performed.

title: Audit search results
body: Source

title: Audit search results
body: The log table where the action was recorded. Audit user log records user actions. Audit system log records system operations. For details, see Track what customer information has been viewed or exported in FA Back reference.

title: Audit search results
body: Target ID

title: Audit search results
body: The ID of the object the user viewed, modified, or created – for example, portfolio ID or transaction ID.

title: Audit search results
body: Target type

title: Audit search results
body: The type of object the user viewed, modified, or created – for example, portfolio or transaction.

title: Audit search results
body: User

title: Audit search results
body: User ID.

title: User management view
body: The User management view allows you to manage FA Platform users and their access rights to applications. The following sections describe what viewing options you have, how to manage users, how to assign user roles, how to manage user authentication, and how to manage user and account information.

title: Viewing options
body: You can:

title: Viewing options
body: Search for users by their user ID, first name, last name, and email (fields at the top).

title: Viewing options
body: Refresh the table content by clicking at the top right.

title: Viewing options
body: Export the user information as an XLSX file.

title: Viewing options
body: For the whole table, click Export → Download as XLSX.

title: Viewing options
body: For specific rows, select users and click Export → Download as XLSX.

title: Viewing options
body: Adjust the table (see Adjust the view).

title: Manage users and roles
body: You can add new users in the system and deactivate or delete existing users.

title: Add a user
body: To create a user account:

title: Add a user
body: Click Add user at the top-right corner and fill in the user information:

title: Add a user
body: The User ID used as a username at login and Email (required fields).

title: Add a user
body: Linked contact to set up access to client data or access to FA Front access with the external identity provider.

title: Add a user
body: Other fields if needed. See User details and account information for details.

title: Add a user
body: Click Edit user roles in the User details pane and choose which apps your user can access and with what roles.

title: Add a user
body: To access an app, a user needs a role for it – a user without any roles can't access any application.

title: Add a user
body: Let the user know about their credentials and how to get a password.

title: Add a user
body: Send them the user ID – FA platform doesn't send this information automatically.

title: Add a user
body: Instruct the user to request a password reset link by clicking Forgot password on the login page.

title: Deactivate a user
body: If a user doesn't need to access the platform anymore, we recommend deactivating their account rather than deleting it – this maintains the user's history while preventing them from accessing FA.

title: Deactivate a user
body: To change the status for multiple users, choose the users in the table and click . To change the status for one user, click in the User details pane. You can see the user's status in the table:

title: Deactivate a user
body: Active – The user can log in to the FA platform.

title: Deactivate a user
body: Inactive – The user can't log in to the FA platform.

title: Delete a user
body: Deleting a user removes all user information from the system. A deleted user can’t log in. If you just want to disable a user and prevent them from logging in, consider deactivating the user instead of deleting the account. To delete a user, click in the User details pane.

title: Assign user roles
body: The Roles block in the User details pane shows the roles assigned to the user. Roles determine:

title: Assign user roles
body: The app the user can access. To access an app, the user needs at least one role within that app. For example, if a user has a right in FA Back, the user is allowed to access FA Back.

title: Assign user roles
body: The access rights within the app. For example, FA Back roles determine access rights through permission and FA Front roles determine access rights through the views defined for the role.

title: Assign user roles
body: To add or remove the user’s roles, click Edit user roles at the top of the User details pane.

title: Manage authentication
body: You can manage user authentication using the following options:

title: Password reset
body: You can force the user to reset their password on next login. To force a password reset for multiple users, choose the users in the table and click . To force password reset for a selected user, click in the User details pane, choose Force password reset on next login and save the changes.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Two-factor authentication is a login option that requires entering a verification code in addition to the basic credentials (user ID and password). You can check two-factor authentication status in the User details pane:

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disabled – Two-factor authentication is turned off.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enabled – Two-factor authentication is turned on. The user has logged in and completed the mobile authenticator setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Pending – Two-factor authentication is turned on. You chose “Enable two-factor authentication on next login”, but the user didn’t yet log in to complete the setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: To manage two-factor authentication, use the buttons (available depending on the two-factor authentication status):

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication on the next login for the user.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication request that is pending.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication for the user.

title: Brute force detection
body: FA Platform uses brute force detection to identify attempts to guess a user’s password. Brute force detection temporarily disables the user's account after a certain number and frequency of login failures. The user account is disabled for one minute if:

title: Brute force detection
body: The user enters incorrect credentials twice within a second. This means that someone tries to guess the password programmatically.

title: Brute force detection
body: The user fails to enter correct credentials 5 times. After the account is disabled, every unsuccessful attempt increases the lock by one minute, up to one hour.

title: Brute force detection
body: To check if a user account is disabled by the brute force detection, open the User details pane and go to the Brute force detection section. It includes the following information:

title: Brute force detection
body: Status

title: Brute force detection
body: Brute force detection status of the user account: Blocked (deactivated by brute force detection), or Unblocked (active). A user blocked by brute force detection has to wait for up to 1 hour (depending on the number of unsuccessful login attempts) for the account to be unblocked.

title: Brute force detection
body: Total login attempts

title: Brute force detection
body: The number of failed login attempts.

title: Brute force detection
body: Last attempt

title: Brute force detection
body: The date and time of the last login attempt.

title: Brute force detection
body: IP address

title: Brute force detection
body: The IP address from which the last login attempt was made.

title: Brute force detection
body: To activate a blocked user account, choose Unblock and activate. Once unblocked, your user can log in again without waiting for the system to unblock the user after a certain time.

title: User details and account information
body: You can view or edit a user's information by clicking on them in the table (the User details sidepane opens). The following user information is available:

title: User account information
body: User ID (required)

title: User account information
body: A unique user ID for logging in to FA and log the user's activities.

title: User account information
body: Email (required)

title: User account information
body: The user’s email to send a password reset link to the user, if the user clicks Forgot password on the login page.

title: User account information
body: First name, Last name

title: User account information
body: The user’s first and last name.

title: User account information
body: Linked contact

title: User account information
body: The corresponding contact in FA Back. Linked contact is needed to:

title: User account information
body: Grant access only to certain customers and portfolios (see the Set up limited visibility for one user and Set up limited visibility for many users sections in the FA Admin guide).

title: User account information
body: Allow online end users to view their own investments in FA Front. A user that has a linked contact has access to the investment information associated with this contact.

title: User account information
body: Linked contact external ID

title: User account information
body: The user’s external ID received from the external identity provider when the user logs in to FA Front. External ID is used to find a matching contact for the user. If you see this field, this means that FA failed to link a contact to the user. For example, there is no contact with such an ID or there are several contacts with this ID stored in FA. In this case, you can add a contact manually in the Linked contact field.

title: User account information
body: Status

title: User account information
body: The user account status: active (the user can log in to FA) or inactive (the user can't log in to the system). See Assign user roles for details.

title: Sessions
body: The Sessions block shows a list of currently active sessions for the user. For example, the same user might have logged in with different browsers, having multiple sessions open at the same time. The list shows:

title: Sessions
body: Application

title: Sessions
body: The apps where the user is logged in within the session. For example, the user might have FA Back and FA Front open in different tabs in the same browser, accessing both applications with a single login and a single session.

title: Sessions
body: Last access

title: Sessions
body: The date and time the user accessed an app within the session. If the user accesses only one app, this shows the time they logged in, or if your user accesses multiple apps, this shows the time the user last opened a new app.

title: Sessions
body: IP address

title: Sessions
body: Shows the IP address the user is logged in from.

title: Sessions
body: You can log the user out of all sessions by clicking Log out user from all sessions. The user will be able to use FA for a short time until their authentication expires, then they will get a "communication problem" and will be taken to the login page.

title: Last logins
body: The Last logins block shows date and time of the five last user logins.

title: Related links
body: Managing users in FA Admin guide

title: Related links
body: Authentication in FA Admin guide

title: Process monitoring view
body: The Process monitoring view provides visibility into processes that take place in FA applications. You can see which processes were run, how long they took, and if were completed successfully. If a process is ongoing, you can see details about its progress and evaluate how long it may take. The view also provides input for monitoring the performance of processes over time.

title: Process monitoring view
body: The system monitors processes such as user-triggered and scheduled processes, authority and client reporting, and custom processes. For example, for nightly price updates and report calculation, the monitoring tracks the process through the following stages:

title: Process monitoring view
body: Start

title: Process monitoring view
body: Fetch active portfolios

title: Process monitoring view
body: Handle market data connector 1 (if enabled)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Find applicable securities

title: Process monitoring view
body: Fetch and save close prices

title: Process monitoring view
body: Update cashflow securities

title: Process monitoring view
body: Handle market data connector 2 (if enabled)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Handle market data connector 3 (if enabled)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Update discount factors (if no connectors 1-3 defined)

title: Process monitoring view
body: Schedule report updates

title: Process monitoring view
body: End

title: Tracked processes
body: The initial release of this feature covers the following processes, but the coverage will be expanded in future releases:

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV calculation

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV acceptance

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV rollback

title: Tracked processes
body: Run deferrals

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV rejection

title: Tracked processes
body: NAV acceptance interruption and NAV rollback

title: Tracked processes
body: Corporate actions

title: Tracked processes
body: Nightly price update and report calculation

title: View the process timeline
body: In the Process monitoring view, you can see the timeline of process runs during a given period by choosing the start and end dates. To view information about a specific process, select the application it relates to. You can filter the list down by selecting a single process type, instance, or status. You can also adjust the time scale of the process timeline by using the slider on the right.

title: View the process timeline
body: The status of a process run can be ongoing (blue), completed (green), canceled (grey), or error (red). Click on the process to view its information: start and end times of a run, its completion status, duration, and the user who executed it. You can expand the process run to see the stages.

title: View process details
body: To view the details of a process run or stage, click in the Actions column. The details shown depend on the process. For example, for the NAV acceptance process, you can see the date on which the NAV was accepted. If the run failed, you can view the error message. If the process was canceled, the details show the user who canceled it.

title: Process information
body: The following information is available in the Process monitoring view:

title: Process information
body: Start time

title: Process information
body: The start date and time of the run.

title: Process information
body: End time

title: Process information
body: The end date and time of the run.

title: Process information
body: Status

title: Process information
body: The run status. If the run was successful, the status is "Completed". If the run was canceled by a user, the status is "Canceled". If the run was unsuccessful, the status is "Error". If the run has not finished yet, the status is "Ongoing".

title: Process information
body: Duration

title: Process information
body: The duration of the run in minutes, seconds, and milliseconds.

title: Process information
body: User

title: Process information
body: The username of the user who executed the run.

title: Process information
body: Actions

title: Process information
body: The Actions column shows the button to open process run or stage details.

title: Process information
body: Canceled by

title: Process information
body: If the run was canceled, the username of the user who canceled it.

title: Related links
body: Administer processes in FA Admin guide

title: Rights window

title: Rights window

The list of user rights shows the name of each right in the system, its description and the permissions it provides, and if the right works with limited visibility (indicated by a green checkmark in the "Limited visibility" column).

title: Analyze profit and loss

title: Set up the table

title: 2. Select columns
body: Click Columns on the right and select the columns from Portfolio details, Security details and Position details. For the full list of columns, see Position data in the PnL view.

title: 3. Group position rows

title: 4. Filter and sort

title: 4. Filter and sort

title: Rebalance portfolios against strategy in FA Invest
body: Strategy rebalancing makes sure your portfolio follows allocation shares defined in the strategy. If an asset type is below or above the target, the system suggests buys or sells for the securities in the asset type. If an asset type is missing from the portfolio (for example, the strategy requires 10% Finnish stocks but the portfolio doesn't have any), the system suggests equally-sized trade orders for each security in the missing asset type from your buy list.

title: Rebalance portfolios against strategy in FA Invest
body: Strategy rebalancing doesn't adjust holdings within the asset type. For example, if Finnish holdings in the portfolio are represented by one security, rebalancing considers this sufficient. It doesn't suggest sells to buy other Finnish stocks from the buy list.

title: Rebalance portfolios against strategy in FA Invest
body: Strategy rebalancing works only for equity portfolios. It should not be used with funds and ETFs that are allocated to several asset types (for example, a fund security can be allocated as 70% US and 30% Canada).

title: Rebalance options
body: Buy with

title: Rebalance options
body: Cash to use for buys:

title: Rebalance options
body: Current cash only. With this option, you can align the portfolio with the model in two rounds. First, the system sells the excess positions and buys with the current cash. After executing the sells and acquiring cash, the second round buys more positions with the newly available cash to rebalance the portfolio fully.

title: Rebalance options
body: Existing outstanding trade orders (all statuses except "Open") affect rebalancing in the following way:

title: Rebalance options
body: Buy trade orders reduce the current cash.

title: Rebalance options
body: Outstanding trade orders with the same type are taken into account when the system suggests buys and sells. For example, if you should buy a security but you already have a buy trade order for it, the trade amount of the outstanding order is subtracted from the suggested order.

title: Rebalance options
body: Cash from sells only. With this option, you can sell a portfolio position that is above the target and buy a position that is below the target with the cash you expect to get from selling. You can also rebalance one position and swap it for another without rebalancing your entire portfolio. Cash from suggested sells is estimated based on the latest market prices.

title: Rebalance options
body: This method requires careful trade order management to ensure you have enough cash to complete the buys.

title: Rebalance options
body: Existing outstanding trade orders (all statuses except "Open") affect rebalancing in the following way:

title: Rebalance options
body: Outstanding trade orders with the same type are taken into account when the system suggests buys and sells. For example, if you should buy a security but you already have a buy trade order for it, the trade amount of the outstanding order is subtracted from the suggested order.

title: Rebalance options
body: Current cash and cash from sells. With this option, you can align the portfolio with the model in one go. Cash from suggested sells is estimated based on the latest prices.

title: Rebalance options
body: This method requires careful trade order management to ensure you settle the trades promptly and have enough cash to complete the buys. To mitigate the risk, you can set a limit on the cash from sells to use for buys during a full rebalance. For example, instead of counting sell values at 100%, you can count them at 95%. If the prices drop between rebalancing and executing sales, you'll likely still have enough cash to complete your buys. See Preference - Portfolios in FA Back for details.

title: Rebalance options
body: Existing outstanding trade orders (all statuses except "Open") affect rebalancing in the following way:

title: Rebalance options
body: Buy trade orders reduce the current cash.

title: Rebalance options
body: Outstanding trade orders with the same type are taken into account when the system suggests buys and sells. For example, if you should buy a security but you already have a buy trade order for it, the trade amount of the outstanding order is subtracted from the suggested order.

title: Rebalance options
body: Current cash, cash from sells and from orders. With this option, you can align the portfolio at once, considering the effect of outstanding orders. Before rebalancing, the system calculates expected positions. It sells any expected excess positions and buys with the cash expected to be available after executing these orders.Cash from suggested sells and outstanding trade orders (all statuses except "Open") is estimated based on the latest prices.

title: Rebalance options
body: This method requires careful trade order management to ensure you have enough cash to complete the buys.

title: Rebalance options
body: Use cash from accounts

title: Rebalance options
body: Accounts to use for buys if you select to buy with extra cash in the portfolio. This option allows you to keep your portfolio fully invested and exclude certain accounts (for example, accrued fee accounts) from rebalancing.

title: Rebalance options
body: "All accounts" – Use cash on all accounts. You can choose to use available credit or repay the used credit (see the Use portfolio credit field below).

title: Rebalance options
body: "Cash accounts" – Use cash on the accounts marked as "cash accounts" in the Portfolio window, Accounts tab.

title: Rebalance options
body: "Cash and credit accounts" – Use cash on cash and credit accounts. You can choose to use available credit or repay the used credit (see the Use portfolio credit field below).

title: Rebalance options
body: "Default account only" – Use cash on the portfolio's default account – the first account in the list in the Portfolio window, Accounts tab. If this account is a credit account, you can choose to use available credit or repay the used credit (see the Use portfolio credit field below).

title: Rebalance options
body: Filter out small trade orders based on

title: Rebalance options
body: The minimum size for the trade orders that rebalancing should create. The size restrictions don't apply if you sell an entire position away from the portfolio (see Selling an entire position). Set the minimum difference between the portfolio position and the model as:

title: Rebalance options
body: "Diff %pt" – The difference in percentage points.

title: Rebalance options
body: "Diff %" – The relative difference in percentage.

title: Rebalance options
body: "Trade amount" – The minimum trade amount in portfolio currency. Alternatively, you can define a Minimum trade amount for each of your securities in FA Back (see Security window).

title: Rebalance options
body: "Model min/max share" – The difference defined with the minimum and maximum thresholds in the model. Trade orders are created only if the position deviates outside of the minimum and maximum thresholds. The minimum trade amount for each trade order is calculated as follows:

title: Rebalance options
body: For "buy": ( target share - min share ) * portfolio value

title: Rebalance options
body: For "sell": ( max share - target share ) * portfolio value

title: Rebalance options
body: Positions that don't have the thresholds specified in the model are rebalanced without filtering when "Position is within min/max share" is selected.

title: Rebalance options
body: Apply fees to trade orders

title: Rebalance options
body: An option to calculate fees, or to estimate the effect of an upcoming fee when generating buy and sell trade orders. If a fee is calculated, the effect of the fee is taken into account when determining how many units you can buy with you available cash and how much money you get from sells. This allows you to estimate the effects of upcoming transaction fees more accurately. Fees are also saved in the Fees field for each trade order.

title: Rebalance options
body: "No fees" – Don't include fees in trade orders.

title: Rebalance options
body: "Portfolio-specific fees" – Include a transaction fee defined for the portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Fees tab).

title: Rebalance options
body: "Fixed fees" – Include a fee defined as a percentage in the field available next to the selection.

title: Adjust target values
body: If needed, you can adjust the target values further by adding positions or editing values:

title: Adjust target values
body: To add a position in the list, click Add position. Select the security and portfolio and click Add. Remember that yo can add all securities that are included in the strategy buy list by selecting Include all positions from model .

title: Adjust target values
body: To exclude some positions from rebalancing, select the rows and click Exclude positions.

title: Adjust target values
body: To adjust target values one by one, edit the Target values section of the table.

title: Adjust target values
body: To adjust several position values, select the asset type positions and click Edit positions. Fill in the fields:

title: Adjustment fields
body: Column

title: Adjustment fields
body: The value you want to adjust:

title: Adjustment fields
body: Share of pf. % – Enter target position share.

title: Adjustment fields
body: Units – Enter target number of units.

title: Adjustment fields
body: Market value – Enter target market value.

title: Adjustment fields
body: Diff. share – Increase or decrease the target positions share the specified percentage (for decreasing, use the minus sign).

title: Adjustment fields
body: Diff. units – Increase or decrease target positions units by the specified number (for decreasing, use the minus sign).

title: Adjustment fields
body: Diff. market value – Increase or decrease positions market value by the specified amount (for decreasing, use the minus sign).

title: Adjustment fields
body: Value

title: Adjustment fields
body: The adjustment value.

title: Adjustment fields
body: Method

title: Adjustment fields
body: The option to choose how the adjustment value is applied to the selected positions:

title: Adjustment fields
body: "Apply to all rows" – Apply the value to positions.

title: Adjustment fields
body: "Distribute the value evenly" – Divide the value equally among positions. For example, distribute €1,000 across 5 positions to add €200 to each.

title: Adjustment fields
body: "Distribute based on current position" – Distribute the value proportional to each position's current market value. Example: Distributing €100,000 ("Diff. market value") among positions with values of €50,000, €150,000, and €300,000 adds €10,000, €30,000, and €60,000, respectively.

title: Adjustment fields
body: "Distribute based on model position" – Distribute the value based on the model shares. Example: Distributing €100,000 ("Diff. market value") in a portfolio of €1,000,000 to positions with model shares of 10%, 20%, and 20% adds €20,000, €40,000, and €40,000.

title: Adjustment fields
body: "Distribute based on portfolio market value" – Distribute the value proportional to the portfolio’s total market value. Example: Adding 100 units ("Diff. units") of stock to portfolios with values of €1,000,000, €1,500,000, and €2,500,000 increases units by 20, 30, and 50, respectively.

title: Check and create suggested trade orders
body: Once you are satisfied with the target values you see, you can proceed to trade order preview.

body: If you want to ignore the cash balance and buy with negative cash if needed, select Ignore cash balance.

title: Check and create suggested trade orders
