body: The portfolio's default account is set as the account of the transaction.

title: Fee transaction's account
body: If no accounts can be found from the portfolio, then the shared accounts for the portfolio are used (available from FA 3.5 onward).

title: Description on statement
body: When creating asset management fee transactions with the fee calculation, the Description on statement field in the transaction created is filled in to describe the calculated asset management fee. The text in the field includes:

title: Description on statement
body: The calculation period of the asset management fee in a form dd.mm.yyyy - dd.mm.yyyy

title: Description on statement
body: The formula used to calculate the asset management fee in a form X.XX % x XXX.XX = XX.XX (the defined asset management fee percentage and the calculated average value of the portfolio, and the asset management fee as a product of these two values)

title: Example: Calculating fixed asset management fee
body: You can define multiple different cost formulas for the calculation of the asset management fee. One example of a possible definition of a cost formula is the definition of the formula for calculating the fixed asset management fee:

title: Example: Calculating fixed asset management fee
body: The fixed asset management fee is calculated from the average value of the portfolio during the calculation period. The average value of the portfolio is calculated from daily market values, including weekend. If no market price can be found for a security on a certain date, the latest market price for the security before the asset management calculation is used. If no market price is available, the unit price of the latest transaction related to the security is used. The asset management fee is always calculated in the portfolio currency, and the securities quoted in other currencies than the portfolio currency are valued with the exchange rate of each valuation date.

title: Example: Calculating fixed asset management fee
body: Formula for calculating the fixed asset management fee: Asset management fee = ka * pv / ACT * kvp / 100

title: Example: Calculating fixed asset management fee
body: pv = the number of days within the calculating period including weekends

title: Example: Calculating fixed asset management fee
body: kvp = fixed fee percentage or portfolio's asset management fee

title: Example: Calculating fixed asset management fee
body: ka = portfolio's average value during the calculation period

title: Example: Calculating fixed asset management fee
Rebalance view
body: Rebalance view shows you the rebalance history, or lists the rebalances conducted in the system. The rebalances are listed by default based on the rebalance date, newest first. Rebalance history shows:

title: Rebalance view
body: Creation date

title: Rebalance view
body: The date when the rebalance was conducted.

title: Rebalance view
body: User

title: Rebalance view
body: Username of the user who conducted the rebalance.

title: Rebalance view
body: Group, customer, portfolio

title: Rebalance view
body: Portfolios that were rebalanced (semicolon-separated list of portfolio IDs).

title: Rebalance view
body: Criteria for rebalancing

title: Rebalance view
body: Criteria the rebalance was conducted with (rest of the columns correspond with the criteria you can select in the Rebalance window, and indicate which selections the rebalance was conducted with).

title: Rebalance view
body: In addition, the following buttons are available at the bottom of the Rebalance view:

title: Rebalance view
body: Rebalancing

title: Rebalance view
body: Opens the Rebalance window for you to rebalance portfolios linked to a chosen model portfolio.

title: Rebalance view
body: Model portfolio

title: Rebalance view
body: Opens the Model portfolio window for modifying and adding model portfolios.

title: Rebalance view
body: You can filter the rebalance history to search for rebalances conducted on a specific date, conducted by a specific user, or involving a specific portfolio. In addition, you can use the rebalance memo to find the rebalance you are looking for.

title: Rebalance view
body: Users with limited visibility can only see the rebalances conducted by themselves or other users with the same role(s) - this ensures the users are not able to access information on portfolios that they are not allowed to access. For more information about limited visibility, see Set up limited visibility for one user and Set up limited visibility for many users.

title: Manage previous rebalances
body: You view the details of the rebalances conducted in the system, and delete previous rebalances.

title: Manage previous rebalances
body: To view details of a single rebalance, double-click the rebalance in the list. The window shows you the portfolio positions at the time of the rebalance, their share in the portfolio and in the model portfolio, and the target share used in rebalancing. You can backtrack each rebalance and determine what kind of information the rebalance was based on.

title: Manage previous rebalances
body: To view the list of trade orders created with the rebalance, click Show trade orders. The list shows the trade orders that are still available in the system. If you delete the trade orders manually (or rebalance the portfolio again, which overrides "Open" trade orders), the list might not show anything. Deleting trade orders created based on a rebalance doesn't delete the entry in the rebalance history.

title: Manage previous rebalances
body: You can delete the whole rebalance entry by clicking – this removes the row from the list and deletes all trade orders and transactions created based on the rebalance. Deleting a rebalance removes it from the history. You can't reverse deleting a rebalance. Deleting a rebalance can be useful, for example, if you accidentally rebalanced all your portfolios or conducted a large rebalance with incorrect parameters - however, proceed with caution when deleting a rebalance to avoid making mistakes.

title: Rebalance window
body: You can create model portfolios, strategies or investment plans and use them to keep your investment portfolios in balance. Rebalancing creates trade orders to buy and sell securities according to the model. For general information about rebalancing approaches and for instructions, see Rebalance in FA User guide.

title: Rebalance window
body: The Rebalance window allows you to define the rebalance parameters and the securities to rebalance. The window lists securities in the portfolio or in the model linked to the rebalanced portfolio and indicates the shares of these securities in the investment portfolio and model. The portfolio account is also included in rebalancing.

title: Rebalance window
body: At the top of the Rebalance window, you can define the rebalancing parameters.

title: Affected portfolios
body: Affected portfolios

title: Affected portfolios
body: The Affected portfolios section defines which portfolios are rebalanced.

title: Affected portfolios
body: Rebalance against

title: Affected portfolios
body: Target for rebalancing, in order of descending priority. The system uses the first target in the list if defined. Otherwise, the system the target with the next highest priority. The targets can be:

title: Affected portfolios
body: "Model portfolio", "Investment plan", "Strategy" – Model portfolio, investment plan or strategy linked to the portfolio.

title: Affected portfolios
body: "Portfolio itself" – Target shares you specify in the Rebalance window.

title: Affected portfolios
body: "Empty portfolio" – An option to empty the portfolio – this will set all the new shares as 0% and sell everything, regardless of the linked model or plan.

title: Affected portfolios
body: Invest

title: Affected portfolios
body: invest

title: Affected portfolios
body: Include sub-portfolios

title: Affected portfolios
body: Aggregates positions and investment plan/ model portfolio contents also from the rebalanced portfolio's subportfolios. This allows you to divide holdings into subportfolios and rebalance everything at once through the main portfolio. Trade orders are created either to the main portfolio or the sub-portfolios based on which portfolio or portfolio's investment plan / model portfolio the trade order's security can be found in: for sells of existing positions, trade orders are created in the same portfolio where the position currently is, and for buys, trade orders are created in the same portfolio which has the position in the investment plan / model portfolio.

title: Affected portfolios
body: Asset group

title: Affected portfolios
body: The asset group the strategy is based on (for example, geographical, industry, or asset class).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Rebalance parameters

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The Rebalance parameters section defines rebalancing logic.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Date

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The rebalancing date. This date affects:

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The market prices, rebalanced portfolio shares, trade order amounts. The percentage shares of securities in the portfolio are determined based on the market prices on the rebalancing date. The market prices on this date are used to calculate the amount in the suggested trade orders.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The content of the model portfolio/ investment plan. The target shares are fetched based on the selected rebalancing date

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Restrict rebalancing to accounts

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Restrict rebalancing to only reach the target level for portfolio accounts, without any other buys or sells. This feature has different effects depending on the rebalance method (buying with extra cash or using cash from sells) – see Choose rebalance method.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: With the conservative rebalancing method, securities are bought and sold only to achieve the target level of the account. If the account has excess cash, the selected securities (largest first) are bought as long as there is available cash but nothing is sold. If the account has a lack of cash, the selected securities (largest first) are sold until the account reaches the target level - nothing is bought and securities are sold only to rebalance the account to the defined level.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: With the exchange method, if the account balance is below the target, it is first rebalanced with sells. After this, the excess cash from sells is used to buy the securities to be rebalanced, but securities are sold only to cover all the necessary buys. If there are Executable sell trade orders, the cash coming in from these is taken into account when selling the securities.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: With full rebalance, if the account balance is below the target, it is first rebalanced with sells. After this, the excess cash from sells is used to buy the securities to be rebalanced, but securities are sold only to cover all the necessary buys.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: You can also define the rebalance settings in Preference ("Define target range for portfolio's cash balance", "Define how much negative cash balance is increased by to cover all negative cash" and "Define how much positive cash balance is decreased by to ensure positive cash balance"). These preferences determine how rebalancing tries to achieve the target level for accounts. See Rebalancing for details.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Rebalance method

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Rebalancing approach: conservative rebalance, full rebalance, full rebalance including outstanding orders, exchange, invest cash, cover for cash, and model change (see Choose rebalance method).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Filter out small trade orders based on

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The minimum size for the trade orders that rebalancing should create. The size restrictions don't apply if you sell an entire position away from the portfolio (see Selling an entire position). Set the minimum difference between the portfolio position and the model as:

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Minimum change % (absolute/ percentage points)" - The difference in percentage points.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Minimum change % (relative / percentage change)" - The relative difference in percentage.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Minimum trade amount" - The minimum trade amount in portfolio currency. Alternatively, you can define a Minimum trade amount for each of your securities (see Security window).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Position is within min/max share" - The difference defined with the minimum and maximum thresholds in the model. Trade orders are created only if your position deviates outside of the minimum and maximum thresholds. The minimum trade amount for each trade order is calculated as follows:

title: Rebalance parameters
body: For "buy": ( target share - min share ) * portfolio value

title: Rebalance parameters
body: For "sell": ( max share - target share ) * portfolio value

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Positions that don't have the thresholds specified int the model are rebalanced without filtering when "Position is within min/max share" is selected.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Use cash from accounts

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Accounts to use for buys if you select to buy with extra cash in the portfolio. This option allows you to keep your portfolio fully invested and exclude certain accounts (for example, accrued fee accounts) from rebalancing.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "All accounts" – Use cash on all accounts. You can choose to use available credit or repay the used credit (see the Use portfolio credit field below).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Cash accounts" – Use cash on the accounts marked as "cash accounts" in the Portfolio window, Accounts tab.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Cash and credit accounts" – Use cash on cash and credit accounts. You can choose to use available credit or repay the used credit (see the Use portfolio credit field below).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Default account only" – Use cash on the portfolio's default account – the first account in the list in the Portfolio window, Accounts tab. If this account is a credit account, you can choose to use available credit or repay the used credit (see the Use portfolio credit field below).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Use portfolio credit

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Use credit account for buys. Choose if you want to use the positive account balance and available credit for buys, and if you want to cover the negative balance. The option is shown if you selected "All accounts", "Cash and credit accounts" or "Default account only" in Use cash from accounts.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Don't use portfolio credit" – Use only positive balance on the credit account for buys, without repaying the used credit.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Use portfolio credit" – Use available credit and positive balance on the credit account for buys, without repaying the used credit.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Repay portfolio credit" – Use positive balance on the credit account. In case of negative balance, rebalance the credit account account to 0. The cash is rebalanced to the default portfolio account, and you can then repay the credit manually. If a portfolio has no accounts other than the credit account, the credit is repaid automatically.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Calculate fees to trade orders

title: Rebalance parameters
body: An option to calculate fees, or to estimate the effect of an upcoming fee when generating buy and sell trade orders. If a fee is calculated, the effect of the fee is taken into account when determining how many units you can buy with you available cash and how much money you get from sells. This allows you to estimate the effects of upcoming transaction fees more accurately. Fees are also saved in the Fees field for each trade order.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Don't calculate fees" - Don't calculate fees in trade orders.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Calculate portfolio specific fees" - Calculate a transaction fee defined in the portfolio (Portfolio window, Fees tab).

title: Rebalance parameters
body: "Calculate fixed fees" - Calculate a fee defined as a percentage in the field available next to the selection.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Use security minimum trade amount

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Option to set the minimum trade amount of the security as the minimum trade order amount. A trade order is only created if the amount is at least equal to the security minimum trade amount. If you also use "Minimum trade amount" for Filter out small trade orders based on, rebalancing first applies the filter and then checks the security minimum trade amount.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: The system starts rebalancing from the largest potential trade order and works towards the smallest one. If both settings are enabled, the system does the two checks and if a trade order fails them, the following logic is used:

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Filter out the trade order without reallocating the trade order if the minimum trade amount is not reached. If the last security to rebalance fails, the trade order is always filtered out.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Reallocate the trade order amount if the security minimum trade amount is not reached.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Example 1: The rebalancing amount is 550. Minimum trade amount is 100. Security minimum trade amount is 600. The system first checks if 550 > 100 (true), and then checks if 550 > 600 (false). No trade order is created.

title: Rebalance parameters
body: Example 2: The rebalancing amount is 550. Minimum trade amount is 100. Security minimum trade amount is 300. The system first checks if 550 > 100 (true), and then checks if 550 > 300 (true). The system creates a trade order.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Trade order parameters

title: Trade order parameters
body: Trade order parameters section includes criteria for defining how trade orders are created

title: Trade order parameters
body: Set accounts to trade orders

title: Trade order parameters
body: An option to define accounts for trade orders (Account field):

title: Trade order parameters
body: "Don't set accounts to trade orders" - Create trade orders with "No account".

title: Trade order parameters
body: "Set the default account to trade orders" - Set the portfolio's default account – the first account in the list in the Portfolio window, Accounts tab.

title: Trade order parameters
body: "Set the currency account (or default account) to trade orders" - Use the account with the same currency as the trade order. If such account doesn't exist, this option uses the default account of the portfolio. If the portfolio doesn't have accounts, then the shared accounts for the portfolio are used in the same order: first using the shared account with the same currency as the trade order, and if not found, then using the shared default account.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Create trade orders with status

title: Trade order parameters
body: The status of trade orders.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Set trade order tags

title: Trade order parameters
body: Tags to add to trade orders. For example, you can use tags to mark trade orders with execution instructions.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Set portfolio tags

title: Trade order parameters
body: Tags to add to portfolios affected by rebalancing. This allows you to for example mark the rebalanced portfolios.

title: Trade order parameters
body: Rebalance memo

title: Trade order parameters
body: Comments and notes on your rebalances, for example, references. Memos are stored in the Rebalance view, which allows you to search for conducted rebalances.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: The bottom of the Rebalance window shows a summary of the positions of the rebalanced portfolio(s). The rebalanced portfolios' positions are grouped per rebalanced portfolio: the icon next to the portfolio ID indicates whether the portfolio is rebalanced against model portfolio, investment plan or portfolio itself, and moving your mouse above a portfolio provides you with more details on how the portfolio is rebalanced, such as the name of the linked model portfolio and the full name of the rebalanced portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: The content is divided into columns:

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Security - Position affected by the rebalance (a position in the portfolio or a position in the model).

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Amount – The current amount (number of units) of the security in the portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Purchase value – The current purchase value of the position in the portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: MPrice – The latest available market unit price of the security, with the date (and time) of the price shown in parentheses.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Market val. – The total market value of the position in the portfolio with the latest available market price.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Change - The change between the purchase value and the market value of the position.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Share % – The current percentage share of the position in the portfolio, calculated with the current market price from the total value of the portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Min % and Max % – The minimum and maximum thresholds defined for the position in its investment plan or model portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Model % – The share of the security in the model portfolio or investment plan.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: New % – Target share. The field shows the percentage share of the security in the model, if any model is linked to the portfolio. Otherwise, the percentage share of the security in the portfolio is shown. You can edit the value before rebalancing the portfolio and creating trade orders.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Difference % – The percentage difference between the percentage shares of the security between the portfolio and the model portfolio.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: Difference - The difference between the shares of the security in the portfolio and the model portfolio in portfolio currency.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: You can select portfolios and the positions to include in rebalancing.

title: Summary of the rebalanced portfolios
body: When the information for the rebalancing is defined and manually adjusted if necessary, the investment portfolios are rebalanced and trade orders are suggested to be created with the Rebalance button.

title: Trade orders suggested by rebalancing
body: You can view the suggested trade orders after you click Rebalance. You can use filters to search for trade orders within the suggestion.

title: Trade orders suggested by rebalancing
body: Only visible trade orders are saved - to save all suggested trade orders, clear all filters.

title: Trade orders suggested by rebalancing
body: Saving the trade orders is done in the background - you can close the trade order listing and continue using FA while the trade orders are being created. Once the trade order creation is finished in the background, you will see a notification at the bottom-right corner of the view: "Trade orders done. Created trade orders: x.

title: Trade orders suggested by rebalancing
body: You can view the trade orders in the Trade orders view. If a portfolio is rebalanced again, Open trade orders are replaced with new trade orders.

title: Model portfolio window
body: Model portfolio preferences allow you to define model portfolio that are used to keep your investment portfolio in balance (see Rebalance portfolios against a model portfolio).

title: Model portfolio window
body: Existing model portfolios are listed by name on the left side of the Model portfolio window. To modify a model portfolio, select it from the list. To add a new model portfolio, click Add model portfolio.

title: Model portfolio information
body: The model portfolio information, both for fluctuating or fixed content, is defined in the fields in the right side of the window. You can only define either fluctuating or fixed content, not both. The following fields are available (fields marked with * are required):

title: Model portfolio information
body: Name*

title: Model portfolio information
body: The name of the model portfolio, which enables the model portfolio to be identified easily.

title: Model portfolio information
body: Code*

title: Model portfolio information
body: The individual model portfolio code that separates it from other model portfolios.

title: Model portfolio information
body: Linked portfolio (only when defining fluctuating shares)

title: Model portfolio information
body: Portfolio that represents the model portfolio (created in the system as a regular portfolio). If the contents of the model portfolio are not defined in this window, and a portfolio is linked to the model portfolio, the contents of the linked portfolio are used as the model portfolio contents. Linking a portfolio to the model portfolio allows updating the model portfolio contents and shares by updating the portfolio linked to the model portfolio.

title: Model portfolio information
body: Number of portfolios the model portfolio is linked to:

title: Model portfolio information
body: The number of portfolios linked to the model portfolio. The number indicates, how many portfolios the model portfolio is linked to, and how many portfolios are rebalanced against this portfolio.

title: Model portfolio information
body: Restrict this model portfolio to be shown to roles

title: Model portfolio information
body: Restrict the access to this model portfolio to only certain user roles. The list of user roles includes:

title: Model portfolio information
body: User roles assigned in the FA Admin Console app (for details, see Role management view).

title: Model portfolio information
body: Underlying system-level roles marked with # before the role name.

title: Model portfolio information
body: Date (only when defining fixed shares)

title: Model portfolio information
body: The date from which the model portfolio is valid (usually the creation or start date of the portfolio). The model portfolio can be updated by adding a new date and re-defining the positions of the model portfolio below this date: the updated model portfolio is valid from the new date onward.

title: Model portfolio information
body: Allow the sum of model portfolio shares other than 100%

title: Model portfolio information
body: When enabled, the model portfolio shares does not have to add up to 100%, allowing you to define partial or leveraged models. If your model portfolio doesn't add up to 100%, you are presented with a question Positions in your model portfolio add up to xx %. Do you want to save your model portfolio even though it does not add up to 100 %? to prevent you from unintentionally saving non-complete model portfolios.

title: Model portfolio shares
body: The table shows the model portfolio content – securities and their target shares. To include the portfolio's cash in rebalancing, add the currency security as a position and specify the target share. For example, if you have EUR accounts in your portfolio and want to have 1% cash in euros, add the currency security EUR with a target share of 1%.

title: Model portfolio shares
body: Security

title: Model portfolio shares
body: Security in the model portfolio.

title: Model portfolio shares
body: Share %

title: Model portfolio shares
body: The share of security in the model portfolio.

title: Model portfolio shares
body: Min share %, Max share %

title: Model portfolio shares
body: Minimum and maximum share of the security.

title: Export model portfolio
body: You can export model portfolio details and model portfolio shares as a CSV file by clicking Export and selecting Model portfolio details or Model portfolio shares. You can only export the details or shares of one model portfolio at a time.

title: Export model portfolio
body: The file format is described in File formats for importing model portfolios.

title: Related links
body: Rebalance portfolios against a model portfolio in FA User guide

title: Related links
body: Reporting in FA User guide

title: Report window
body: Report window allows you to generate reports - you can either generate individual reports, mass-generate reports to a group of portfolios, send reports via email, or publish reports to documents. Everything related to reporting is available in the Report window.

title: Report window
body: You can access the report window either from the New report option in the New menu, or from the New report icon on Overview and standard search views. In addition, you can open reports as tabs on the Overview.

title: Generate reports
body: To generate a report, start by selecting a report from the listing on the left. The reports listing allows you to select from:

title: Generate reports
body: Any standard reports (see Available standard reports).

title: Generate reports
body: Any query-based report templates you have saved from the Queries view. Report templates can only be used as a PDF, and are indicated in the listing with the suffix (PDF) after report template name.

title: Generate reports
body: Any PDF report template you have uploaded to the system. Report templates can only be used as a PDF, and are indicated in the listing with the suffix (PDF) after report template name.

title: Generate reports
body: Any custom reports developed for you.

title: Generate reports
body: Any custom report developed and published through JSReport.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Based on the report you selected, available report parameters on the right vary. Parameters that are available only for certain reports are shown below in brackets.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Some fields, for example, Transaction type or Security type, allow you to restrict the content of the report to show only certain kind of data - if not filled in, all data within your portfolio during the reporting time is included in the report.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Saved search

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Available if you run reports from the Transactions or Trade orders view). The saved search you want to create the report for. See Generate reports for transactions and trade orders in FA User guide for details.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Customer, Group, Portfolio*

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Available if you run reports from the top menu or from the Overview). Customer, group or portfolio you want to create the report for. You can set the report to be created for multiple customers, portfolios or groups by choosing it from the field and clicking the + button: the selection is listed below the field, and you can add other selections to the listing. You can delete a customer, portfolio or group listed below the field with the - button. You can create a report with the following selections:

title: Report generation parameters
body: Choosing one or more portfolios (if a portfolio is chosen on the Overview, this portfolio is the default selection for the report)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Choosing one or more contacts (if a contact is chosen on the Overview, this contact is the default selection for the report)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Choosing one or more groups

title: Report generation parameters
body: Choosing #All, when the chosen report is created for all portfolios in the system

title: Report generation parameters
body: Date

title: Report generation parameters
body: The Report date or Date period (see also Selecting dates). Depending on the nature of the report and the data shown on the report, you need to either select a single date, a date range or no date at all. For example, reports showing positions or allocation naturally show data for a single date, whereas reports showing transactions or a history of figures naturally react to a date range.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Note that if you combine individual reports or create report package, the report date (or the end date of the period) is the same for all reports. If you enter different dates or date ranges, the system picks up the last one you entered and applies it to all reports. To have individual reports generated for different dates, you should save them as different packages and then combine as a report package.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Purchase value)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Original purchase price and Transaction purchase price. The selection tells whether the reports always show the transaction purchase price, or whether the reports show the original purchase price of transactions that original transaction information is defined to. The default selection of the purchase price used can be set in Preferences - Transactions.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Securities)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Security, if you want to create a report based on only one security

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Grouping)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Grouping of your report's content from alternatives Security type, Security, Class 1 - 5, Country, Market place, Currency, Counter, Issuer, Asset class or Asset type (available for older reports), or from alternatives Portfolio, All portfolios, Portfolio type, Portfolio's country, Portfolio's juridical form, Portfolio's contact, Security, Position, Linked security, Type, Subtype, Basetype, Class 1 - 5, Country, Currency, Marketplace, Settlementplace, Tag, Issuer, Asset class, Asset type, Assets and liabilities and Assets and accounts by category.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Allocation group)

title: Report generation parameters
body: If you have selected a grouping that involves asset classes or asset types, select also the allocation group (defined in Preferences) you want to use.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Transaction types)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Transaction types to be printed out on the created report from the alternatives, which are defined in Preferences - Transaction types. You can choose multiple transaction types from the list by holding the Ctrl key and choosing the needed transaction types.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Reference, Counter)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Reference or counter.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Tags)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Transaction tags to limit the transactions included in the report.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Security type)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Security types to be printed out on the created report from the alternatives, which are defined in Preferences - Security types. You can choose multiple security types from the list by holding the Ctrl key and choosing the needed security types.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Language

title: Report generation parameters
body: language of the report: Customer/Portfolio language, Svenska, Suomi or English. The languages available are defined in Preferences - Language. The default selection is the Language of portfolio/customer, when the language of the report will be the language set for the portfolio in the Basic info of the Portfolio window. In order to being able to print reports in different languages, you would need to define appropriate translations for security types, transaction types, etc. thorough Preferences - General - Internationalization.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Print reports even if empty)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Print out report(s) even if they would be empty, e.g. the report has no content. If checked, report will always be printed out, even if it has no content. If not checked, when creating only one report, the report is not opened if it is empty, and when creating multiple reports (either per portfolio or per customer), empty reports are not created into the specified folder.

title: Report generation parameters
body: File format

title: Report generation parameters
body: File format of the report to be created: PDF, XLS, XLSX, CSV, TXT, DOCX, PPTX, RTF, XML, XHTML.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Output type

title: Report generation parameters
body: Output type of the report.

title: Report generation parameters
body: One report - Prints out one combined report for the selection of the Customer, Group, Portfolio selection, if possible. The generated report ones up on the screen after the report generation is finished.

title: Report generation parameters
body: One report (background) - Similar to the One report option, but the report is run in the background (a good choice when generating large reports or reports requiring heavy calculations - when the report is run in the background, the FA Portfolio can be used while the report is generating). The report can be found in the Generated reports tab.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per customer or Report per portfolio - Prints out a report (or combination of reports is multiple reports are chosen) for each customer or each portfolio chosen in Customer, Group, Portfolio. The individual reports can be found in the Generated reports tab.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per customer via email or Report per portfolio via email - See sending reports via email for more details.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per customer to documents, Report per portfolio to documents or Report per trade order to documents - See publishing reports to documents for more details.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per customer (list emails below) - Report is sent to a list of email addresses you provide instead of emails linked to the contact.

title: Report generation parameters
body: Report per portfolio (list emails below) - Report is sent to a list of email addresses you provide instead of emails linked to the portfolio.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Emails (comma-separated))

title: Report generation parameters
body: List of customer email addresses (comma-separated) to which the report is sent. The report is sent to these emails instead of emails linked to the contact or portfolio. If you don't define any emails, the report is generated but not sent. If some emails have errors, you can see an error in the Email(s) column of the report summary (see Status report from report generation).

title: Report generation parameters
body: The field is visible only if you chose the output type Report per customer (list emails below) or Report per portfolio (list emails below).

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Folder name)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Name for the folder for the created reports. All characters except for special charaters, such as "+", "%", "*", and so on, are allowed. The reports are saved to a folder with the defined name, and can be downloaded from the Generated reports tab. Folder name you define here is extended with a time stamp when the folder was created (following the syntax Folder-yyyyMMdd-hhmmss), ensuring that even if you use the same folder name, reports within one generation always go to a unique folder (available from FA 3.11 onward).

title: Report generation parameters
body: The field is visible only if you chose the output type other than One report.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Email template)

title: Report generation parameters
body: Select the email template you want to use. This field is visible only if the output type is Report via email, and it pre-fills the template used when sending reports via email.(Available from FA 3.11 onward).

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Transaction tags)

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Available if you run reports from the Transactions view). Single select transaction tags to assign to the transactions after they are reported, for example, "Reporting - Confirmation sent". You can use this option to filter out reported transactions in the Transactions view and exclude them from future reports.

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Trade order tags)

title: Report generation parameters
body: (Available if you run reports from the Trade orders view). Single select trade order tags to assign to the trade orders after they are reported, for example, "Reporting - Confirmation sent". You can use this option to filter out reported trade orders in the Trade orders view and exclude them from future reports.

title: Report generation parameters
body: After filling in the report parameters, you can click the Generate report button. Depending on your selections, the report is downloaded to your computer or saved in a folder and you can view it in the Generated reports tab. Note that if you selected Reports via email as the output type, you need to fill in the fields for email reporting in the new window that opens.

title: Report generation parameters
body: The combination of the selected group, customer and portfolio together with the selected output type allows you to efficiently create different kinds of reports. For example, selecting a group in the group, customer and portfolio field and defining the output type to be either report per portfolio or report per customer generates separate reports per each portfolio/customer within the group. You don't need to create the same report for each portfolio/customer separately, but you can generate these at once and fetch the individual reports from the Generated reports tab after the reports have been created. Additionally, if selecting a group in the group, customer and portfolio field and defining the output type to be one report, you get one aggregated report of the contents of the portfolios within the group.

title: Combined report
body: You can combine multiple different reports for the same date in a single PDF file. Individual reports are placed on separate pages within the file.

title: Combined report
body: To generate a combined report, multi-select reports from the report list in the order you want them to appear in your combined report - the order is also indicated at the bottom of the Report window.

title: Report packages
body: You can save your combined report and the report generation parameters for later use as a report package. You can make the report package visible only to yourself or choose to share the report package with other FA users.

title: Report packages
body: To save selected reports as a report package:

title: Report packages
body: Open the report window and multi-select reports as a combined report. Essentially, saving a report package means saving a combined report for later use.

title: Report packages
body: Define the report generation parameters on the right. Note that you can only select one date range or date for all the reports included in the package.

title: Report packages
body: Once you are happy with the content and order of your combined report, click Save as a new report package.

title: Report packages
body: Define a name for your report package - this name will be used in the file name of the generated report (define the report file naming syntax in Reporting Preferences), and to list the report in the report package listing.

title: Report packages
body: Decide which users you want to share the report package with, i.e. which users can see and use the report package in the Report window:

title: Report packages
body: Not shared – The package is saved only for you to use.

title: Report packages
body: Shared with everyone – The package is available for everyone to use.

title: Report packages
body: Shared with group xx – The package is available for the users in a specific user group. The list of groups includes user roles assigned in the FA Admin Console app (for details, see User details pane).

title: Report packages
body: Shared with role xx – The package is available for the users with a user role defined on the system level.

title: Report packages
body: To use a saved report package:

title: Report packages
body: Open the Report window.

title: Report packages
body: The Report window opened from the Portfolios and Contacts views, and from the New → New report menu features all report packages you created before.

title: Report packages
body: The Report window opened from the Transactions or Trade orders view features only report packages that include at least one transaction or trade order report.

title: Report packages
body: Select the report package at the bottom of the Report window. You can see the reports within the package in the combined report section, and the report generation parameters are shown on the right.

title: Report packages
body: If your selected report package contains a report that is no longer available (the report has been uninstalled after you have saved your report package), you'll get a confirmation to generate the report package anyway without the unavailable report(s).

title: Report packages
body: If needed, edit the report generation parameters on the right.

title: Report packages
body: Click Generate report.

title: Report packages
body: To delete a report package, select it from the list and click the trash can icon . This will not delete the reports within the package, but just remove the report package from the list. To modify your report package, make changes in the selected reports or the parameters and click Update report package.

title: Report packages
body: If you have a report package selected, you can't select reports since the report listing shows you the content of your report package - Unselect the report package to use the Report window manually again.

title: Generated reports
body: The Generated reports tab shows the generated reports. The reports are visible on the tab sheet when multiple reports or reports on background are generated: one report created opens up on directly, but multiple reports are stored on the server, where they can be downloaded to be viewed on your computer.

title: Generated reports
body: The reports are saved in folders, which are named based on the information given on the previous tab sheet. The folders can be seen at the top of the window, in the Folders area: you can download a folder to your computer, or you can view the reports saved inside this folder by clicking it from the folder listing. The reports within the chosen folder appear at the bottom of the window, in the Reports area.

title: Generated reports
body: The following functions are available through right-clicking the folder or report

title: Generated reports
body: Open

title: Generated reports
body: Opens and downloads the chosen folder as a zip package or an individual report (a folder or report can also be opened by double-clicking it).

title: Generated reports
body: Delete

title: Generated reports
body: Deletes the chosen folder or individual report.

title: Generated reports
body: The following buttons are available:

title: Generated reports
body: Delete reports

title: Generated reports
body: Deletes the chosen folder with all the reports in it.

title: Generated reports
body: Download reports (ZIP) (WIN)

title: Generated reports
body: Downloads the chosen folder as a zip folder, if there are multiple reports in the folder, or as a single file, if the folder only includes a single report. Use this button when you are using Windows operating system / Windows computer.

title: Generated reports
body: Download reports (ZIP) (OS)

title: Generated reports
body: Downloads the chosen folder as a zip folder, if there are multiple reports in the folder, or as a single file, if the folder only includes a single report. Use this button when you are using OS operating system / Mac computer.

title: Generated reports
body: Download reports (PDF)

title: Generated reports
body: Downloads all the reports in the chosen folder as one pdf file.

title: Status report from report generation
body: Whenever the system generates reports in the background and saves them under the Generated reports tab, the system produces a status report out of the generation. The status report is saved along with the report files into the same folder under the Generated reports tab - you can find it among the report files with the name Report_summary.csv. (Available from FA 3.11 onward)

title: Status report from report generation
body: The status report provides you with details on which reports were generated successfully and which reports failed, allowing you to more easily follow up and get a grasp of the status of your reporting. In addition to the success or failure of each report, the status report includes relevant information on which group, customer or portfolio the report was generated to, for which dates and with what file type. In addition, if you were sending reports via email, the email address the report was sent to is included in the status report. This allows you to easily replicate a generation, for example if a couple of reports failed to be generated while most of your reports were generated successfully.

title: Ongoing generations
body: The Ongoing generations tab sheet shows the ongoing report generations: if the report generation includes multiple reports, the progress of the generation is shown on this tab sheet. The report generation can also be cancelled on this tab sheet.

title: Log tab
body: The Log tab sheet shows the report generations performed and the history of email reporting: the tab sheet shows the date and time, when a report was created, as well as a description of the report generating activity.

title: Log tab
body: The following buttons are available:

title: Log tab
body: Clear

title: Log tab
body: Clears the log listing

title: Log tab
body: Refresh

title: Log tab
body: Refreshes the listing to show the latest actions.

title: Scheduled report generations
body: Scheduled report generations tab lists all the report packages that have been scheduled to be generated automatically by the system. The tab lists all report packages with a schedule defined for them (ordered by next upcoming generation), shows each packages' next scheduled generation, and allows you to remove or edit any given schedule directly through the tab. (Available from FA 3.11 onward)

title: Related links
body: Reporting in FA User guide

title: Task management
body: Tasks view allows you to manage, monitor and control your tasks in FA: Tasks view provides you with tools to manage different kinds of tasks that are scheduled to be done or have already been done.

title: Selecting shown tasks
body: Selecting shown tasks

title: Selecting shown tasks
body: Tasks view consists of two task listings, allowing you to flexibly decide which task lists you want to view.

title: Selecting shown tasks
body: First, select the task list you want to view from the task list options.

title: Selecting shown tasks
body: In addition, you can filter the task list to easily find the task you are looking for. You can also choose to Hide overdue tasks, or tasks with a due date earlier than today, in order to only see upcoming tasks.

title: Selecting shown tasks
body: Finally, you can Limit shown tasks to 100, 1 000, 10 000 or 100 000 to only see the defined number of newest tasks within the selected task list, or choose No limit to be able to view all available tasks.

title: Selecting shown tasks
body: Your selection of the task listings, filtering, and other selections you make are remembered for the next time you log in - the tasks lists are opened with the content you were using the previous time.

title: Viewing tasks
body: Viewing tasks

title: Viewing tasks
body: The task with the task listings are shown in date order to show the most relevant task first: open tasks show the next upcoming task first, and completed tasks show the latest completed task first.

title: Viewing tasks
body: The individual tasks are listed with the title defined for the task, with a task icon corresponding with the type defined for the task. Underneath the title, the description of the task is shown together with the linked customer(s), the priority of the task and a date. For open tasks, the date shows the due date, and for completed tasks, the complete date of the task is shown. The date also determines, which icon is shown to remind about the date in the after the descriptions. Finally, the assignee of the task is shown at the end.

title: Viewing tasks
body: Clicking a task opens the selected task as a new tab on the Tasks view, and allows you to modify, schedule or assign the task or mark the task as done when completed. Similarly, clicking a linked customer from the task list opens the customer information as a new tab on the Tasks view.

title: Viewing tasks
body: At the bottom of the task list, the button Search customers searches for the customers linked to the visible tasks and shows the search result as a list of customers on the Customers view (available if permission to use the Customers view).

title: Viewing tasks
body: You can create new tasks either from the the Tasks view, Customers view, or Dashboard's tasks widget through selecting the type of the task to be created from the New... button, or tasks can be created by different processes defined for you in FA.

title: Task list options
body: Task list options

title: Task list options
body: You can select to view either your own, your team's or all open or completed tasks with the following options:

title: Task list options
body: The selections can be chosen as above, or they can be chosen per certain time period. Times can either define the due dates of open tasks or the dates tasks were completed.

title: Tasks view
body: Tasks view allows you to manage, monitor and control your tasks in FA: Tasks view provides you with tools to manage different kinds of tasks that are scheduled to be done or have already been done.

title: Selecting tasks to display
body: Selecting tasks to display

title: Selecting tasks to display
body: Tasks view consists of two task listings, allowing you to decide which task lists you want to view.

title: Selecting tasks to display
body: First, select the task list you want to view from the task list options.

title: Selecting tasks to display
body: In addition, you can filter the task list to easily find the task you are looking for. You can also choose to Hide overdue tasks, or tasks with a due date earlier than today, in order to only see upcoming tasks.

title: Selecting tasks to display
body: Finally, you can Limit shown tasks to 100, 1 000, 10 000 or 100 000 to only see the defined number of newest tasks within the selected task list, or choose No limit to be able to view all available tasks.

title: Selecting tasks to display
body: Your selection of the task listings, filtering, and other selections you make are remembered for the next time you log in - the tasks lists are opened with the content you were using the previous time.

title: Viewing tasks
body: Viewing tasks

title: Viewing tasks
body: The task with the task listings are shown in date order to show the most relevant task first: open tasks show the next upcoming task first, and completed tasks show the latest completed task first.

title: Viewing tasks
body: The individual tasks are listed with the title defined for the task, with a task icon corresponding with the type defined for the task. Underneath the title, the description of the task is shown together with the linked customer(s), the priority of the task and a date. For open tasks, the date shows the due date, and for completed tasks, the complete date of the task is shown. The date also determines, which icon is shown to remind about the date in the after the descriptions. Finally, the assignee of the task is shown at the end.

title: Viewing tasks
body: Clicking a task opens the selected task as a new tab on the Tasks view, and allows you to modify, schedule or assign the task or mark the task as done when completed. Similarly, clicking a linked customer from the task list opens the customer information as a new tab on the Tasks view.

title: Viewing tasks
body: At the bottom of the task list, the button Search customers searches for the customers linked to the visible tasks and shows the search result as a list of customers on the Customers view (available if permission to use the Customers view).

title: Viewing tasks
body: You can create new tasks either from the the Tasks view, Customers view, or Dashboard's tasks widget through selecting the type of the task to be created from the New... button, or tasks can be created by different processes defined for you in FA.

title: Task list options
body: You can select to view either your own, your team's or all open or completed tasks with the following options:

title: Task list options
body: The selections can be chosen as above, or they can be chosen per certain time period. Times can either define the due dates of open tasks or the dates tasks were completed.

title: Task window
body: Tasks window allows you to either manually create and modify a task, or manage different process tasks. You can manually create a new task from the the Tasks view, Customers view, or Dashboard's tasks widget. In addition, tasks can be created by different processes defined for you in FA.

title: Manual tasks
body: Manual tasks

title: Manual tasks
body: In order to create a task manually, click the New... button next to the filter field under your task list header and select the type of the task you want to create. The task is then defined in the new task window.

title: Manual tasks
body: The fields available are:

title: Manual tasks
body: Title

title: Manual tasks
body: Define a title for the task. The task will be shown with it's defined title in the tasks lists both on the Tasks and Customers views. It is also possible to define default titles to be used for tasks through the Task type preferences.

title: Manual tasks
body: Assignee

title: Manual tasks
body: Choose an assignee for the task. The assignee field will determine to whom the task is assigned, and will then affect in which sections the task is shown on the Tasks view and for which user names (e.g. My tasks, Tasks assigned to me, My completed tasks).

title: Manual tasks
body: Owner

title: Manual tasks
body: Choose the owner of the task. The owner field will determine the creator of the task, and will show the task in the owner's Tasks created by me list on the Tasks view.

title: Manual tasks
body: Both the assignee and owner fields contain a list of active FA users, e.g. users and user names that are created as FA users and have the right to log in and use FA. The FA users are identified with their name together with their user name in parentheses. For both fields, your user name is suggested as a default. You can also leave either of the fields empty. If limited visibility or extended limited visibility is enabled, both the assignee and owner fields only list users who have the same role than the logged-in user.

title: Manual tasks
body: Creation date

title: Manual tasks
body: Shows the date and time the task was created.

title: Manual tasks
body: Due date

title: Manual tasks
body: Define the due date (for open tasks) or completed date (for done tasks), either by writing it to the field or using the calendar icon to choose the date. The selections will determine with what date the task is shown on the Tasks view task listing.

title: Manual tasks
body: Duration

title: Manual tasks
body: Define a duration for your task in hours and minutes as hh:mm. Duration allows you to define the length of your task, and is useful for meetings, events and other tasks that associate with how long they take in addition to when they occur.

title: Manual tasks
body: Reference

title: Manual tasks
body: Define a unique reference for your task. This allows you to define an ID for your task - reference is useful especially when synchronizing tasks from one system to another, allowing you to easily identify tasks from each other.

title: Manual tasks
body: Linked to

title: Manual tasks
body: This field allows you to link the task to one or multiple contacts saved in FA. When linking a task to for example a customer, the task will be shown in the tasks sections of the Customers view for the linked customer. If you wish to link a task to contacts, enable the contact field if not yet enabled.

title: Manual tasks
body: Priority

title: Manual tasks
body: Choose a priority for the task from Very low, Low, Normal, High or Very high. The priority allows you to prioritize your tasks, and you can also filter tasks based on their priority.

title: Manual tasks
body: Task type

title: Manual tasks
body: The type of the task (defined in the Task type preferences). Selecting the type allows you to categorize your tasks, and the visually distinguish between different types of tasks on the tasks listing. The type of the task is selected when creating the task.

title: Manual tasks
body: Done

title: Manual tasks
body: Check the Done box in order to mark a task as completed.

title: Manual tasks
body: Description

title: Manual tasks
body: Write a more detailed description for the task if necessary.

title: Manual tasks
body: Attachments

title: Manual tasks
body: In addition, you can also attach files to the task as an addition to your description. Choose a file and upload the file to attach it to the task. For example, you can attach a transaction file to be imported, instructions for how to send out monthly reports, or any other material you want to include in your task.

title: Manual tasks
body: There are various buttons available at the bottom of the task window

title: Manual tasks
body: Complete without modifying date

title: Manual tasks
body: Marks the task as "Done" with the date defined in "When", i.e. completes the task with the originally defined date as the complete date.

title: Manual tasks
body: Complete now

title: Manual tasks
body: Marks the task as "Done" and modifies the complete date to be current date and time, i.e. completes the task now.

title: Manual tasks
body: Save

title: Manual tasks
body: Saves the changes made to the task.

title: Process tasks
body: Process tasks

title: Process tasks
body: In addition to being able to create tasks manually, tasks can be created to the tasks lists by different custom processes defined for you in FA. Whereas the manually created tasks follow the above layout, the content of the tasks created through a custom process are also customized.

title: Process tasks
body: The process-related tasks support defining which user roles have rights to modify, accept of delete a task. A user has rights for a process-related task if (s)he is the assignee of the task or (s)he has a role defined that is specified as a candidate role for the task within the process definition that created the task. A user can modify the values in the task or click Done or Delete buttons in the task window ONLY IF the user has rights for the task. If a user doesn't have rights for the task, buttons are greyed out and modified values are not saved.

title: Process tasks
body: Depending on how the process and process-related task has been defined, the following components might be available.

title: Process tasks
body: Process-related tasks can contain / support attachments. Only users that have rights for the process-related task can add or modify attachments of the task.

title: Process tasks
body: Attachments

title: Process tasks
body: Process-related tasks can contain attachments, or you can attach files to the task yourself. Download / edit / delete the attachments through the corresponding icons, or choose and upload the file to attach it to the task.

title: Process tasks
body: Process-related tasks can support defining details to the task. Only users that have rights for the process-related task can modify the details of the task.

title: Process tasks
body: Assignee

title: Process tasks
body: Choose an assignee for the task. The assignee list shows only users that have rights for the process-related task. If limited visibility or extended limited visibility is enabled, the assignee field only list users who have the same role than the logged-in user.

title: Process tasks
body: Priority

title: Process tasks
body: Choose a priority for the task from Very low, Low, Normal, High or Very high.

title: Process tasks
body: When

title: Process tasks
body: Define the due date for the task, either by writing it to the field or using the calendar icon to choose the date.

title: Process tasks
body: Depending on the type of the process, there are different buttons available at the bottom of the task window:

title: Process tasks
body: Done

title: Process tasks
body: Marks the current process-related task as done and removes it from open tasks. User can click Done only if the user has rights for the task.

title: Process tasks
body: Continue later

title: Process tasks
body: Returns the process-related task back to open tasks and saves the filled in information. Filled in data is saved with the Continue later button only if the user has rights for the task.

title: Process tasks
body: Delete

title: Process tasks
body: If available, deletes the task and the running process that created the task. Deleting a running process task is confirmed with a pop up. User can click Delete only if the user has rights for the task.

title: Process tasks
body: Cancel

title: Process tasks
body: If available, cancels the started task.

title: Customers view
body: The Customers view allows you to efficiently manage your customers and information related to them all at once - the Customers view is structured to allow you to access all relevant customer information easily from a single view. The Customer's view has been designed for CRM purposes and is especially useful for employees with customer responsibility: the view gathers all relevant information and allows you to view and edit anything related to your customers or your leads, prospects, and potential customers.

title: Customers view
body: Customer's view is an add-on to FA - if you are interested, please contact FA for more details.

title: Searching for customers
body: The main page of the Customers view allows you to search for customers, and to save your frequently used searches as new tabs - for example, you can save all potential customers as their own tab. Customers view supports searching for customers of the type "Customer" or "Lead". Double-clicking a customer from the search result opens the customer information as a new tab. You can have multiple customers open at the same time - just browse through the the tabs to see information to view each customer.

title: Searching for customers
body: The main page of the Customers view by default shows your own customers, in addition to which there is a possibility to search for your own customers with the My customers button. Customers view also supports Limited visibility, or only allowing your users to view certain customers.

title: Searching for customers
body: In order to utilize own customers, first create a contact for yourself in FA. Link the contact directly your user through the Linked contact field within the user information in User management.

title: Searching for customers
body: With this set up, your own customers will show:

title: Searching for customers
body: The contacts you are a representative of.

title: Searching for customers
body: The contacts of the portfolios you are an asset manager of.

title: Searching for customers
body: The contact for you (e.g. the contact linked to the user.

title: Mass-generating tasks
body: The main page of the Customers view also allows you mass generate tasks related to the customers you have searched on the view. This functionality allows you to easily create multiple, similar tasks linked to separate customers at once - all you need to do is to fill in the task information once, and a task with the same information is created to multiple customers.

title: Mass-generating tasks
body: In order to mass generate tasks, first search for the customers you want to generate tasks to. Second, create a task for all the searched customers you have visible on the screen with the Create tasks button at the bottom right hand corner of the screen. Fill in the task information: when you save or complete the task, the system will create one individual task with the filled in information per customer you had searched on the Customers view. For example, if you have searched seven customers on the Customers view, clicked Create tasks, and defined a task, after clicking Save or Complete for the task, you would end up with seven separate tasks with the same content, each separate task linked to one of the searched customers.

title: Customer information page
body: The customer page, opened as a new tab with the customer's name, allows you to view all relevant customer information in one glance.

title: Customer information page
body: The page consists of six parts:

title: Customer information page
body: Basic info shows relevant basic information of the customer, such as name, ID, address information and tags. Editing the customer's information in the Contact window is easy through the edit icon. In addition, basic information section shows the representatives of the selected customer as well as other customers the selected customer represents. Clicking one of the representatives or represents opens their information as a new tab on the view, providing you easy access to related customers.

title: Customer information page
body: Memo shows the information you have defined in the customer's memo. Single-click the memo to edit the contents of the memo, or double-click the memo to open it in the Contact window for editing. Memo is mainly targeted to storing static information related to the customer.

title: Customer information page
body: Processes section shows the customer-related processes defined for you, and you can run a process to the selected customer directly from the Customers view with a click of a button.

title: Customer information page
body: Tasks shows all open tasks linked to the selected customer. The tasks section on the Customers view allows you to save and keep track of every discussion and other form of interaction you have had with the customer, as regulated within the financial industry. You can record every meeting, phone call, email or other event related to the customer as a new task, describe what was discussed, and add attachments to complement the description. You can also link multiple customers to a single task, which brings up the task in every linked customer's tasks list.

title: Customer information page
body: Completed tasks shows all completed tasks linked to the selected customer. The completed tasks provides you with an overview of the interaction you or someone from your company has had with the customer. Filter the list to find a specific task, and double-click a single task to see comments and attachments linked to it.

title: Customer information page
body: Documents section allows you to manage the documents added to the selected customer: you can view, download and delete any of the documents, and you can add new documents related to the selected customer. If you want also to see the documents in the customer's portfolios or customer's portfolio's transactions, just enable the tree structure through the top-right corner of the section.

title: Customer information page
body: The Overview bar at the bottom opens the Overview for the selected customer.

title: Trade order management
body: Trade order management in FA User guide

title: Trade order management
body: Trade order management settings in FA Admin guide

title: Trade orders view
body: Trade orders view allows you to search and manage trade orders saved in the system. You can either perform a completely new trade order search or utilize the trade order searches saved earlier. Trade orders view also allows you to Export data as XLS or PDF or generate a report from the search view.

title: Searching for trade orders
body: Trade orders view allows you to search for trade orders in different ways. You can:

title: Searching for trade orders
body: Quick search by typing in your search criteria into the available field

title: Searching for trade orders
body: Click "Show all" and search through filtering

title: Searching for trade orders
body: "Show extended search" and define your search criteria in the available fields

title: Searching for trade orders
body: Access one of the saved search tabs to do a pre-defined search

title: Searching for trade orders
body: The trade orders found are listed in the table. You can change the order by clicking on one of the column headers: the arrow next to the column header indicates that the trade orders are ordered based on the values in that column. The search result is divided into columns, and you can choose which columns you want to use from the the upper-right corner of the screen. For more details, see Available columns for transaction listings.

title: Searching for trade orders
body: You can also save the search for later use as a new tab sheet on the Trade orders view. Saving the search saves the search criteria, and the search with the search criteria is conducted again every time the saved search is opened.

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Double-clicking a trade order from the search result opens the trade order information in the Trade order window for viewing and editing.

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: In addition, the following functions are available through right-clicking a trade order:

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Modify trade order

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Opens the chosen trade order in the Trade order window, where you can view and modify the trade order. You can also open the trade order by double clicking it. You can only modify Open and Accepted trade orders - for other trade orders, modifying allows you to view their information.

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Open linked transactions

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Opens the transaction created based on the trade order (when trade order has been executed) in the Transaction window, where the transaction can be viewed and modified.

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Delete trade order

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Deletes the trade order. Only trade orders with the status Open or Accepted can be deleted - if you want to delete other trade orders, change them to be open first.

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Create payment transaction

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Opens the Transaction window allowing you to create a cash transaction corresponding to the trade order's trade amount. This allows you to separately handle the cash transaction related to the trade order, or for example to create a corresponding cash transaction into the counter portfolio of the trade.

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Execute trade order

title: Actions and processes against a single trade order
body: Opens the Transaction window allowing you to execute the trade order and create a transaction to the portfolio based on the trade order information. You can only execute trade orders with the status Executable, Sent to execution, In execution, Executed in the market or Settled in the market.

title: Actions and processes against multiple trade orders
body: You can perform different actions and processes against the trade orders searched on the Trade orders view. These actions and processes are shown on the bottom of the Trade orders view as buttons. These processes are always started against a trade order search: the processes affect the trade orders searched on the view.

title: Actions and processes against multiple trade orders
body: By default, the Trade orders view allows you to initiate the following features against the searched trade orders:

title: Actions and processes against multiple trade orders
body: Modify trade orders

title: Actions and processes against multiple trade orders
body: Allows you to change the status of multiple trade orders at once or to mass-delete trade orders. Even though you cannot change the status of individual trade orders through the Trade order window unless your trade order's status is Open or Accepted, this feature allows you to modify the status of any of your trade orders - if you want to for example make modifications to already Executable trade orders, first change their status to be Open through the Modify trade orders process to enable modification. When changing the status of an Executed trade order to be Open through the modification process, the system also deletes the transactions linked to the trade order in addition to changing the status from Executed to Open.

title: Actions and processes against multiple trade orders
body: Import trade orders (Excel)

title: Actions and processes against multiple trade orders
body: Allows you to execute trade orders with an Excel file. For more information, see Confirm trade orders (Excel).

title: Actions and processes against multiple trade orders
body: Trade order execution

title: Actions and processes against multiple trade orders
body: Starts a process for you to execute your trade orders. For more information, see Trade order execution.

title: Actions and processes against multiple trade orders
body: In addition, processes configured against "tradeorders" are visible at the bottom of the Trade orders view.

title: Trade order window
body: Trade order window allows you to define a new trade order or to view and modify the information of existing trade orders.

title: Trade order window
body: You can open the Trade order window from any of the trade order listings available in FA: in addition to searching for trade orders in the Trade orders view, non-executed trade orders are also visible in the Transaction listing on the Overview, marked with a *. You can open the trade order information in the trade order window by double-clicking the trade order or by right-clicking the trade order and choosing Modify. When creating a new trade order, first you have to choose the type of the security you are creating the trade order to, which affects the fields available in the window.

title: Trade order information
body: Trade order information

title: Trade order information
